original: tvare cāham anenādya yad idaṃ me cikīrṣitam
analyzed: tvare ca aham anena adya yat idam me cikīrṣitam
translated: And hasten to do what I intend today.

original: tasya me tvaramāṇasya kuto nidrā kutaḥ sukham
analyzed: tasya me tvaramāṇasya kutas nidrā kutas sukham
translated: How can I sleep or be happy when I am in such a hurry?

original: na sa jātaḥ pumāṃl loke kaś cin na ca bhaviṣyati
analyzed: na sa jātaḥ pumān loke kaḥ cit na ca bhaviṣyati
translated: There has never been born, nor will there ever be born,

original: yo me vyāvartayed etāṃ vadhe teṣāṃ kṛtāṃ matim
analyzed: yaḥ me vyāvartayet etām vadhe teṣām kṛtām matim
translated: A man in this world who can dissuade me from my resolve to kill them.

original: saṃjaya uvāca
analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca
translated: Sanjaya said:

original: evam uktvā mahārāja droṇaputraḥ pratāpavān
analyzed: evam uktvā mahā rāja droṇaputraḥ pratāpavān
translated: Having said this, O great king, the powerful son of Drona

original: ekānte yojayitvāśvān prāyād abhimukhaḥ parān
analyzed: ekānte yojayitvā aśvān prāyāt abhimukhaḥ parān
translated: Yoked his horses to one side and advanced towards the enemy.

original: tam abrūtāṃ mahātmānau bhojaśāradvatāv ubhau
analyzed: tam abrūtām mahātmānau bhoja śāradvatau ubhau
translated: The two great souls, Bhoja and Sharadvata, said to him:

original: kim ayaṃ syandano yuktaḥ kiṃ ca kāryaṃ cikīrṣitam🔽ekasārthaṃ prayātau svas tvayā saha nararṣabha
analyzed: kim ayam syandanaḥ yuktaḥ kim ca kāryam cikīrṣitam  eka sārtham prayātau svaḥ tvayā saha nara ṛṣabha
translated: To what purpose is this chariot harnessed? What task do you wish to accomplish?🔽We are going together with you, O best of men, on the same journey.

original: samaduḥkhasukhau caiva nāvāṃ śaṅkitum arhasi
analyzed: sama duḥkha sukhau ca eva na āvām śaṅkitum arhasi
translated: You should not suspect us, for we share your sorrows and joys.

original: aśvatthāmā tu saṃkruddhaḥ pitur vadham anusmaran
analyzed: aśvatthāmā tu saṃkruddhaḥ pituḥ vadham anusmaran
translated: But Ashvatthama, remembering the death of his father, was enraged.

original: tābhyāṃ tathyaṃ tadācakhyau yad asyātmacikīrṣitam🔽hatvā śatasahasrāṇi yodhānāṃ niśitaiḥ śaraiḥ
analyzed: tābhyām tathyam tadā ācakhyau yat asya ātma cikīrṣitam  hatvā śata sahasrāṇi yodhānām niśitaiḥ śaraiḥ
translated: He then truthfully told them what he intended to do.🔽My father, having killed hundreds of thousands of warriors with his sharp arrows,

original: nyastaśastro mama pitā dhṛṣṭadyumnena pātitaḥ
analyzed: nyasta śastraḥ mama pitā dhṛṣṭadyumnena pātitaḥ
translated: was felled by Dhrishtadyumna while unarmed.

original: taṃ tathaiva haniṣyāmi nyastavarmāṇam adya vai
analyzed: tam tathā eva haniṣyāmi nyasta varmāṇam adya vai
translated: I will kill him today in the same way, while he is unarmed.

original: putraṃ pāñcālarājasya pāpaṃ pāpena karmaṇā
analyzed: putram pāñcāla rājasya pāpam pāpena karmaṇā
translated: The sinful son of the Panchala king, through sinful deeds,

original: kathaṃ ca nihataḥ pāpaḥ pāñcālaḥ paśuvan mayā
analyzed: katham ca nihataḥ pāpaḥ pāñcālaḥ paśu vat mayā
translated: and how that sinful Panchala was killed by me like an animal?

original: śastrāhavajitāṃ lokān prāpnuyād iti me matiḥ🔽kṣipraṃ saṃnaddhakavacau sakhaḍgāv āttakārmukau
analyzed: śastra āhava jitām lokān prāpnuyāt iti me matiḥ  kṣipram saṃnaddha kavacau sa khaḍgau ātta kārmukau
translated: I think he will attain the worlds obtained by those killed by weapons.🔽Quickly put on your armor, take up your swords and bows,

original: samāsthāya pratīkṣetāṃ rathavaryau paraṃtapau
analyzed: samāsthāya pratīkṣetām ratha varyau paraṃtapau
translated: and mount your excellent chariot. You two scorchers of enemies should wait.

original: ity uktvā ratham āsthāya prāyād abhimukhaḥ parān
analyzed: iti uktvā ratham āsthāya prāyāt abhimukhaḥ parān
translated: Having said this, he mounted his chariot and advanced towards the enemy.

original: tam anvagāt kṛpo rājan kṛtavarmā ca sātvataḥ
analyzed: tam anvagāt kṛpaḥ rājan kṛtavarmā ca sātvataḥ
translated: Kripa and Kritavarman of the Satvata lineage followed him, O king.

original: te prayātā vyarocanta parān abhimukhās trayaḥ
analyzed: te prayātāḥ vyarocanta parān abhimukhāḥ trayaḥ
translated: Those three, as they advanced facing the enemy, shone forth,

original: hūyamānā yathā yajñe samiddhā havyavāhanāḥ
analyzed: hūyamānāḥ yathā yajñe samiddhāḥ havya vāhanāḥ
translated: like the well-kindled sacrificial fires to which oblations are offered.

original: yayuś ca śibiraṃ teṣāṃ saṃprasuptajanaṃ vibho
analyzed: yayuḥ ca śibiram teṣām saṃprasupta janam vibho
translated: And they went to their camp, where all the people were asleep, O lord.

original: dvāradeśaṃ tu saṃprāpya drauṇis tasthau rathottame
analyzed: dvāra deśam tu saṃprāpya drauṇiḥ tasthau ratha uttame
translated: But Drona's son stood at the gate on his excellent chariot.

original: saṃjaya uvāca
analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca
translated: Sanjaya said:

original: tatas tau saṃvidaṃ kṛtvā vāsudevavṛṣadhvajau
analyzed: tatas tau saṃvidam kṛtvā vāsudeva vṛṣadhvajau
translated: Then Vasudeva and the bull among the Kurus made an agreement.

original: niścitau tu vadhe teṣāṃ pāñcālānāṃ mahāvratau
analyzed: niścitau tu vadhe teṣām pāñcālānām mahā vratau
translated: Those two, firm in their great vow, were determined to kill the Panchalas.

original: tato 'bravīn mahādevaṃ kṛṣṇam akliṣṭakāriṇam
analyzed: tatas bravīt mahādevam kṛṣṇam akliṣṭa kāriṇam
translated: Then he spoke to Krishna, the great god who performs without effort,

original: yogamūrtidharo bhūtvā praviśyābhyantaraṃ manaḥ
analyzed: yoga mūrti dharaḥ bhūtvā praviśya abhyantaram manaḥ
translated: assuming the form of yoga, entering the inner mind,

original: tāvat kāryam idaṃ yuktaṃ sādhayāmy aham añjasā
analyzed: tāvat kāryam idam yuktam sādhayāmi aham añjasā
translated: thinking, I will quickly accomplish this task that needs to be done.

original: evaṃ tu saṃvidaṃ kṛtvā ekamūrtidharau sthitau
analyzed: evam tu saṃvidam kṛtvā eka mūrti dharau sthitau
translated: Having thus made an agreement, they remained in one form.

original: dhṛtarāṣṭra uvāca
analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ uvāca
translated: Dhritarashtra said:

original: dvāradeśe tato drauṇim avasthitam avekṣya tau
analyzed: dvāra deśe tatas drauṇim avasthitam avekṣya tau
translated: Seeing Drona's son standing at the gate,

original: akurvatāṃ bhojakṛpau kiṃ saṃjaya vadasva me
analyzed: akurvatām bhoja kṛpau kim saṃjaya vadasva me
translated: what did Bhoja and Kripa do? Tell me, Sanjaya.

original: saṃjaya uvāca
analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca
translated: Sanjaya said:

original: kṛtavarmāṇam āmantrya kṛpaṃ ca sa mahāratham
analyzed: kṛtavarmāṇam āmantrya kṛpam ca sa mahā ratham
translated: Having taken leave of Kritavarma and the great warrior Kripa,

original: drauṇir manyuparītātmā śibiradvāram āsadat
analyzed: drauṇiḥ manyu parīta ātmā śibira dvāram āsadat
translated: Ashvatthama, his mind filled with anger, went to the gate of the camp.

original: tatra bhūtaṃ mahākāyaṃ candrārkasadṛśadyutim
analyzed: tatra bhūtam mahā kāyam candra arka sadṛśa dyutim
translated: There he saw a huge being, his radiance like the sun and moon,

original: so 'paśyad dvāram āvṛtya tiṣṭhantaṃ lomaharṣaṇam
analyzed: saḥ paśyat dvāram āvṛtya tiṣṭhantam loma harṣaṇam
translated: standing at the gate, causing the hair to stand on end.

original: vasānaṃ carma vaiyāghraṃ mahārudhiravisravam
analyzed: vasānam carma vaiyāghram mahā rudhira visravam
translated: Wearing a tiger skin, with great streams of blood flowing,

original: kṛṣṇājinottarāsaṅgaṃ nāgayajñopavītinam
analyzed: kṛṣṇājina uttarāsaṅgam nāga yajña upavītinam
translated: with a black antelope skin on his upper body, with a snake as his sacred thread,

original: bāhubhiḥ svāyataiḥ pīnair nānāpraharaṇodyataiḥ🔽baddhāṅgadamahāsarpaṃ jvālāmālākulānanam
analyzed: bāhubhiḥ su āyataiḥ pīnaiḥ nānā praharaṇa udyataiḥ  baddha aṅgada mahā sarpam jvālā mālā ākula ānanam
translated: with his long, stout arms raised, holding various weapons,🔽with large serpents bound as armlets, his face ablaze with flames,

original: daṃṣṭrākarālavadanaṃ vyāditāsyaṃ bhayāvaham
analyzed: daṃṣṭra karāla vadanam vyādita āsyam bhaya āvaham
translated: his face terrifying with bared fangs, his mouth gaping, causing fear,

original: nayanānāṃ sahasraiś ca vicitrair abhibhūṣitam
analyzed: nayanānām sahasraiḥ ca vicitraiḥ abhibhūṣitam
translated: adorned with thousands of eyes of various colors,

original: naiva tasya vapuḥ śakyaṃ pravaktuṃ veṣa eva vā
analyzed: na eva tasya vapuḥ śakyam pravaktum veṣaḥ eva vā
translated: his body or dress cannot be described at all,

original: sarvathā tu tad ālakṣya sphuṭeyur api parvatāḥ
analyzed: sarvathā tu tat ālakṣya sphuṭeyuḥ api parvatāḥ
translated: but seeing him in any way, even the mountains would split.

original: tasyāsyān nāsikābhyāṃ ca śravaṇābhyāṃ ca sarvaśaḥ
analyzed: tasya āsyāt nāsikābhyām ca śravaṇābhyām ca sarvaśas
translated: From his mouth, nose, and ears, and from all over,

original: tebhyaś cākṣisahasrebhyaḥ prādurāsan mahārciṣaḥ
analyzed: tebhyaḥ ca akṣi sahasrebhyaḥ prādurāsan mahā arciṣaḥ
translated: and from those thousands of eyes, great flames arose.

original: tathā tejomarīcibhyaḥ śaṅkhacakragadādharāḥ
analyzed: tathā tejaḥ marīcibhyaḥ śaṅkha cakra gadā dharāḥ
translated: And from those rays of fiery light, holders of conch, discus, and club appeared,

original: prādurāsan hṛṣīkeśāḥ śataśo 'tha sahasraśaḥ
analyzed: prādurāsan hṛṣīkeśāḥ sahasraśas
translated: Hundreds and thousands of Hrishikeshas appeared.

original: tad atyadbhutam ālokya bhūtaṃ lokabhayaṃkaram
analyzed: tat ati adbhutam ālokya bhūtam loka bhayaṃkaram
translated: Seeing that extremely wonderful being, terrifying to the world,

original: drauṇir avyathito divyair astravarṣair avākirat
analyzed: drauṇiḥ a vyathitaḥ divyaiḥ astra varṣaiḥ avākirat
translated: Drona's son, unperturbed, covered it with divine showers of weapons.

original: drauṇimuktāñ śarāṃs tāṃs tu tad bhūtaṃ mahad agrasat
analyzed: drauṇim uktām śarān tān tu tat bhūtam mahat agrasat
translated: But that great being swallowed up those arrows released by Drona's son,

original: udadher iva vāryoghān pāvako vaḍavāmukhaḥ🔽agrasat tāṃs tathā bhūtaṃ drauṇinā prahitāñ śarān
analyzed: udadheḥ iva vāri oghān pāvakaḥ vaḍavāmukhaḥ  agrasat tān tathā bhūtam drauṇinā prahitām śarān
translated: Just as the submarine fire swallows up the waters of the ocean.🔽In the same way, that being swallowed up the arrows released by Drona's son.

original: aśvatthāmā tu saṃprekṣya tāñ śaraughān nirarthakān🔽rathaśaktiṃ mumocāsmai dīptām agniśikhām iva
analyzed: aśvatthāmā tu saṃprekṣya tām śara oghān nirarthakān  ratha śaktim mumoca asmai dīptām agni śikhām iva
translated: But Ashvatthama, seeing those showers of arrows to be useless,🔽Hurled a flaming spear at it, like the flame of a fire.

original: sā tadāhatya dīptāgrā rathaśaktir aśīryata
analyzed: sā tadā āhatya dīpta agrā ratha śaktiḥ aśīryata
translated: That flaming spear struck it and shattered,

original: yugānte sūryam āhatya maholkeva divaś cyutā🔽atha hematsaruṃ divyaṃ khaḍgam ākāśavarcasam
analyzed: yuga ante sūryam āhatya mahā ulkā iva divaḥ cyutā  atha hema tsarum divyam khaḍgam ākāśa varcasam
translated: Like a great meteor falling from the sky, striking the sun at the end of the yuga.🔽Then he quickly drew from its sheath a divine sword with a golden hilt, radiant like the sky,

original: kośāt samudbabarhāśu bilād dīptam ivoragam
analyzed: kośāt samudbabarha āśu bilāt dīptam iva uragam
translated: Like a glowing serpent from its hole.

original: tataḥ khaḍgavaraṃ dhīmān bhūtāya prāhiṇot tadā
analyzed: tatas khaḍga varam dhīmān bhūtāya prāhiṇot tadā
translated: Then the wise one hurled that excellent sword at the being.

original: sa tadāsādya bhūtaṃ vai vilayaṃ tūlavad yayau
analyzed: sa tat āsādya bhūtam vai vilayam tūla vat yayau
translated: But it struck that being and was reduced to dust like cotton.

original: tataḥ sa kupito drauṇir indraketunibhāṃ gadām
analyzed: tatas sa kupitaḥ drauṇiḥ indra ketu nibhām gadām
translated: Then Drona's son, enraged, hurled a mace resembling Indra's standard,

original: jvalantīṃ prāhiṇot tasmai bhūtaṃ tām api cāgrasat
analyzed: jvalantīm prāhiṇot tasmai bhūtam tām api ca agrasat
translated: He hurled at him a blazing weapon, but he swallowed that up too.

original: tataḥ sarvāyudhābhāve vīkṣamāṇas tatas tataḥ
analyzed: tatas sarva āyudha abhāve vīkṣamāṇaḥ tatas tatas
translated: Then, in the absence of all weapons, he looked here and there,

original: apaśyat kṛtam ākāśam anākāśaṃ janārdanaiḥ
analyzed: apaśyat kṛtam ākāśam an ākāśam janārdanaiḥ
translated: and saw the sky made non-sky by the Janārdanas.

original: tad adbhutatamaṃ dṛṣṭvā droṇaputro nirāyudhaḥ
analyzed: tat adbhutatamam dṛṣṭvā droṇaputraḥ nirāyudhaḥ
translated: Seeing that most wonderful thing, the son of Droṇa, weaponless,

original: abravīd abhisaṃtaptaḥ kṛpavākyam anusmaran
analyzed: abravīt abhisaṃtaptaḥ kṛpa vākyam anusmaran
translated: spoke, tormented, remembering the words of Kripa:

original: bruvatām apriyaṃ pathyaṃ suhṛdāṃ na śṛṇoti yaḥ
analyzed: bruvatām apriyam pathyam suhṛdām na śṛṇoti yaḥ
translated: He who does not listen to the beneficial but unpleasant words of well-wishers,

original: sa śocaty āpadaṃ prāpya yathāham ativartya tau
analyzed: sa śocati āpadam prāpya yathā aham ativartya tau
translated: he grieves when calamity befalls him, as I do for disregarding those two.

original: śāstradṛṣṭān avadhyān yaḥ samatītya jighāṃsati
analyzed: śāstra dṛṣṭān avadhyān yaḥ samatītya jighāṃsati
translated: He who, disregarding those who should not be killed according to the scriptures, desires to kill them,

original: sa pathaḥ pracyuto dharmyāt kupathaṃ pratipadyate🔽gobrāhmaṇanṛpastrīṣu sakhyur mātur guros tathā🔽vṛddhabālajaḍāndheṣu suptabhītotthiteṣu ca
analyzed: sa pathaḥ pracyutaḥ dharmyāt kupatham pratipadyate  go brāhmaṇa nṛpa strīṣu sakhyuḥ mātuḥ guroḥ tathā  vṛddha bāla jaḍa andheṣu supta bhīta utthiteṣu ca
translated: he falls off the path of righteousness and enters a wrong path.🔽One should not brandish weapons against cows, Brahmins, kings, women, friends, mothers, teachers,🔽the aged, the young, the foolish, the blind, those asleep, those frightened, those standing,

original: mattonmattapramatteṣu na śastrāṇy upadhārayet
analyzed: matta unmatta pramatteṣu na śastrāṇi upadhārayet
translated: those intoxicated, insane, or heedless.

original: ity evaṃ gurubhiḥ pūrvam upadiṣṭaṃ nṛṇāṃ sadā
analyzed: iti evam gurubhiḥ pūrvam upadiṣṭam nṛṇām sadā
translated: This is what the teachers have always taught to men.

original: so 'ham utkramya panthānaṃ śāstradṛṣṭaṃ sanātanam
analyzed: saḥ ham utkramya panthānam śāstra dṛṣṭam sanātanam
translated: I, transgressing the eternal path seen in the scriptures,

original: amārgeṇaivam ārabhya ghorām āpadam āgataḥ
analyzed: amārgeṇa evam ārabhya ghorām āpadam āgataḥ
translated: having begun in this way by a wrong path, have come to a terrible calamity.

original: tāṃ cāpadaṃ ghoratarāṃ pravadanti manīṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: tām ca āpadam ghoratarām pravadanti manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: The wise ones call that calamity the most terrible,

original: yad udyamya mahat kṛtyaṃ bhayād api nivartate
analyzed: yat udyamya mahat kṛtyam bhayāt api nivartate
translated: When, having undertaken a great task, one turns back out of fear.

original: aśakyaṃ caiva kaḥ kartuṃ śaktaḥ śaktibalād iha
analyzed: aśakyam ca eva kaḥ kartum śaktaḥ śakti balāt iha
translated: And who is able to do what is impossible here by the power of strength?

original: na hi daivād garīyo vai mānuṣaṃ karma kathyate
analyzed: na hi daivāt garīyaḥ vai mānuṣam karma kathyate
translated: It is said that human action is more weighty than fate.

original: mānuṣaṃ kurvataḥ karma yadi daivān na sidhyati
analyzed: mānuṣam kurvataḥ karma yadi daivāt na sidhyati
translated: If, while performing human action, it is not accomplished due to fate,

original: sa pathaḥ pracyuto dharmyād vipadaṃ pratipadyate
analyzed: sa pathaḥ pracyutaḥ dharmyāt vipadam pratipadyate
translated: He who has strayed from the path of righteousness encounters misfortune.

original: pratighātaṃ hy avijñātaṃ pravadanti manīṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: pratighātam hi a vijñātam pravadanti manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: For the wise ones speak of an unknown obstruction,

original: yad ārabhya kriyāṃ kāṃ cid bhayād iha nivartate
analyzed: yat ārabhya kriyām kām cit bhayāt iha nivartate
translated: When, having begun some action, one turns back out of fear here.

original: tad idaṃ duṣpraṇītena bhayaṃ māṃ samupasthitam
analyzed: tat idam duṣpraṇītena bhayam mām samupasthitam
translated: This fear has come upon me due to that ill-advised action.

original: na hi droṇasutaḥ saṃkhye nivarteta kathaṃ cana
analyzed: na hi droṇa sutaḥ saṃkhye nivarteta katham cana
translated: For Drona's son would never turn back in battle.

original: idaṃ ca sumahad bhūtaṃ daivadaṇḍam ivodyatam
analyzed: idam ca su mahat bhūtam daiva daṇḍam iva udyatam
translated: And this is a great being, raised up like a punishment from fate.

original: na caitad abhijānāmi cintayann api sarvathā
analyzed: na ca etat abhijānāmi cintayan api sarvathā
translated: And I do not know this at all, even when thinking.

original: dhruvaṃ yeyam adharme me pravṛttā kaluṣā matiḥ
analyzed: dhruvam yā iyam adharme me pravṛttā kaluṣā matiḥ
translated: Surely this defiled mind of mine has turned towards unrighteousness,

original: tasyāḥ phalam idaṃ ghoraṃ pratighātāya dṛśyate
analyzed: tasyāḥ phalam idam ghoram pratighātāya dṛśyate
translated: And the fruit of that is seen as a terrible obstruction.

original: tad idaṃ daivavihitaṃ mama saṃkhye nivartanam
analyzed: tat idam daiva vihitam mama saṃkhye nivartanam
translated: This turning back of mine in battle is ordained by fate.

original: nānyatra daivād udyantum iha śakyaṃ kathaṃ cana
analyzed: na anyatra daivāt udyantum iha śakyam katham cana
translated: Nothing can be undertaken here without destiny.

original: so 'ham adya mahādevaṃ prapadye śaraṇaṃ prabhum
analyzed: saḥ ham adya mahādevam prapadye śaraṇam prabhum
translated: Therefore, I now take refuge in Mahadeva, the powerful lord.

original: daivadaṇḍam imaṃ ghoraṃ sa hi me nāśayiṣyati
analyzed: daiva daṇḍam imam ghoram sa hi me nāśayiṣyati
translated: He will destroy this terrible punishment of destiny for me.

original: kapardinaṃ prapadyātha devadevam umāpatim
analyzed: kapardinam prapadya atha devadevam umāpatim
translated: I take refuge in Kapardin, the god of gods, the lord of Uma,

original: kapālamālinaṃ rudraṃ bhaganetraharaṃ haram
translated: Rudra, the wearer of a garland of skulls, Hara, the destroyer of Bhaga's eyes.

original: sa hi devo 'tyagād devāṃs tapasā vikrameṇa ca
analyzed: sa hi tyagāt devān tapasā vikrameṇa ca
translated: That god surpasses the gods in austerity and prowess.

original: tasmāc charaṇam abhyeṣye giriśaṃ śūlapāṇinam
analyzed: tasmāt śaraṇam abhyeṣye giriśam śūlapāṇinam
translated: Therefore, I shall seek refuge in Girisha, the wielder of the trident.

original: saṃjaya uvāca
analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca
translated: Sanjaya said:

original: sa evaṃ cintayitvā tu droṇaputro viśāṃ pate
analyzed: saḥ evam cintayitvā tu droṇaputraḥ viśām pate
translated: Having thought thus, O lord of the people, Drona's son

original: avatīrya rathopasthād dadhyau saṃprayataḥ sthitaḥ
analyzed: avatīrya rathopasthāt dadhyau saṃprayataḥ sthitaḥ
translated: Descended from the chariot and stood, absorbed in meditation.

original: drauṇir uvāca
analyzed: drauṇiḥ uvāca
translated: Ashvatthama said:

original: ugraṃ sthāṇuṃ śivaṃ rudraṃ śarvam īśānam īśvaram
analyzed: ugram sthāṇum śivam rudram śarvam īśānam īśvaram
translated: The fierce, the immovable, the auspicious, the Rudra, the Sharva, the Ishana, the lord,

original: giriśaṃ varadaṃ devaṃ bhavaṃ bhāvanam avyayam
analyzed: giriśam vara dam devam bhavam bhāvanam avyayam
translated: The giver of boons, the god, the unborn, the cause, the imperishable,

original: śitikaṇṭham ajaṃ śakraṃ krathaṃ kratuharaṃ haram
analyzed: śitikaṇṭham ajam śakram kratham kratu haram haram
translated: The blue-throated, the unborn, the Shakra, the crusher, the sacrificer, the Hara,

original: viśvarūpaṃ virūpākṣaṃ bahurūpam umāpatim
analyzed: viśvarūpam virūpākṣam bahurūpam umāpatim
translated: The universal form, the disfigured-eyed, the multi-formed, the lord of Uma,

original: śmaśānavāsinaṃ dṛptaṃ mahāgaṇapatiṃ prabhum
analyzed: śmaśānavāsinam dṛptam mahāgaṇapatim prabhum
translated: The dweller in cremation grounds, the proud, the lord of the great Ganas, the powerful,

original: khaṭvāṅgadhāriṇaṃ muṇḍaṃ jaṭilaṃ brahmacāriṇam
analyzed: khaṭvāṅga dhāriṇam muṇḍam jaṭilam brahmacāriṇam
translated: Holding a khaṭvāṅga, shaven-headed, matted hair, celibate,

original: manasāpy asucintyena duṣkareṇālpacetasā
analyzed: manasā api a su cintyena duṣkareṇa alpa cetasā
translated: Even mentally inconceivable, difficult to do, with little thought,

original: so 'ham ātmopahāreṇa yakṣye tripuraghātinam
analyzed: saḥ ham ātma upahāreṇa yakṣye tripura ghātinam
translated: I will perform a sacrifice to the slayer of Tripura with my own body.

original: stutaṃ stutyaṃ stūyamānam amoghaṃ carmavāsasam
analyzed: stutam stutyam stūyamānam amogham carma vāsasam
translated: Praised, praiseworthy, being praised, infallible, wearing a hide,

original: vilohitaṃ nīlakaṇṭham apṛktaṃ durnivāraṇam
analyzed: vilohitam nīlakaṇṭham apṛktam durnivāraṇam
translated: Reddish, blue-throated, unattached, difficult to stop,

original: śukraṃ viśvasṛjaṃ brahma brahmacāriṇam eva ca
analyzed: śukram viśvasṛjam brahma brahmacāriṇam eva ca
translated: Semen, creator of the universe, Brahman, and celibate,

original: vratavantaṃ taponityam anantaṃ tapatāṃ gatim
analyzed: vratavantam tapaḥ nityam anantam tapatām gatim
translated: Having vows, always austere, infinite, the goal of those who heat,

original: bahurūpaṃ gaṇādhyakṣaṃ tryakṣaṃ pāriṣadapriyam🔽gaṇādhyakṣekṣitamukhaṃ gaurīhṛdayavallabham🔽kumārapitaraṃ piṅgaṃ govṛṣottamavāhanam
analyzed: bahu rūpam gaṇādhyakṣam tryakṣam pāriṣada priyam                 kumāra pitaram piṅgam go vṛṣa uttama vāhanam
translated: Multi-formed, chief of the Gaṇas, three-eyed, fond of the attendants,🔽With a face looked at by the chief of the Gaṇas, beloved of Pārvatī's heart,🔽Father of Kumāra, tawny, riding the best of bulls,

original: tanuvāsasam atyugram umābhūṣaṇatatparam
analyzed: tanu vāsasam ati ugram umā bhūṣaṇa tatparam
translated: Wearing a thin garment, very fierce, intent on adorning Umā,

original: paraṃ parebhyaḥ paramaṃ paraṃ yasmān na vidyate
analyzed: param parebhyaḥ paramam param yasmāt na vidyate
translated: Supreme among the supreme, the highest, from whom there is nothing higher,

original: iṣvastrottamabhartāraṃ digantaṃ caiva dakṣiṇam
analyzed: iṣvastra uttama bhartāram diś antam ca eva dakṣiṇam
translated: Bearer of the best of bows and arrows, and the end of the southern direction,

original: hiraṇyakavacaṃ devaṃ candramaulivibhūṣitam
analyzed: hiraṇyakavacam devam candra mauli vibhūṣitam
translated: The god with golden armor, adorned with a moon crest,

original: prapadye śaraṇaṃ devaṃ parameṇa samādhinā
analyzed: prapadye śaraṇam devam parameṇa samādhinā
translated: I take refuge in the god with supreme concentration.

original: imāṃ cāpy āpadaṃ ghorāṃ tarāmy adya sudustarām
analyzed: imām ca api āpadam ghorām tarāmi adya su dustarām
translated: And today I shall cross this terrible and extremely difficult calamity.

original: sarvabhūtopahāreṇa yakṣye 'haṃ śucinā śucim
analyzed: sarva bhūta upahāreṇa yakṣye ham śucinā śucim
translated: With a pure offering of all beings, I shall worship the pure one.

original: iti tasya vyavasitaṃ jñātvā tyāgātmakaṃ manaḥ
analyzed: iti tasya vyavasitam jñātvā tyāga ātmakam manaḥ
translated: Knowing his mind to be determined by renunciation,

original: purastāt kāñcanī vediḥ prādurāsīn mahātmanaḥ
analyzed: purastāt kāñcanī vediḥ prādurāsīt mahātmanaḥ
translated: in front of the great-souled one, a golden altar appeared.

original: tasyāṃ vedyāṃ tadā rājaṃś citrabhānur ajāyata
analyzed: tasyām vedyām tadā rājan citrabhānuḥ ajāyata
translated: On that altar, O king, a blazing fire arose,

original: dyāṃ diśo vidiśaḥ khaṃ ca jvālābhir abhipūrayan🔽ratnacitrāṅgadadharāḥ samudyatakarās tathā
analyzed: dyām diśaḥ vidiśaḥ kham ca jvālābhiḥ abhipūrayan  ratna citra aṅgada dharāḥ samudyata karāḥ tathā
translated: filling the sky, the directions, the sub-directions and the sky with flames.🔽Some had bodies adorned with jewels, some had uplifted hands,

original: dīptāsyanayanāś cātra naikapādaśirobhujāḥ
analyzed: dīpta āsya nayanāḥ ca atra na eka pāda śiraḥ bhujāḥ
translated: some had blazing mouths and eyes, some had many feet, heads and arms.

original: dvipaśailapratīkāśāḥ prādurāsan mahānanāḥ🔽śvavarāhoṣṭrarūpāś ca hayagomāyugomukhāḥ
analyzed: dvipa śaila pratīkāśāḥ prādurāsan mahā ānanāḥ  śva varāha uṣṭra rūpāḥ ca haya gomāyu go mukhāḥ
translated: Some resembled elephants and mountains, some had large faces.🔽Some had the forms of dogs, pigs and camels, some had the faces of horses, jackals and cows.

original: ṛkṣamārjāravadanā vyāghradvīpimukhās tathā🔽kākavaktrāḥ plavamukhāḥ śukavaktrās tathaiva ca
analyzed: ṛkṣa mārjāra vadanāḥ vyāghra dvīpi mukhāḥ tathā  kāka vaktrāḥ plava mukhāḥ śuka vaktrāḥ tathā eva ca
translated: Some had the faces of bears and cats, some had the faces of tigers and leopards.🔽Some had the faces of crows and monkeys, some had the faces of parrots.

original: mahājagaravaktrāś ca haṃsavaktrāḥ sitaprabhāḥ🔽dārvāghāṭamukhāś caiva cāṣavaktrāś ca bhārata
analyzed: mahā ajagara vaktrāḥ ca haṃsa vaktrāḥ sita prabhāḥ  dārvāghāṭa mukhāḥ ca eva cāṣa vaktrāḥ ca bhārata
translated: Some had the faces of large pythons, some had the faces of swans shining white.🔽Some had the faces of Darvabhishakas, some had the faces of chashas, O descendant of Bharata.

original: śataśaś ca sahasrākṣās tathaiva ca ghaṭodarāḥ
analyzed: śataśas ca sahasra akṣāḥ tathā eva ca ghaṭa udarāḥ
translated: Some had hundreds of eyes, some had pot-bellies.

original: kūrmanakramukhāś caiva śiśumāramukhās tathā🔽mahāmakaravaktrāś ca timivaktrās tathaiva ca🔽harivaktrāḥ krauñcamukhāḥ kapotebhamukhās tathā
analyzed: kūrma nakra mukhāḥ ca eva śiśumāra mukhāḥ tathā  mahā makara vaktrāḥ ca timi vaktrāḥ tathā eva ca  hari vaktrāḥ krauñca mukhāḥ kapota ibha mukhāḥ tathā
translated: Some had faces like tortoises and alligators, some like porpoises,🔽Some had faces like giant makaras, some like whales,🔽Some had faces like peacocks, some like pigeons and hawks,

original: pārāvatamukhāś caiva madguvaktrās tathaiva ca
analyzed: pārāvata mukhāḥ ca eva madgu vaktrāḥ tathā eva ca
translated: Some had faces like doves and herons,

original: pāṇikarṇāḥ sahasrākṣās tathaiva ca śatodarāḥ
analyzed: pāṇi karṇāḥ sahasra akṣāḥ tathā eva ca śata udarāḥ
translated: Some had hands for ears and a thousand eyes, some had a hundred stomachs,

original: nirmāṃsāḥ kokavaktrāś ca śyenavaktrāś ca bhārata
analyzed: nirmāṃsāḥ koka vaktrāḥ ca śyena vaktrāḥ ca bhārata
translated: Some were without flesh, some had faces like crows and hawks, O Bharata,

original: tathaivāśiraso rājann ṛkṣavaktrāś ca bhīṣaṇāḥ
analyzed: tathā eva aśirasaḥ rājan ṛkṣa vaktrāḥ ca bhīṣaṇāḥ
translated: Some had faces like bears, O king, and were terrifying,

original: pradīptanetrajihvāś ca jvālāvaktrās tathaiva ca
analyzed: pradīpta netra jihvāḥ ca jvālā vaktrāḥ tathā eva ca
translated: Some had blazing eyes and tongues, some had flaming mouths,

original: jvālākeśāś ca rājendra jvaladromacaturbhujāḥ
analyzed: jvālā keśāḥ ca rāja indra jvalat roma catur bhujāḥ
translated: Some had hair like flames, O lord of kings, and blazing eyebrows and four arms,

original: meṣavaktrās tathaivānye tathā chāgamukhā nṛpa🔽śaṅkhābhāḥ śaṅkhavaktrāś ca śaṅkhakarṇās tathaiva ca
analyzed: meṣa vaktrāḥ tathā eva anye tathā chāga mukhāḥ nṛpa  śaṅkha ābhāḥ śaṅkha vaktrāḥ ca śaṅkha karṇāḥ tathā eva ca
translated: Some had faces like rams, and some like goats, O king,🔽Some had the color of conches, some had faces like conches, some had ears like conches,

original: śaṅkhamālāparikarāḥ śaṅkhadhvanisamasvanāḥ
analyzed: śaṅkha mālā parikarāḥ śaṅkha dhvani sama svanāḥ
translated: Some had garlands of conches around their bodies, and their voices sounded like the conch,

original: jaṭādharāḥ pañcaśikhās tathā muṇḍāḥ kṛśodarāḥ
analyzed: jaṭā dharāḥ pañca śikhāḥ tathā muṇḍāḥ kṛśa udarāḥ
translated: Some had matted hair, some had five locks of hair, some were shaven-headed and thin-waisted,

original: caturdaṃṣṭrāś caturjihvāḥ śaṅkukarṇāḥ kirīṭinaḥ
analyzed: catur daṃṣṭrāḥ catur jihvāḥ śaṅku karṇāḥ kirīṭinaḥ
translated: Some had four fangs and four tongues, some had conical ears and crowns,

original: maulīdharāś ca rājendra tathākuñcitamūrdhajāḥ
analyzed: maulī dharāḥ ca rāja indra tathā ākuñcita mūrdhajāḥ
translated: Some wore head ornaments, O lord of kings, and some had coiled hair,

original: uṣṇīṣiṇo mukuṭinaś cāruvaktrāḥ svalaṃkṛtāḥ🔽cārukuṇḍalinaś caiva tathā mukuṭadhāriṇaḥ
analyzed: uṣṇīṣiṇaḥ mukuṭinaḥ cāru vaktrāḥ su alaṃkṛtāḥ  cāru kuṇḍalinaḥ ca eva tathā mukuṭa dhāriṇaḥ
translated: Wearing turbans and crowns, with beautiful faces and adorned,🔽Wearing beautiful earrings and also wearing crowns,

original: padmotpalāpīḍadharās tathā kumudadhāriṇaḥ
analyzed: padma utpala āpīḍa dharāḥ tathā kumuda dhāriṇaḥ
translated: Wearing lotus, blue lotus, and white water lily garlands,

original: māhātmyena ca saṃyuktāḥ śataśo 'tha sahasraśaḥ
analyzed: māhātmyena ca saṃyuktāḥ sahasraśas
translated: Endowed with greatness, in hundreds and thousands,

original: śataghnīcakrahastāś ca tathā musalapāṇayaḥ🔽bhuśuṇḍīpāśahastāś ca gadāhastāś ca bhārata🔽pṛṣṭheṣu baddheṣudhayaś citrabāṇā raṇotkaṭāḥ
analyzed: śataghnī cakra hastāḥ ca tathā musala pāṇayaḥ  bhuśuṇḍī pāśa hastāḥ ca gadā hastāḥ ca bhārata  pṛṣṭheṣu baddha iṣudhayaḥ citra bāṇāḥ raṇa utkaṭāḥ
translated: With hands holding shataghnis and discuses, and also with pestles in their hands,🔽With hands holding bhusundis and nooses, and with maces in their hands, O descendant of Bharata,🔽With quivers on their backs, with colorful arrows, and eager for battle,

original: sadhvajāḥ sapatākāś ca saghaṇṭāḥ saparaśvadhāḥ
analyzed: sa dhvajāḥ sa patākāḥ ca sa ghaṇṭāḥ sa paraśvadhāḥ
translated: With flags, with banners, with bells, and with axes,

original: mahāpāśodyatakarās tathā laguḍapāṇayaḥ
analyzed: mahā pāśa udyata karāḥ tathā laguḍa pāṇayaḥ
translated: With hands raised holding great nooses, and with hands holding clubs,

original: sthūṇāhastāḥ khaḍgahastāḥ sarpocchritakirīṭinaḥ
analyzed: sthūṇā hastāḥ khaḍga hastāḥ sarpa ucchrita kirīṭinaḥ
translated: With hands holding pillars, with hands holding swords, with hoods of serpents raised as crowns,

original: mahāsarpāṅgadadharāś citrābharaṇadhāriṇaḥ
analyzed: mahā sarpa aṅgada dharāḥ citra ābharaṇa dhāriṇaḥ
translated: Wearing great serpents as armlets, wearing colorful ornaments,

original: rajodhvastāḥ paṅkadigdhāḥ sarve śuklāmbarasrajaḥ🔽karālākṣāḥ sakṛdbhāsvacchatavakrās tathaiva ca🔽nīlāṅgāḥ kamalāṅgāś ca muṇḍavaktrās tathaiva ca
analyzed: rajaḥ dhvastāḥ paṅka digdhāḥ sarve śukla ambara srajaḥ  karāla akṣāḥ sakṛt bhāsvat śata vakrāḥ tathā eva ca  nīla aṅgāḥ kamala aṅgāḥ ca muṇḍa vaktrāḥ tathā eva ca
translated: Covered with dust, smeared with mud, all wearing white garments and garlands,🔽With fierce eyes, with single radiant teeth, and also with hundred curved teeth,🔽With blue bodies, with lotus bodies, and also with shaven faces,

original: bherīśaṅkhamṛdaṅgāṃs te jharjharānakagomukhān
analyzed: bherī śaṅkha mṛdaṅgān te jharjhara ānaka gomukhān
translated: With drums, conches, and kettledrums, with jharjharas, ankuses, and gomukhas,

original: avādayan pāriṣadāḥ prahṛṣṭāḥ kanakaprabhāḥ
analyzed: avādayan pāriṣadāḥ prahṛṣṭāḥ kanaka prabhāḥ
translated: The delighted attendants, shining like gold, played musical instruments.

original: gāyamānās tathaivānye nṛtyamānās tathāpare
analyzed: gāyamānāḥ tathā eva anye nṛtyamānāḥ tathā apare
translated: Some sang, others danced,

original: laṅghayantaḥ plavantaś ca valgantaś ca mahābalāḥ🔽dhāvanto javanāś caṇḍāḥ pavanoddhūtamūrdhajāḥ
analyzed: laṅghayantaḥ plavantaḥ ca valgantaḥ ca mahā balāḥ  dhāvantaḥ javanāḥ caṇḍāḥ pavana uddhūta mūrdhajāḥ
translated: some leaped, some flew, and some powerful ones roared.🔽Running swiftly, fiercely, with their hair blown by the wind,

original: mattā iva mahānāgā vinadanto muhur muhuḥ
analyzed: mattāḥ iva mahā nāgāḥ vinadantaḥ muhur muhur
translated: like great intoxicated elephants, they repeatedly roared.

original: subhīmā ghorarūpāś ca śūlapaṭṭiśapāṇayaḥ🔽nānāvirāgavasanāś citramālyānulepanāḥ
analyzed: su bhīmāḥ ghora rūpāḥ ca śūla paṭṭiśa pāṇayaḥ  nānā virāga vasanāḥ citra mālya anulepanāḥ
translated: Extremely terrifying, of terrible forms, with spears and axes in their hands,🔽dressed in various colors, with colorful garlands and ointments,

original: ratnacitrāṅgadadharāḥ samudyatakarās tathā
analyzed: ratna citra aṅgada dharāḥ samudyata karāḥ tathā
translated: wearing jeweled armlets, with uplifted hands,

original: hantāro dviṣatāṃ śūrāḥ prasahyāsahyavikramāḥ🔽pātāro 'sṛgvasādyānāṃ māṃsāntrakṛtabhojanāḥ
analyzed: hantāraḥ dviṣatām śūrāḥ prasahya asahya vikramāḥ  pātāraḥ sṛj vasā ādyānām māṃsa antra kṛta bhojanāḥ
translated: slayers of enemies, heroes, forcibly enduring unbearable valor,🔽drinkers of blood and fat, with flesh and entrails as their food,

original: cūḍālāḥ karṇikālāś ca prakṛśāḥ piṭharodarāḥ
analyzed: cūḍālāḥ karṇi kālāḥ ca prakṛśāḥ piṭhara udarāḥ
translated: with topknots, with ears reaching the shoulders, emaciated, with pot-bellies,

original: atihrasvātidīrghāś ca prabalāś cātibhairavāḥ🔽vikaṭāḥ kālalamboṣṭhā bṛhacchephāsthipiṇḍikāḥ
analyzed: ati hrasva ati dīrghāḥ ca prabalāḥ ca ati bhairavāḥ  vikaṭāḥ kāla lamba uṣṭhāḥ bṛhat śepha asthi piṇḍikāḥ
translated: extremely short, extremely tall, very strong, and extremely terrifying,🔽with disfigured faces, hanging lips like death, large lips, and fleshy cheeks,

original: mahārhanānāmukuṭā muṇḍāś ca jaṭilāḥ pare
analyzed: mahārha nānā mukuṭāḥ muṇḍāḥ ca jaṭilāḥ pare
translated: wearing jeweled crowns, some shaven-headed, others with matted locks,

original: sārkendugrahanakṣatrāṃ dyāṃ kuryur ye mahītale
analyzed: sa arka indu graha nakṣatrām dyām kuryuḥ ye mahī tale
translated: those who could make the sky with the sun, moon, planets, and stars fall to the ground,

original: utsaheraṃś ca ye hantuṃ bhūtagrāmaṃ caturvidham
analyzed: utsaheran ca ye hantum bhūta grāmam caturvidham
translated: And those who are able to destroy the four types of living beings,

original: ye ca vītabhayā nityaṃ harasya bhrukuṭībhaṭāḥ
analyzed: ye ca vīta bhayāḥ nityam harasya bhrukuṭī bhaṭāḥ
translated: And those who are always fearless, the soldiers of Shiva's frown,

original: kāmakārakarāḥ siddhās trailokyasyeśvareśvarāḥ
analyzed: kāmakāra karāḥ siddhāḥ trailokyasya īśvara īśvarāḥ
translated: The Siddhas who act as they please, the lords of the lords of the three worlds,

original: nityānandapramuditā vāgīśā vītamatsarāḥ
translated: Always joyful with eternal bliss, the lords of speech, free from envy,

original: prāpyāṣṭaguṇam aiśvaryaṃ ye na yānti ca vismayam
analyzed: prāpya aṣṭaguṇam aiśvaryam ye na yānti ca vismayam
translated: Having attained the eightfold lordship, those who do not become proud,

original: yeṣāṃ vismayate nityaṃ bhagavān karmabhir haraḥ
analyzed: yeṣām vismayate nityam bhagavān karmabhiḥ haraḥ
translated: Whose pride is always aroused by the deeds of Lord Shiva,

original: manovākkarmabhir bhaktair nityam ārādhitaś ca yaiḥ
analyzed: manaḥ vāc karmabhiḥ bhaktaiḥ nityam ārādhitaḥ ca yaiḥ
translated: Who are always worshipped by devotees with mind, speech and action,

original: manovākkarmabhir bhaktān pāti putrān ivaurasān
analyzed: manaḥ vāc karmabhiḥ bhaktān pāti putrān iva aurasān
translated: Who protect the devotees with mind, speech and action like one's own sons,

original: pibanto 'sṛgvasās tv anye kruddhā brahmadviṣāṃ sadā
analyzed: pibantaḥ sṛgvasāḥ tu anye kruddhāḥ brahma dviṣām sadā
translated: Others drink blood and fat, always angry with the haters of Brahman,

original: caturviṃśātmakaṃ somaṃ ye pibanti ca nityadā
analyzed: caturviṃśa ātmakam somam ye pibanti ca nityadā
translated: Those who always drink the Soma consisting of twenty-four,

original: śrutena brahmacaryeṇa tapasā ca damena ca
analyzed: śrutena brahmacaryeṇa tapasā ca damena ca
translated: By the Vedas, celibacy, austerities and self-control,

original: ye samārādhya śūlāṅkaṃ bhavasāyujyam āgatāḥ🔽yair ātmabhūtair bhagavān pārvatyā ca maheśvaraḥ
analyzed: ye samārādhya śūla aṅkam bhava sāyujyam āgatāḥ  yaiḥ ātma bhūtaiḥ bhagavān pārvatyā ca maheśvaraḥ
translated: Having propitiated the trident-bearer, have attained union with Bhava,🔽By whom the Blessed One, Mahesvara, along with Parvati,

original: saha bhūtagaṇān bhuṅkte bhūtabhavyabhavatprabhuḥ
analyzed: saha bhūta gaṇān bhuṅkte bhūta bhavya bhavat prabhuḥ
translated: The lord of the past, present and future, eats with the hosts of spirits,

original: nānāvicitrahasitakṣveḍitotkruṣṭagarjitaiḥ
analyzed: nānā vicitra hasita kṣveḍita utkruṣṭa garjitaiḥ
translated: With various kinds of laughter, jeering, shouting and roaring,

original: saṃnādayantas te viśvam aśvatthāmānam abhyayuḥ🔽saṃstuvanto mahādevaṃ bhāḥ kurvāṇāḥ suvarcasaḥ
analyzed: saṃnādayantaḥ te viśvam aśvatthāmānam abhyayus  saṃstuvantaḥ mahādevam bhāḥ kurvāṇāḥ su varcasaḥ
translated: Shaking the entire universe, they approached Ashvatthama.🔽Praising Mahadeva, radiating great splendor,

original: vivardhayiṣavo drauṇer mahimānaṃ mahātmanaḥ
analyzed: vivardhayiṣavaḥ drauṇeḥ mahimānam mahātmanaḥ
translated: Desiring to increase the greatness of the great-souled son of Drona,

original: jijñāsamānās tattejaḥ sauptikaṃ ca didṛkṣavaḥ🔽bhīmograparighālātaśūlapaṭṭiśapāṇayaḥ
analyzed: jijñāsamānāḥ tat tejaḥ sauptikam ca didṛkṣavaḥ  bhīma ugra parigha alāta śūla paṭṭiśa pāṇayaḥ
translated: Desiring to test his energy and to witness the slaughter of the sleeping warriors,🔽With arms holding heavy iron bludgeons, iron rods, spears and axes,

original: ghorarūpāḥ samājagmur bhūtasaṃghāḥ samantataḥ
analyzed: ghora rūpāḥ samājagmuḥ bhūta saṃghāḥ samantataḥ
translated: Terrible-looking groups of spirits assembled from all directions.

original: janayeyur bhayaṃ ye sma trailokyasyāpi darśanāt
analyzed: janayeyuḥ bhayam ye sma trailokyasya api darśanāt
translated: They were capable of striking terror even to the three worlds by their mere sight.

original: tān prekṣamāṇo 'pi vyathāṃ na cakāra mahābalaḥ
analyzed: tān prekṣamāṇaḥ pi vyathām na cakāra mahā balaḥ
translated: But the mighty Ashvatthama was not at all agitated on seeing them.

original: atha drauṇir dhanuṣpāṇir baddhagodhāṅgulitravān
analyzed: atha drauṇiḥ dhanuṣpāṇiḥ baddha godhā aṅgulitravān
translated: Then the son of Drona, with bow in hand, his fingers protected by leather gloves,

original: svayam evātmanātmānam upahāram upāharat
analyzed: svayam eva ātmanā ātmānam upahāram upāharat
translated: Himself offered himself as a sacrificial offering.

original: dhanūṃṣi samidhas tatra pavitrāṇi śitāḥ śarāḥ
analyzed: dhanūṃṣi samidhaḥ tatra pavitrāṇi śitāḥ śarāḥ
translated: The bows were the sacrificial fuel, the sharp arrows the sacred blades,

original: havir ātmavataś cātmā tasmin bhārata karmaṇi
analyzed: haviḥ ātmavataḥ ca ātmā tasmin bhārata karmaṇi
translated: And the sacrificer's own self was the sacrificial offering in that rite, O Bharata.

original: tataḥ saumyena mantreṇa droṇaputraḥ pratāpavān
analyzed: tatas saumyena mantreṇa droṇaputraḥ pratāpavān
translated: Then the powerful son of Drona, with a peaceful mantra,

original: upahāraṃ mahāmanyur athātmānam upāharat
analyzed: upahāram mahā manyuḥ atha ātmānam upāharat
translated: Offered himself as a sacrificial offering, filled with great rage.🔽To that Rudra, of terrible deeds, who is not subject to decay,

original: taṃ rudraṃ raudrakarmāṇaṃ raudraiḥ karmabhir acyutam
analyzed: tam rudram raudra karmāṇam raudraiḥ karmabhiḥ acyutam
translated: Who is worshipped by the terrible deeds of the terrible,

original: abhiṣṭutya mahātmānam ity uvāca kṛtāñjaliḥ🔽imam ātmānam adyāhaṃ jātam āṅgirase kule
analyzed: abhiṣṭutya mahātmānam iti uvāca kṛtāñjaliḥ  imam ātmānam adya aham jātam āṅgirase kule
translated: Having praised the great-souled one, he spoke with folded hands:🔽Today, I offer this self of mine, born in the family of Āṅgiras,

original: agnau juhomi bhagavan pratigṛhṇīṣva māṃ balim
analyzed: agnau juhomi bhagavan pratigṛhṇīṣva mām balim
translated: into the fire, O Lord. Accept me as an offering.

original: bhavadbhaktyā mahādeva parameṇa samādhinā
analyzed: bhavat bhaktyā mahādeva parameṇa samādhinā
translated: By devotion to you, O Mahādeva, with supreme concentration,

original: asyām āpadi viśvātmann upākurmi tavāgrataḥ
analyzed: asyām āpadi viśvātman upākurmi tava agratas
translated: in this calamity, O soul of the universe, I commence in front of you.

original: tvayi sarvāṇi bhūtāni sarvabhūteṣu cāsi vai
analyzed: tvayi sarvāṇi bhūtāni sarva bhūteṣu ca asi vai
translated: You are in all beings and all beings are in you.

original: guṇānāṃ hi pradhānānām ekatvaṃ tvayi tiṣṭhati
analyzed: guṇānām hi pradhānānām eka tvam tvayi tiṣṭhati
translated: The oneness of the principal qualities resides in you.

original: sarvabhūtāśaya vibho havirbhūtam upasthitam
analyzed: sarva bhūta āśaya vibho haviḥ bhūtam upasthitam
translated: O Lord of the abode of all beings, I am present as the oblation.

original: pratigṛhāṇa māṃ deva yady aśakyāḥ pare mayā
analyzed: pratigṛhāṇa mām deva yadi aśakyāḥ pare mayā
translated: Accept me, O God, if the enemy is invincible to me.

original: ity uktvā drauṇir āsthāya tāṃ vedīṃ dīptapāvakām🔽saṃtyaktātmā samāruhya kṛṣṇavartmany upāviśat
analyzed: iti uktvā drauṇiḥ āsthāya tām vedīm dīpta pāvakām  saṃtyakta ātmā samāruhya kṛṣṇavartmani upāviśat
translated: Having said this, Drona's son ascended that altar with the blazing fire,🔽abandoned his self, mounted the funeral pyre, and sat down.

original: tam ūrdhvabāhuṃ niśceṣṭaṃ dṛṣṭvā havir upasthitam
analyzed: tam ūrdhva bāhum niśceṣṭam dṛṣṭvā haviḥ upasthitam
translated: Seeing him with upraised arms, motionless, ready for the oblation,

original: abravīd bhagavān sākṣān mahādevo hasann iva🔽satyaśaucārjavatyāgais tapasā niyamena ca
analyzed: abravīt bhagavān sākṣāt mahādevaḥ hasan iva  satya śauca ārjava tyāgaiḥ tapasā niyamena ca
translated: the Blessed Lord Mahādeva himself spoke, as if smiling:🔽By truth, purity, sincerity, renunciation, austerity, discipline,

original: kṣāntyā bhaktyā ca dhṛtyā ca buddhyā ca vacasā tathā
analyzed: kṣāntyā bhaktyā ca dhṛtyā ca buddhyā ca vacasā tathā
translated: forbearance, devotion, fortitude, intellect, and speech,

original: yathāvad aham ārāddhaḥ kṛṣṇenākliṣṭakarmaṇā
analyzed: yathāvat aham ārāddhaḥ kṛṣṇena akliṣṭa karmaṇā
translated: Krishna, whose deeds are unsullied, has worshipped me properly.

original: tasmād iṣṭatamaḥ kṛṣṇād anyo mama na vidyate
analyzed: tasmāt iṣṭatamaḥ kṛṣṇāt anyaḥ mama na vidyate
translated: Therefore, there is no one dearer to me than Krishna.

original: kurvatā tasya saṃmānaṃ tvāṃ ca jijñāsatā mayā🔽pāñcālāḥ sahasā guptā māyāś ca bahuśaḥ kṛtāḥ
analyzed: kurvatā tasya saṃmānam tvām ca jijñāsatā mayā  pāñcālāḥ sahasā guptāḥ māyāḥ ca bahuśas kṛtāḥ
translated: While honoring him and testing you,🔽I suddenly protected the Panchalas and created many illusions.

original: kṛtas tasyaiṣa saṃmānaḥ pāñcālān rakṣatā mayā
analyzed: kṛtaḥ tasya eṣa saṃmānaḥ pāñcālān rakṣatā mayā
translated: Having honored him by protecting the Panchalas,

original: abhibhūtās tu kālena naiṣām adyāsti jīvitam
analyzed: abhibhūtāḥ tu kālena na eṣām adya asti jīvitam
translated: their life is now over, overwhelmed by time.

original: evam uktvā maheṣvāsaṃ bhagavān ātmanas tanum
analyzed: evam uktvā mahā iṣvāsam bhagavān ātmanaḥ tanum
translated: Having said this to the great archer, the Lord entered his own body,

original: āviveśa dadau cāsmai vimalaṃ khaḍgam uttamam🔽athāviṣṭo bhagavatā bhūyo jajvāla tejasā
analyzed: āviveśa dadau ca asmai vimalam khaḍgam uttamam  atha āviṣṭaḥ bhagavatā bhūyas jajvāla tejasā
translated: and gave him an excellent and spotless sword.🔽Then, possessed by the Lord, he blazed forth with energy once again,

original: varṣmavāṃś cābhavad yuddhe devasṛṣṭena tejasā
analyzed: varṣmavān ca abhavat yuddhe deva sṛṣṭena tejasā
translated: and became endowed with strength in battle through the energy created by the gods.

original: tam adṛśyāni bhūtāni rakṣāṃsi ca samādravan
analyzed: tam adṛśyāni bhūtāni rakṣāṃsi ca samādravan
translated: Invisible beings and demons rushed towards him,

original: abhitaḥ śatruśibiraṃ yāntaṃ sākṣād iveśvaram
analyzed: abhitas śatru śibiram yāntam sākṣāt iva īśvaram
translated: as he went around the enemy camp, like the Lord himself.

original: yāntaṃ drauṇiṃ mahāratham
analyzed: yāntam drauṇim mahā ratham
translated: As the great chariot Drona's son was going,

original: devadevaṃ haraṃ sthāṇuṃ
analyzed: devadevam haram sthāṇum
translated: the god of gods, Hara, Sthanu,

original: yaś cedaṃ paṭhate stotraṃ śrutvā bhaktisamanvitaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ ca idam paṭhate stotram śrutvā bhakti samanvitaḥ
translated: and whoever recites this hymn with devotion after hearing it,

original: sarvapāpaviśuddhātmā rudralokaṃ sa gacchati
analyzed: sarva pāpa viśuddha ātmā rudra lokam sa gacchati
translated: with his soul purified from all sins, he goes to Rudra's world.

original: dhṛtarāṣṭra uvāca
analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ uvāca
translated: Dhritarashtra said:

original: tathā prayāte śibiraṃ droṇaputre mahārathe🔽kaccit kṛpaś ca bhojaś ca bhayārtau na nyavartatām
analyzed: tathā prayāte śibiram droṇaputre mahā rathe  kaccit kṛpaḥ ca bhojaḥ ca bhaya ārtau na nyavartatām
translated: When the great warrior Drona's son had left in that way,🔽Did Kripa and Bhoja, afflicted with fear, turn back?

original: kaccin na vāritau kṣudrai rakṣibhir nopalakṣitau
analyzed: kaccit na vāritau kṣudraiḥ rakṣibhiḥ na upalakṣitau
translated: Were they not stopped by the wretched guards and noticed?

original: asahyam iti vā matvā na nivṛttau mahārathau
analyzed: asahyam iti vā matvā na nivṛttau mahā rathau
translated: Or, considering it unbearable, did the great warriors not turn back?

original: kaccit pramathya śibiraṃ hatvā somakapāṇḍavān
analyzed: kaccit pramathya śibiram hatvā somaka pāṇḍavān
translated: Having destroyed the camp and killed the Somakas and Pandavas,

original: kṛtā pratijñā saphalā kaccit saṃjaya sā niśi
analyzed: kṛtā pratijñā saphalā kaccit saṃjaya sā niśi
translated: O Sanjaya, was that vow made by Duryodhana fulfilled that night?

original: duryodhanasya padavīṃ gatau paramikāṃ raṇe
analyzed: duryodhanasya padavīm gatau paramikām raṇe
translated: Did they follow Duryodhana's supreme path in battle?

original: balair vā nihatau tau tu kaccin na patitau kṣitau
analyzed: balaiḥ vā nihatau tau tu kaccit na patitau kṣitau
translated: Or were they killed by the forces and fell down on the ground?

original: gatvā tiṣṭhaty asau drauṇiḥ kṛtvā karma suduṣkaram
analyzed: gatvā tiṣṭhati asau drauṇiḥ kṛtvā karma su duṣkaram
translated: Having gone there, does Drona's son remain, having performed a difficult deed?

original: dhṛṣṭadyumnaśikhaṇḍibhyāṃ draupadyāś ca sutaiḥ kila
analyzed: dhṛṣṭadyumna śikhaṇḍibhyām draupadyāḥ ca sutaiḥ kila
translated: By Dhrishtadyumna, Shikhandi and the sons of Draupadi, it is said,

original: saṃchannā medinī suptair nihataiḥ pāṇḍusainikaiḥ
analyzed: saṃchannā medinī suptaiḥ nihataiḥ pāṇḍu sainikaiḥ
translated: The earth is covered with the slain and sleeping soldiers of the Pandus.

original: pāñcālair vā vinihatau kaccin nāsvapatāṃ kṣitau
analyzed: pāñcālaiḥ vā vinihatau kaccit na asvapatām kṣitau
translated: Or were they killed by the Panchalas and sleep on the ground?

original: kaccit tābhyāṃ kṛtaṃ karma tan mamācakṣva saṃjaya
analyzed: kaccit tābhyām kṛtam karma tat mama ācakṣva saṃjaya
translated: Tell me that, O Sanjaya, what deed was done by them?

original: saṃjaya uvāca
analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca
translated: Sanjaya said:

original: tasmin prayāte śibiraṃ droṇaputre mahātmani
analyzed: tasmin prayāte śibiram droṇaputre mahātmani
translated: When the great-souled son of Drona had left for the camp,

original: kṛpaś ca kṛtavarmā ca śibiradvāry atiṣṭhatām
analyzed: kṛpaḥ ca kṛtavarmā ca śibira dvāri atiṣṭhatām
translated: Kripa and Kritavarma stood at the gate of the camp.

original: aśvatthāmā tu tau dṛṣṭvā yatnavantau mahārathau
analyzed: aśvatthāmā tu tau dṛṣṭvā yatnavantau mahā rathau
translated: Ashvatthama, seeing those two great warriors exerting themselves,

original: prahṛṣṭaḥ śanakai rājann idaṃ vacanam abravīt
analyzed: prahṛṣṭaḥ śanakais rājan idam vacanam abravīt
translated: was delighted, O king, and slowly spoke these words:

original: yattau bhavantau paryāptau sarvakṣatrasya nāśane
analyzed: yattau bhavantau paryāptau sarva kṣatrasya nāśane
translated: You two are sufficient for the destruction of all the kshatriyas,

original: kiṃ punar yodhaśeṣasya prasuptasya viśeṣataḥ
analyzed: kim punar yodha śeṣasya prasuptasya viśeṣataḥ
translated: what to speak of the remaining warriors, especially when they are asleep.

original: ahaṃ pravekṣye śibiraṃ cariṣyāmi ca kālavat
analyzed: aham pravekṣye śibiram cariṣyāmi ca kāla vat
translated: I will enter the camp and move about as I please.

original: yathā na kaś cid api me jīvan mucyeta mānavaḥ
analyzed: yathā na kaḥ cit api me jīvan mucyeta mānavaḥ
translated: So that not a single man may escape from me alive.

original: tathā bhavadbhyāṃ kāryaṃ syād iti me niścitā matiḥ
analyzed: tathā bhavadbhyām kāryam syāt iti me niścitā matiḥ
translated: It is my firm resolve that you two should act in this way.

original: ity uktvā prāviśad drauṇiḥ pārthānāṃ śibiraṃ mahat
analyzed: iti uktvā prāviśat drauṇiḥ pārthānām śibiram mahat
translated: Having said this, Drona's son entered the great camp of the Parthas,

original: advāreṇābhyavaskandya vihāya bhayam ātmanaḥ
analyzed: advāreṇa abhyavaskandya vihāya bhayam ātmanaḥ
translated: leaping over the walls, disregarding his own fear.

original: sa praviśya mahābāhur uddeśajñaś ca tasya ha
analyzed: sa praviśya mahā bāhuḥ uddeśa jñaḥ ca tasya ha
translated: The mighty-armed one, who knew the layout of the camp,

original: drauṇiḥ paramasaṃkruddhaḥ tejasā prajvalann iva
analyzed: drauṇiḥ parama saṃkruddhaḥ tejasā prajvalan iva
translated: Drona's son, extremely angry, as if blazing with energy,

original: tataḥ paryacarat sarvaṃ saṃprasuptajanaṃ niśi
analyzed: tatas paryacarat sarvam saṃprasupta janam niśi
translated: then moved about everywhere in the camp, where people were asleep at night,

original: dhṛṣṭadyumnasya nilayaṃ śanakair abhyupāgamat
analyzed: dhṛṣṭadyumnasya nilayam śanakais abhyupāgamat
translated: and slowly approached the abode of Dhrishtadyumna.

original: punar abhyahanat pārśve sa bhinnahṛdayo 'patat
analyzed: punar abhyahanat pārśve sa bhinna hṛdayaḥ patat
translated: and again struck him in the side. With his heart shattered, he fell down.

original: nākulis tu śatānīko rathacakreṇa vīryavān
analyzed: nākuliḥ tu śatānīkaḥ ratha cakreṇa vīryavān
translated: But Shatanika, the son of Nakula, the valiant one,

original: dorbhyām utkṣipya vegena vakṣasy enam atāḍayat
analyzed: dorbhyām utkṣipya vegena vakṣasi enam atāḍayat
translated: raised the chariot wheel with his arms and forcefully struck him in the chest.

original: atāḍayac chatānīkaṃ muktacakraṃ dvijas tu saḥ
analyzed: atāḍayat śatānīkam mukta cakram dvijaḥ tu saḥ
translated: But the brahmin struck Shatanika, who had let go of the wheel,🔽with his sword.

original: sa vihvalo yayau bhūmiṃ tato 'syāpāharac chiraḥ
analyzed: sa vihvalaḥ yayau bhūmim sya apāharat śiraḥ
translated: He became unconscious and fell to the ground, and then (Arjuna) cut off his head.

original: śrutakarmā tu parighaṃ gṛhītvā samatāḍayat
analyzed: śrutakarmā tu parigham gṛhītvā samatāḍayat
translated: But Shrutakarma, taking up a club, struck (Arjuna)

original: abhidrutya tato drauṇiṃ savye sa phalake bhṛśam
analyzed: abhidrutya tatas drauṇim savye sa phalake bhṛśam
translated: and violently attacked Drona's son on the left side of his body.

original: sa tu taṃ śrutakarmāṇam āsye jaghne varāsinā
analyzed: sa tu tam śrutakarmāṇam āsye jaghne vara asinā
translated: But he struck Shrutakarma in the face with an excellent sword.

original: sa hato nyapatad bhūmau vimūḍho vikṛtānanaḥ
analyzed: sa hataḥ nyapatat bhūmau vimūḍhaḥ vikṛta ānanaḥ
translated: Struck, he fell to the ground, confused and with a distorted face.

original: tena śabdena vīras tu śrutakīrtir mahādhanuḥ
analyzed: tena śabdena vīraḥ tu śrutakīrtiḥ mahā dhanuḥ
translated: At that sound, the hero Shrutakirti, the wielder of a great bow,

original: aśvatthāmānam āsādya śaravarṣair avākirat
analyzed: aśvatthāmānam āsādya śara varṣaiḥ avākirat
translated: approaching Ashvatthama, covered him with showers of arrows.

original: śarair ācchāditas tena droṇaputro mahārathaḥ
analyzed: śaraiḥ ācchāditaḥ tena droṇaputraḥ mahā rathaḥ
translated: Covered with arrows by him, Drona's son, the great chariot-warrior,

original: adṛśyata mahārāja śvāviṭ śalalito yathā
analyzed: adṛśyata mahā rāja śvāviṣ śalalitaḥ yathā
translated: appeared, great king, like a porcupine with its quills erect.

original: tasyāpi śaravarṣāṇi carmaṇā prativārya saḥ
analyzed: tasya api śara varṣāṇi carmaṇā prativārya saḥ
translated: He, too, warding off his showers of arrows with his shield,

original: sakuṇḍalaṃ śiraḥ kāyād bhrājamānam apāharat
analyzed: sa kuṇḍalam śiraḥ kāyāt bhrājamānam apāharat
translated: removed from his body his head, shining with earrings.

original: tato bhīṣmanihantā taṃ saha sarvaiḥ prabhadrakaiḥ
analyzed: tatas bhīṣma nihantā tam saha sarvaiḥ prabhadrakaiḥ
translated: Then the slayer of Bhishma, together with all the Prabhadrakas,

original: ahanat sarvato vīraṃ nānāpraharaṇair balī
analyzed: ahanat sarvatas vīram nānā praharaṇaiḥ balī
translated: struck the hero in every direction with various weapons, the powerful one.

original: śilīmukhena cāpy enaṃ bhruvor madhye samārdayat
analyzed: śilīmukhena ca api enam bhruvoḥ madhye samārdayat
translated: And with a sharp-pointed arrow, he struck him between the eyebrows.

original: sa tu krodhasamāviṣṭo droṇaputro mahābalaḥ
analyzed: sa tu krodha samāviṣṭaḥ droṇaputraḥ mahā balaḥ
translated: But Drona's son, the greatly powerful one, possessed by anger,

original: śikhaṇḍinaṃ samāsādya dvidhā ciccheda so 'sinā
analyzed: śikhaṇḍinam samāsādya dvidhā ciccheda saḥ sinā
translated: Approaching Shikhandi, he cut him in two with his sword.

original: śikhaṇḍinaṃ tato hatvā krodhāviṣṭaḥ paraṃtapaḥ
analyzed: śikhaṇḍinam tatas hatvā krodha āviṣṭaḥ paraṃtapaḥ
translated: Then, having killed Shikhandi, that scorcher of enemies, possessed by anger,

original: prabhadrakagaṇān sarvān abhidudrāva vegavān
analyzed: prabhadraka gaṇān sarvān abhidudrāva vegavān
translated: rushed with speed against all the Prabhadrakas.

original: yac ca śiṣṭaṃ virāṭasya balaṃ tac ca samādravat
analyzed: yat ca śiṣṭam virāṭasya balam tat ca samādravat
translated: And he attacked the remaining army of Virata,

original: drupadasya ca putrāṇāṃ pautrāṇāṃ suhṛdām api
analyzed: drupadasya ca putrāṇām pautrāṇām suhṛdām api
translated: and the sons, grandsons and friends of Drupada.

original: cakāra kadanaṃ ghoraṃ dṛṣṭvā dṛṣṭvā mahābalaḥ🔽anyān anyāṃś ca puruṣān abhisṛtyābhisṛtya ca
analyzed: cakāra kadanam ghoram dṛṣṭvā dṛṣṭvā mahā balaḥ  anyān anyān ca puruṣān abhisṛtya abhisṛtya ca
translated: The immensely strong one caused a terrible carnage, seeing them one by one.🔽And Drona's son, skilled in the path of the sword, repeatedly rushed at other men

original: nyakṛntad asinā drauṇir asimārgaviśāradaḥ🔽kālīṃ raktāsyanayanāṃ raktamālyānulepanām🔽raktāmbaradharām ekāṃ pāśahastāṃ śikhaṇḍinīm
analyzed: nyakṛntat asinā drauṇiḥ asi mārga viśāradaḥ  kālīm rakta āsya nayanām rakta mālya anulepanām  rakta ambara dharām ekām pāśa hastām śikhaṇḍinīm
translated: and cut them down with his sword.🔽They saw Kali, with a red face and eyes, adorned with red garlands and ointments,🔽wearing a red garment, alone, with a noose in her hand, with disheveled hair,

original: dadṛśuḥ kālarātriṃ te smayamānām avasthitām
analyzed: dadṛśuḥ kālarātrim te smayamānām avasthitām
translated: standing there with a smile.

original: narāśvakuñjarān pāśair baddhvā ghoraiḥ pratasthuṣīm
analyzed: nara aśva kuñjarān pāśaiḥ baddhvā ghoraiḥ pratasthuṣīm
translated: She was seen binding men, horses and elephants with terrible nooses and setting out,

original: tathaiva ca mahārāja nyastaśastrān mahārathān
analyzed: tathā eva ca mahā rāja nyasta śastrān mahā rathān
translated: and in the same way, great king, she was seen taking away great warriors who had laid down their weapons,

original: harantīṃ vividhān pretān pāśabaddhān vimūrdhajān
analyzed: harantīm vividhān pretān pāśa baddhān vimūrdhajān
translated: and various ghosts bound with nooses and with disheveled hair,

original: svapne suptān nayantīṃ tāṃ rātriṣv anyāsu māriṣa
analyzed: svapne suptān nayantīm tām rātriṣu anyāsu māriṣa
translated: and in other nights, O friends, she was seen leading those who were sleeping in dreams.

original: dadṛśur yodhamukhyās te ghnantaṃ drauṇiṃ ca nityadā
analyzed: dadṛśuḥ yodha mukhyāḥ te ghnantam drauṇim ca nityadā
translated: The foremost warriors saw Drona's son always killing them.

original: yataḥ pravṛttaḥ saṃgrāmaḥ kurupāṇḍavasenayoḥ
analyzed: yatas pravṛttaḥ saṃgrāmaḥ kuru pāṇḍava senayoḥ
translated: From where the battle began between the Kuru and Pandava armies,

original: tataḥ prabhṛti tāṃ kṛtyām apaśyan drauṇim eva ca
analyzed: tatas prabhṛti tām kṛtyām apaśyan drauṇim eva ca
translated: from then on they saw that magical creation and Drona's son.

original: tāṃs tu daivahatān pūrvaṃ paścād drauṇir nyapātayat
analyzed: tān tu daiva hatān pūrvam paścāt drauṇiḥ nyapātayat
translated: But they were first struck down by fate, and then Drona's son brought them down.

original: trāsayan sarvabhūtāni vinadan bhairavān ravān🔽tad anusmṛtya te vīrā darśanaṃ paurvakālikam🔽idaṃ tad ity amanyanta daivenopanipīḍitāḥ
analyzed: trāsayan sarva bhūtāni vinadan bhairavān ravān  tat anusmṛtya te vīrāḥ darśanam paurvakālikam  idam tat iti amanyanta daivena upanipīḍitāḥ
translated: Terrifying all beings, roaring terrible roars,🔽remembering that, the heroes,🔽afflicted by fate, thought, This is it!

original: tatas tena ninādena pratyabudhyanta dhanvinaḥ
analyzed: tatas tena ninādena pratyabudhyanta dhanvinaḥ
translated: Then, by that sound, the archers

original: śibire pāṇḍaveyānāṃ śataśo 'tha sahasraśaḥ
analyzed: śibire pāṇḍaveyānām sahasraśas
translated: in the camp of the Pandavas woke up by the hundreds and thousands.

original: so 'cchinat kasya cit pādau jaghanaṃ caiva kasya cit
analyzed: saḥ chinat kasya cit pādau jaghanam ca eva kasya cit
translated: He cut off the feet of some, and the hips of others,

original: kāṃś cid bibheda pārśveṣu kālasṛṣṭa ivāntakaḥ
analyzed: kān cit bibheda pārśveṣu kāla sṛṣṭaḥ iva antakaḥ
translated: and some he pierced in the sides, like Death created by time.

original: atyugrapratipiṣṭaiś ca nadadbhiś ca bhṛśāturaiḥ
analyzed: ati ugra pratipiṣṭaiḥ ca nadadbhiḥ ca bhṛśa āturaiḥ
translated: With those extremely violently crushed, roaring, and extremely sick,

original: gajāśvamathitaiś cānyair mahī kīrṇābhavat prabho
analyzed: gaja aśva mathitaiḥ ca anyaiḥ mahī kīrṇā abhavat prabho
translated: and others crushed by elephants and horses, the earth became strewn, my lord.

original: krośatāṃ kim idaṃ ko 'yaṃ kiṃ śabdaḥ kiṃ nu kiṃ kṛtam
analyzed: krośatām kim idam kaḥ yam kim śabdaḥ kim nu kim kṛtam
translated: What is this? Who is this? What sound? What is it? What has been done?

original: evaṃ teṣāṃ tadā drauṇir antakaḥ samapadyata
analyzed: evam teṣām tadā drauṇiḥ antakaḥ samapadyata
translated: Thus, Drona's son became like Death to them then.

original: apetaśastrasaṃnāhān saṃrabdhān pāṇḍusṛñjayān
analyzed: apeta śastra saṃnāhān saṃrabdhān pāṇḍu sṛñjayān
translated: To the enraged Pandus and Srinjayas, who had lost their weapons and armor,

original: prāhiṇon mṛtyulokāya drauṇiḥ praharatāṃ varaḥ
analyzed: prāhiṇot mṛtyu lokāya drauṇiḥ praharatām varaḥ
translated: Drona's son, the best of strikers, sent them to the world of the dead.

original: tatas tacchastravitrastā utpatanto bhayāturāḥ
analyzed: tatas tad śastra vitrastāḥ utpatantaḥ bhaya āturāḥ
translated: Then, terrified by those weapons, flying up in fear,

original: nidrāndhā naṣṭasaṃjñāś ca tatra tatra nililyire🔽ūrustambhagṛhītāś ca kaśmalābhihataujasaḥ
analyzed: nidrā andhāḥ naṣṭa saṃjñāḥ ca tatra tatra nililyire  ūru stambha gṛhītāḥ ca kaśmala abhihata ojasaḥ
translated: blind with sleep, and losing consciousness, they hid here and there.🔽Seized by paralysis of the thighs, their energy destroyed by depression,

original: vinadanto bhṛśaṃ trastāḥ saṃnyapeṣan parasparam
analyzed: vinadantaḥ bhṛśam trastāḥ saṃnyapeṣan parasparam
translated: roaring loudly, terrified, they rubbed against each other.

original: tato rathaṃ punar drauṇir āsthito bhīmanisvanam
analyzed: tatas ratham punar drauṇiḥ āsthitaḥ bhīma nisvanam
translated: Then Drona's son, mounted on his chariot again with a terrible roar,

original: dhanuṣpāṇiḥ śarair anyān preṣayad vai yamakṣayam🔽punar utpatataḥ kāṃś cid dūrād api narottamān
analyzed: dhanuṣpāṇiḥ śaraiḥ anyān preṣayat vai yama kṣayam  punar utpatataḥ kān cid dūrāt api nara uttamān
translated: with bow in hand, sent others with arrows to Yama's abode.🔽And from afar, he announced to the night of death those best of men who were flying up again,

original: śūrān saṃpatataś cānyān kālarātryai nyavedayat🔽tathaiva syandanāgreṇa pramathan sa vidhāvati
analyzed: śūrān saṃpatataḥ ca anyān kālarātryai nyavedayat  tathā eva syandana agreṇa pramathan sa vidhāvati
translated: and other heroes who were falling down.🔽And thus, crushing them with the front of his chariot, he ran about,

original: śaravarṣaiś ca vividhair avarṣac chātravāṃs tataḥ
analyzed: śara varṣaiḥ ca vividhaiḥ avarṣat śātravān tatas
translated: and with various showers of arrows, he rained down on his enemies.

original: punaś ca suvicitreṇa śatacandreṇa carmaṇā
analyzed: punar ca su vicitreṇa śata candreṇa carmaṇā
translated: And again, with a very colorful shield with a hundred moons,

original: tena cākāśavarṇena tadācarata so 'sinā
analyzed: tena ca ākāśa varṇena tadā ācarata saḥ sinā
translated: with that sky-colored one, he then moved about with his sword.

original: tathā sa śibiraṃ teṣāṃ drauṇir āhavadurmadaḥ
analyzed: tathā sa śibiram teṣām drauṇiḥ āhava durmadaḥ
translated: O king, Drona's son, invincible in battle, then agitated the camp of the Pandavas,

original: vyakṣobhayata rājendra mahāhradam iva dvipaḥ
analyzed: vyakṣobhayata rāja indra mahā hradam iva dvipaḥ
translated: like an elephant agitating a large lake.

original: utpetus tena śabdena yodhā rājan vicetasaḥ
analyzed: utpetuḥ tena śabdena yodhāḥ rājan vicetasaḥ
translated: O king, the warriors, bewildered by that sound,

original: nidrārtāś ca bhayārtāś ca vyadhāvanta tatas tataḥ🔽vikrośaṃ cukruśuś cānye bahubaddhaṃ tatas tataḥ
analyzed: nidrā ārtāḥ ca bhaya ārtāḥ ca vyadhāvanta tatas tatas  vikrośam cukruśuḥ ca anye bahu baddham tatas tatas
translated: afflicted by sleep and fear, ran hither and thither.🔽Some cried out and wailed in many ways.

original: visvaraṃ cukruśuś cānye bahvabaddhaṃ tathāvadan
analyzed: visvaram cukruśuḥ ca anye bahu abaddham tathā avadan
translated: Others wailed in discordant voices and spoke much nonsense.

original: na ca sma pratipadyante śastrāṇi vasanāni ca
analyzed: na ca sma pratipadyante śastrāṇi vasanāni ca
translated: They could not find their weapons and garments.

original: vimuktakeśāś cāpy anye nābhyajānan parasparam🔽utpatantaḥ pare bhītāḥ ke cit tatra tathābhraman
analyzed: vimukta keśāḥ ca api anye na abhyajānan parasparam  utpatantaḥ pare bhītāḥ ke cid tatra tathā abhraman
translated: Others, with dishevelled hair, did not recognize each other.🔽Some, frightened, jumped up and ran about there.

original: purīṣam asṛjan ke cit ke cin mūtraṃ prasusruvuḥ
analyzed: purīṣam asṛjan ke cit ke cit mūtram prasusruvuḥ
translated: Some excreted feces and some urinated.

original: bandhanāni ca rājendra saṃchidya turagā dvipāḥ
analyzed: bandhanāni ca rāja indra saṃchidya turagāḥ dvipāḥ
translated: O king, horses and elephants broke their bonds

original: samaṃ paryapataṃś cānye kurvanto mahad ākulam
analyzed: samam paryapatan ca anye kurvantaḥ mahat ākulam
translated: and fell down together, creating great confusion.

original: tatra ke cin narā bhītā vyalīyanta mahītale
analyzed: tatra ke cid narāḥ bhītāḥ vyalīyanta mahī tale
translated: There, some men, frightened, lay down on the ground.

original: tathaiva tān nipatitān apiṃṣan gajavājinaḥ
analyzed: tathā eva tān nipatitān apiṃṣan gaja vājinaḥ
translated: And elephants and horses trampled those who had fallen down.

original: tasmiṃs tathā vartamāne rakṣāṃsi puruṣarṣabha
analyzed: tasmin tathā vartamāne rakṣāṃsi puruṣa ṛṣabha
translated: O best of men, when that was happening, the demons,

original: tṛptāni vyanadann uccair mudā bharatasattama
analyzed: tṛptāni vyanadan uccais mudā bharata sattama
translated: O best of the Bharata lineage, the satisfied ones roared loudly with joy.

original: sa śabdaḥ prerito rājan bhūtasaṃghair mudā yutaiḥ
analyzed: sa śabdaḥ preritaḥ rājan bhūta saṃghaiḥ mudā yutaiḥ
translated: That sound was spread, O king, by the hosts of beings filled with joy,

original: apūrayad diśaḥ sarvā divaṃ cāpi mahāsvanaḥ
analyzed: apūrayat diśaḥ sarvāḥ divam ca api mahā svanaḥ
translated: And that great sound filled all the directions and even the sky.

original: teṣām ārtasvaraṃ śrutvā vitrastā gajavājinaḥ
analyzed: teṣām ārta svaram śrutvā vitrastāḥ gaja vājinaḥ
translated: Hearing their cries of distress, the elephants and horses became frightened,

original: muktāḥ paryapatan rājan mṛdnantaḥ śibire janam
analyzed: muktāḥ paryapatan rājan mṛdnantaḥ śibire janam
translated: And being released, they ran around, O king, crushing the people in the camp.

original: tais tatra paridhāvadbhiś caraṇodīritaṃ rajaḥ
analyzed: taiḥ tatra paridhāvadbhiḥ caraṇa udīritam rajaḥ
translated: The dust raised by their running there

original: akaroc chibire teṣāṃ rajanyāṃ dviguṇaṃ tamaḥ
analyzed: akarot śibire teṣām rajanyām dviguṇam tamaḥ
translated: Doubled the darkness in their camp that night.

original: tasmiṃs tamasi saṃjāte pramūḍhāḥ sarvato janāḥ
analyzed: tasmin tamasi saṃjāte pramūḍhāḥ sarvatas janāḥ
translated: When that darkness arose, the people were confused in every way,

original: nājānan pitaraḥ putrān bhrātṝn bhrātara eva ca🔽gajā gajān atikramya nirmanuṣyā hayā hayān
analyzed: na ajānan pitaraḥ putrān bhrātṝn bhrātaraḥ eva ca  gajāḥ gajān atikramya nirmanuṣyāḥ hayāḥ hayān
translated: The fathers did not recognize their sons, nor the brothers their brothers.

original: atāḍayaṃs tathābhañjaṃs tathāmṛdnaṃś ca bhārata🔽te bhagnāḥ prapatantaś ca nighnantaś ca parasparam
analyzed: atāḍayan tathā abhañjan tathā amṛdnan ca bhārata  te bhagnāḥ prapatantaḥ ca nighnantaḥ ca parasparam
translated: Elephants, with their riders killed, trampled other elephants, and horses, with their riders killed, trampled other horses, O descendant of Bharata.🔽They were shattered, falling down, and killing each other.

original: nyapātayanta ca parān pātayitvā tathāpiṣan
analyzed: nyapātayanta ca parān pātayitvā tathā apiṣan
translated: They brought down others and, having brought them down, crushed them.

original: vicetasaḥ sanidrāś ca tamasā cāvṛtā narāḥ
analyzed: vicetasaḥ sa nidrāḥ ca tamasā ca āvṛtāḥ narāḥ
translated: Men, bereft of consciousness, drowsy, and covered with darkness,

original: jaghnuḥ svān eva tatrātha kālenābhipracoditāḥ
analyzed: jaghnuḥ svān eva tatra atha kālena abhipracoditāḥ
translated: Struck down their own, being urged on by time.

original: tyaktvā dvārāṇi ca dvāḥsthās tathā gulmāṃś ca gaulmikāḥ
analyzed: tyaktvā dvārāṇi ca dvāḥsthāḥ tathā gulmān ca gaulmikāḥ
translated: The gatekeepers abandoned the gates, and the commanders abandoned their troops.

original: prādravanta yathāśakti kāṃdiśīkā vicetasaḥ
analyzed: prādravanta yathāśakti kāṃdiśīkāḥ vicetasaḥ
translated: They fled as best they could, confused and disoriented.

original: vipranaṣṭāś ca te 'nyonyaṃ nājānanta tadā vibho
analyzed: vipranaṣṭāḥ ca te nyonyam na ajānanta tadā vibho
translated: O lord, they were scattered and lost, and did not recognize each other at that time.

original: krośantas tāta putreti daivopahatacetasaḥ
analyzed: krośantaḥ tāta putra iti daiva upahata cetasaḥ
translated: Crying Father! and Son! their minds overwhelmed by fate,

original: palāyatāṃ diśas teṣāṃ svān apy utsṛjya bāndhavān🔽gotranāmabhir anyonyam ākrandanta tato janāḥ
analyzed: palāyatām diśaḥ teṣām svān api utsṛjya bāndhavān  gotra nāmabhiḥ anyonyam ākrandanta tatas janāḥ
translated: they fled in all directions, abandoning even their own relatives.🔽The people cried out to each other by their clan and family names.

original: hāhākāraṃ ca kurvāṇāḥ pṛthivyāṃ śerate pare
analyzed: hāhākāram ca kurvāṇāḥ pṛthivyām śerate pare
translated: Others lay down on the ground, wailing Alas! Alas!

original: tān buddhvā raṇamatto 'sau droṇaputro vyapothayat
analyzed: tān buddhvā raṇa mattaḥ sau droṇaputraḥ vyapothayat
translated: Having understood their situation, Drona's son, intoxicated with battle, crushed them.

original: tatrāpare vadhyamānā muhur muhur acetasaḥ
analyzed: tatra apare vadhyamānāḥ muhur muhur acetasaḥ
translated: There, others, being slaughtered, repeatedly lost consciousness.

original: śibirān niṣpatanti sma kṣatriyā bhayapīḍitāḥ
analyzed: śibirāt niṣpatanti sma kṣatriyāḥ bhaya pīḍitāḥ
translated: The Kshatriyas, afflicted with fear, emerged from their camps.

original: tāṃs tu niṣpatatas trastāñ śibirāñ jīvitaiṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: tān tu niṣpatataḥ trastām śibirām jīvita eṣiṇaḥ
translated: Those frightened ones, desiring to live, emerged from the camp.

original: kṛtavarmā kṛpaś caiva dvāradeśe nijaghnatuḥ🔽viśastrayantrakavacān muktakeśān kṛtāñjalīn🔽vepamānān kṣitau bhītān naiva kāṃś cid amuñcatām
analyzed: kṛtavarmā kṛpaḥ ca eva dvāra deśe nijaghnatuḥ  viśastra yantra kavacān muktakeśān kṛtāñjalīn  vepamānān kṣitau bhītān na eva kān cit amuñcatām
translated: Kritavarma and Kripa killed them at the entrance to the camp.🔽They did not release anyone who had left the camp, even if they were without weapons, machines, armor, with loose hair, with folded hands,🔽trembling, frightened on the ground.

original: nāmucyata tayoḥ kaś cin niṣkrāntaḥ śibirād bahiḥ
analyzed: na amucyata tayoḥ kaḥ cit niṣkrāntaḥ śibirāt bahis
translated: No one who emerged from the camp was released by them.

original: kṛpasya ca mahārāja hārdikyasya ca durmateḥ
analyzed: kṛpasya ca mahā rāja hārdikyasya ca durmateḥ
translated: And of Kripa and the evil-minded son of Hridika,

original: bhūyaś caiva cikīrṣantau droṇaputrasya tau priyam
analyzed: bhūyas ca eva cikīrṣantau droṇaputrasya tau priyam
translated: And again desiring to do what was dear to the son of Drona,

original: triṣu deśeṣu dadatuḥ śibirasya hutāśanam
analyzed: triṣu deśeṣu dadatuḥ śibirasya hutāśanam
translated: They set fire to the camp in three places.

original: tataḥ prakāśe śibire khaḍgena pitṛnandanaḥ
analyzed: tatas prakāśe śibire khaḍgena pitṛ nandanaḥ
translated: Then, when the camp was illuminated, the delighter of his father,

original: aśvatthāmā mahārāja vyacarat kṛtahastavat
analyzed: aśvatthāmā mahā rāja vyacarat kṛtahasta vat
translated: Ashvatthama, O great king, moved about with his sword, displaying his skill.

original: kāṃś cid āpatato vīrān aparāṃś ca pradhāvataḥ
analyzed: kān cit āpatataḥ vīrān aparān ca pradhāvataḥ
translated: Some heroes he struck as they were rushing towards him, and some as they were running away,

original: vyayojayata khaḍgena prāṇair dvijavaro narān🔽kāṃś cid yodhān sa khaḍgena madhye saṃchidya vīryavān
analyzed: vyayojayata khaḍgena prāṇaiḥ dvijavaraḥ narān  kān cit yodhān sa khaḍgena madhye saṃchidya vīryavān
translated: And that best of Brahmanas separated those men from their lives with his sword.🔽Some warriors, the valiant son of Drona, having cut in the middle with his sword,

original: apātayad droṇasutaḥ saṃrabdhas tilakāṇḍavat
analyzed: apātayat droṇa sutaḥ saṃrabdhaḥ tila kāṇḍa vat
translated: Brought down like sesamum stalks, O Bharata.

original: vinadadbhir bhṛśāyastair narāśvadviradottamaiḥ
analyzed: vinadadbhiḥ bhṛśa āyastaiḥ nara aśva dvirada uttamaiḥ
translated: With the best of men, horses and elephants roaring in great rage,

original: patitair abhavat kīrṇā medinī bharatarṣabha
analyzed: patitaiḥ abhavat kīrṇā medinī bharata ṛṣabha
translated: The earth became strewn with fallen ones, O best of the Bharata lineage.

original: mānuṣāṇāṃ sahasreṣu hateṣu patiteṣu ca
analyzed: mānuṣāṇām sahasreṣu hateṣu patiteṣu ca
translated: When thousands of men were killed and fell down,

original: udatiṣṭhan kabandhāni bahūny utthāya cāpatan🔽sāyudhān sāṅgadān bāhūn nicakarta śirāṃsi ca
analyzed: udatiṣṭhan kabandhāni bahūni utthāya ca apatan  sa āyudhān sa aṅgadān bāhūn nicakarta śirāṃsi ca
translated: Many headless bodies rose up and fell down again.🔽With weapons, armlets, arms and heads,

original: hastihastopamān ūrūn hastān pādāṃś ca bhārata
analyzed: hasti hasta upamān ūrūn hastān pādān ca bhārata
translated: And thighs like the trunks of elephants, hands and feet, O Bharata,

original: pṛṣṭhacchinnāñ śiraśchinnān pārśvacchinnāṃs tathāparān🔽samāsādyākarod drauṇiḥ kāṃś cic cāpi parāṅmukhān🔽madhyakāyān narān anyāṃś cicchedānyāṃś ca karṇataḥ
analyzed: pṛṣṭha chinnām śiraḥ chinnān pārśva chinnān tathā aparān  samāsādya akarot drauṇiḥ kān cit ca api parāṅmukhān  madhya kāyān narān anyān ciccheda anyān ca karṇataḥ
translated: Some had their backs cut off, some their heads, and others their sides.🔽Approaching them, Drona's son killed some who were turning away.🔽He cut off the bodies of some men from the middle, and the ears of others.

original: aṃsadeśe nihatyānyān kāye prāveśayac chiraḥ
analyzed: aṃsa deśe nihatya anyān kāye prāveśayat śiraḥ
translated: Having struck others on the shoulders, he inserted their heads into their bodies.

original: evaṃ vicaratas tasya nighnataḥ subahūn narān
analyzed: evam vicarataḥ tasya nighnataḥ su bahūn narān
translated: While he was thus moving about, killing many men,

original: tamasā rajanī ghorā babhau dāruṇadarśanā
analyzed: tamasā rajanī ghorā babhau dāruṇa darśanā
translated: the terrible night, with darkness, appeared dreadful to behold.

original: kiṃ cit prāṇaiś ca puruṣair hataiś cānyaiḥ sahasraśaḥ
analyzed: kim cit prāṇaiḥ ca puruṣaiḥ hataiḥ ca anyaiḥ sahasraśas
translated: With only a few men alive, and others killed by the thousands,

original: bahunā ca gajāśvena bhūr abhūd bhīmadarśanā
analyzed: bahunā ca gaja aśvena bhūḥ abhūt bhīma darśanā
translated: the earth became terrible to look at with many dead elephants and horses.

original: yakṣarakṣaḥsamākīrṇe rathāśvadvipadāruṇe
analyzed: yakṣa rakṣaḥ samākīrṇe ratha aśva dvipa dāruṇe
translated: Filled with Yakshas and Rakshasas, with chariots, horses and elephants,

original: kruddhena droṇaputreṇa saṃchinnāḥ prāpatan bhuvi
analyzed: kruddhena droṇaputreṇa saṃchinnāḥ prāpatan bhuvi
translated: the angry son of Drona cut them down and they fell to the ground.

original: mātṝr anye pitṝn anye bhrātṝn anye vicukruśuḥ
analyzed: mātṝḥ anye pitṝn anye bhrātṝn anye vicukruśuḥ
translated: Some cried out for their mothers, others for their fathers, and others for their brothers.

original: ke cid ūcur na tat kruddhair dhārtarāṣṭraiḥ kṛtaṃ raṇe
analyzed: ke cid ūcuḥ na tat kruddhaiḥ dhārtarāṣṭraiḥ kṛtam raṇe
translated: Some said, This was not done by the angry sons of Dhritarashtra in battle,

original: yat kṛtaṃ naḥ prasuptānāṃ rakṣobhiḥ krūrakarmabhiḥ
analyzed: yat kṛtam naḥ prasuptānām rakṣobhiḥ krūra karmabhiḥ
translated: but by us, who were sleeping, by Rakshasas of cruel deeds.

original: asāṃnidhyād dhi pārthānām idaṃ naḥ kadanaṃ kṛtam
analyzed: asāṃnidhyāt hi pārthānām idam naḥ kadanam kṛtam
translated: This massacre was done to us because the Parthas were not present.

original: na devāsuragandharvair na yakṣair na ca rākṣasaiḥ
analyzed: na deva asura gandharvaiḥ na yakṣaiḥ na ca rākṣasaiḥ
translated: He cannot be conquered by gods, demons, gandharvas, yakshas, or rakshasas,

original: śakyo vijetuṃ kaunteyo goptā yasya janārdanaḥ
analyzed: śakyaḥ vijetum kaunteyaḥ goptā yasya janārdanaḥ
translated: Whose protector is Janardana, the son of Kunti.

original: brahmaṇyaḥ satyavāg dāntaḥ sarvabhūtānukampakaḥ🔽na ca suptaṃ pramattaṃ vā nyastaśastraṃ kṛtāñjalim
analyzed: na ca suptam pramattam vā nyasta śastram kṛtāñjalim
translated: He is devoted to Brahmanas, truthful, self-controlled, and compassionate towards all beings.🔽Partha Dhananjaya does not kill one who is asleep, intoxicated, laid down his weapons, or has his hands folded in supplication,

original: dhāvantaṃ muktakeśaṃ vā hanti pārtho dhanaṃjayaḥ
analyzed: dhāvantam muktakeśam vā hanti pārthaḥ dhanaṃjayaḥ
translated: Or one who is running away with disheveled hair.

original: tad idaṃ naḥ kṛtaṃ ghoraṃ rakṣobhiḥ krūrakarmabhiḥ
analyzed: tat idam naḥ kṛtam ghoram rakṣobhiḥ krūra karmabhiḥ
translated: This terrible deed has been done by us by the rakshasas of cruel deeds.

original: iti lālapyamānāḥ sma śerate bahavo janāḥ
analyzed: iti lālapyamānāḥ sma śerate bahavaḥ janāḥ
translated: Thus lamenting, many people lay down.

original: stanatāṃ ca manuṣyāṇām apareṣāṃ ca kūjatām
analyzed: stanatām ca manuṣyāṇām apareṣām ca kūjatām
translated: Of the men who were shouting and others who were moaning,

original: tato muhūrtāt prāśāmyat sa śabdas tumulo mahān
analyzed: tatas muhūrtāt prāśāmyat sa śabdaḥ tumulaḥ mahān
translated: Then in a moment, that great tumultuous sound subsided,

original: śoṇitavyatiṣiktāyāṃ vasudhāyāṃ ca bhūmipa
analyzed: śoṇita vyatiṣiktāyām vasudhāyām ca bhūmipa
translated: And on the ground drenched with blood, O king,

original: tad rajas tumulaṃ ghoraṃ kṣaṇenāntaradhīyata
analyzed: tat rajaḥ tumulam ghoram kṣaṇena antaradhīyata
translated: That terrible and tumultuous dust disappeared in an instant.

original: saṃveṣṭamānān udvignān nirutsāhān sahasraśaḥ
analyzed: saṃveṣṭamānān udvignān nirutsāhān sahasraśas
translated: Thousands of them were trembling, anxious, and dispirited,

original: nyapātayan narān kruddhaḥ paśūn paśupatir yathā
analyzed: nyapātayat narān kruddhaḥ paśūn paśupatiḥ yathā
translated: The enraged one brought them down like Pashupati (Shiva) does to animals.

original: anyonyaṃ saṃpariṣvajya śayānān dravato 'parān
analyzed: anyonyam saṃpariṣvajya śayānān parān
translated: Others were lying down embracing each other, and others were running away,

original: saṃlīnān yudhyamānāṃś ca sarvān drauṇir apothayat
analyzed: saṃlīnān yudhyamānān ca sarvān drauṇiḥ apothayat
translated: Drona's son crushed all of them, whether they were hiding or fighting.

original: dahyamānā hutāśena vadhyamānāś ca tena te
analyzed: dahyamānāḥ hutāśena vadhyamānāḥ ca tena te
translated: They were being burned by the fire and killed by him.

original: parasparaṃ tadā yodhā anayan yamasādanam🔽tasyā rajanyās tv ardhena pāṇḍavānāṃ mahad balam
analyzed: parasparam tadā yodhāḥ anayan yama sādanam  tasyāḥ rajanyāḥ tu ardhena pāṇḍavānām mahat balam
