translated: The warriors then led each other to Yama's abode.🔽In half of that night, O lord of kings, Drona's son

original: gamayām āsa rājendra drauṇir yamaniveśanam🔽niśācarāṇāṃ sattvānāṃ sa rātrir harṣavardhinī
analyzed: gamayām āsa rāja indra drauṇiḥ yama niveśanam  niśā carāṇām sattvānām sa rātriḥ harṣa vardhinī
translated: sent the great army of the Pandavas to Yama's abode.🔽That night increased the delight of the creatures moving in the night.

original: āsīn naragajāśvānāṃ raudrī kṣayakarī bhṛśam
analyzed: āsīt nara gaja aśvānām raudrī kṣaya karī bhṛśam
translated: It was extremely terrible and destructive of men, elephants and horses.

original: tatrādṛśyanta rakṣāṃsi piśācāś ca pṛthagvidhāḥ
analyzed: tatra adṛśyanta rakṣāṃsi piśācāḥ ca pṛthagvidhāḥ
translated: There were seen various kinds of demons and goblins,

original: khādanto naramāṃsāni pibantaḥ śoṇitāni ca
analyzed: khādantaḥ nara māṃsāni pibantaḥ śoṇitāni ca
translated: eating human flesh and drinking blood.

original: karālāḥ piṅgalā raudrāḥ śailadantā rajasvalāḥ
analyzed: karālāḥ piṅgalāḥ raudrāḥ śaila dantāḥ rajasvalāḥ
translated: They were terrible, tawny, fierce, with mountain-like teeth, menstruating,

original: jaṭilā dīrghasakthāś ca pañcapādā mahodarāḥ
analyzed: jaṭilāḥ dīrgha sakthāḥ ca pañca pādāḥ mahā udarāḥ
translated: with matted hair, long thighs, five feet, and large bellies.

original: paścād aṅgulayo rūkṣā virūpā bhairavasvanāḥ🔽ghaṭajānavo 'tihrasvāś ca nīlakaṇṭhā vibhīṣaṇāḥ
analyzed: paścāt aṅgulayaḥ rūkṣāḥ virūpāḥ bhairava svanāḥ  ghaṭa jānavaḥ ti hrasvāḥ ca nīla kaṇṭhāḥ vibhīṣaṇāḥ
translated: Their fingers were rough, misshapen, and made frightful sounds.🔽They had pot-like knees, were extremely short, had blue throats, and were terrifying.

original: saputradārāḥ sukrūrā durdarśanasunirghṛṇāḥ
analyzed: sa putra dārāḥ su krūrāḥ durdarśana su nirghṛṇāḥ
translated: They were very cruel, along with their sons and wives, and were extremely inauspicious and merciless.

original: vividhāni ca rūpāṇi tatrādṛśyanta rakṣasām
analyzed: vividhāni ca rūpāṇi tatra adṛśyanta rakṣasām
translated: Various forms of demons were seen there.

original: pītvā ca śoṇitaṃ hṛṣṭāḥ prānṛtyan gaṇaśo 'pare
analyzed: pītvā ca śoṇitam hṛṣṭāḥ prānṛtyan pare
translated: Having drunk blood, some danced in groups, delighted.

original: idaṃ varam idaṃ medhyam idaṃ svādv iti cābruvan🔽medomajjāsthiraktānāṃ vasānāṃ ca bhṛśāsitāḥ
analyzed: idam varam idam medhyam idam svādu iti ca abruvan  medaḥ majja asthi raktānām vasānām ca bhṛśa āsitāḥ
translated: They said, This is excellent, this is pure, this is sweet.🔽 Extremely fond of fat, marrow, flesh, blood and grease,

original: paramāṃsāni khādantaḥ kravyādā māṃsajīvinaḥ
analyzed: para māṃsāni khādantaḥ kravyādāḥ māṃsa jīvinaḥ
translated: carnivorous creatures, living on flesh,

original: vasāṃ cāpy apare pītvā paryadhāvan vikukṣilāḥ
analyzed: vasām ca api apare pītvā paryadhāvan vikukṣilāḥ
translated: drinking grease, some ran around with distended bellies.

original: nānāvaktrās tathā raudrāḥ kravyādāḥ piśitāśinaḥ
analyzed: nānā vaktrāḥ tathā raudrāḥ kravyādāḥ piśita āśinaḥ
translated: Having various faces, terrible, carnivorous, flesh-eating,

original: ayutāni ca tatrāsan prayutāny arbudāni ca
analyzed: ayutāni ca tatra āsan prayutāni arbudāni ca
translated: there were myriads, millions and billions

original: rakṣasāṃ ghorarūpāṇāṃ mahatāṃ krūrakarmaṇām
analyzed: rakṣasām ghora rūpāṇām mahatām krūra karmaṇām
translated: of demons, of terrible form, of great size, of cruel deeds.

original: muditānāṃ vitṛptānāṃ tasmin mahati vaiśase
analyzed: muditānām vitṛptānām tasmin mahati vaiśase
translated: Delighted, insatiable, in that great carnage,

original: sametāni bahūny āsan bhūtāni ca janādhipa
analyzed: sametāni bahūni āsan bhūtāni ca janādhipa
translated: many beings assembled, O lord of men.

original: pratyūṣakāle śibirāt pratigantum iyeṣa saḥ
analyzed: pratyūṣa kāle śibirāt pratigantum iyeṣa saḥ
translated: At dawn, he was about to leave the camp,

original: nṛśoṇitāvasiktasya drauṇer āsīd asitsaruḥ
analyzed: nṛ śoṇita avasiktasya drauṇeḥ āsīt asi tsaruḥ
translated: the black sinew of Drona's son, drenched with human blood,

original: pāṇinā saha saṃśliṣṭa ekībhūta iva prabho🔽sa niḥśeṣān arīn kṛtvā virarāja janakṣaye
analyzed: pāṇinā saha saṃśliṣṭaḥ ekībhūtaḥ iva prabho  sa niḥśeṣān arīn kṛtvā virarāja jana kṣaye
translated: was joined with his hand, as if becoming one with him, O lord.🔽Having destroyed all enemies, he shone in the destruction of men,

original: yugānte sarvabhūtāni bhasma kṛtveva pāvakaḥ
analyzed: yuga ante sarva bhūtāni bhasma kṛtvā iva pāvakaḥ
translated: like the fire that has reduced all beings to ashes at the end of the yuga.

original: yathāpratijñaṃ tat karma kṛtvā drauṇāyaniḥ prabho
analyzed: yathāpratijñam tat karma kṛtvā drauṇāyaniḥ prabho
translated: Having accomplished that deed as promised, the son of Drona, O lord,

original: durgamāṃ padavīṃ kṛtvā pitur āsīd gatajvaraḥ
analyzed: durgamām padavīm kṛtvā pituḥ āsīt gata jvaraḥ
translated: Having made a path difficult to traverse, was relieved of his fever for his father.

original: yathaiva saṃsuptajane śibire prāviśan niśi
analyzed: yathā eva saṃsupta jane śibire prāviśat niśi
translated: Just as he had entered the camp at night when people were asleep,

original: tathaiva hatvā niḥśabde niścakrāma nararṣabhaḥ
analyzed: tathā eva hatvā niḥśabde niścakrāma nara ṛṣabhaḥ
translated: In the same way, having killed silently, the bull among men left.

original: niṣkramya śibirāt tasmāt tābhyāṃ saṃgamya vīryavān🔽ācakhyau karma tat sarvaṃ hṛṣṭaḥ saṃharṣayan vibho
analyzed: niṣkramya śibirāt tasmāt tābhyām saṃgamya vīryavān  ācakhyau karma tat sarvam hṛṣṭaḥ saṃharṣayan vibho
translated: Having emerged from that camp, the valiant one met with them,🔽And joyfully told them all about the deed, delighting them, O lord.

original: tāv apy ācakhyatus tasmai priyaṃ priyakarau tadā
analyzed: tau api ācakhyatuḥ tasmai priyam priya karau tadā
translated: Those two, the doers of what is pleasing, then told him what was pleasing to them,

original: pāñcālān sṛñjayāṃś caiva vinikṛttān sahasraśaḥ
analyzed: pāñcālān sṛñjayān ca eva vinikṛttān sahasraśas
translated: About the Panchalas and Srinjayas being cut down by the thousands.

original: prītyā coccair udakrośaṃs tathaivāsphoṭayaṃs talān
analyzed: prītyā ca uccais udakrośan tathā eva asphoṭayan talān
translated: And out of affection, they loudly shouted and clapped their palms.

original: evaṃvidhā hi sā rātriḥ somakānāṃ janakṣaye
analyzed: evaṃvidhā hi sā rātriḥ somakānām jana kṣaye
translated: Such was that night, in the destruction of the Somakas,

original: prasuptānāṃ pramattānām āsīt subhṛśadāruṇā
analyzed: prasuptānām pramattānām āsīt su bhṛśa dāruṇā
translated: For those who were sleeping and heedless, it was extremely terrible.

original: asaṃśayaṃ hi kālasya paryāyo duratikramaḥ
analyzed: asaṃśayam hi kālasya paryāyaḥ duratikramaḥ
translated: There is no doubt that the course of time is irresistible,

original: tādṛśā nihatā yatra kṛtvāsmākaṃ janakṣayam
analyzed: tādṛśāḥ nihatāḥ yatra kṛtvā asmākam jana kṣayam
translated: Where such [heroes] were killed, having caused a great destruction of our people.

original: dhṛtarāṣṭra uvāca
analyzed: dhṛtarāṣṭraḥ uvāca
translated: Dhritarashtra said:

original: prāg eva sumahat karma drauṇir etan mahārathaḥ
analyzed: prāk eva su mahat karma drauṇiḥ etat mahā rathaḥ
translated: Even before this, the great chariot Drona's son had performed a great deed,

original: nākarod īdṛśaṃ kasmān matputravijaye dhṛtaḥ
analyzed: na akarot īdṛśam kasmāt mad putra vijaye dhṛtaḥ
translated: Why did he not do this before, being devoted to the victory of my sons?

original: atha kasmād dhate kṣatre karmedaṃ kṛtavān asau
analyzed: atha kasmāt hate kṣatre karma idam kṛtavān asau
translated: And why did he do this act after the Kshatriyas had been slain?

original: droṇaputro maheṣvāsas tan me śaṃsitum arhasi
analyzed: droṇaputraḥ mahā iṣvāsaḥ tat me śaṃsitum arhasi
translated: The son of Drona is a great bowman. It behoveth thee to tell me this.

original: saṃjaya uvāca
analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca
translated: Sanjaya said:

original: teṣāṃ nūnaṃ bhayān nāsau kṛtavān kurunandana
analyzed: teṣām nūnam bhayāt na asau kṛtavān kuru nandana
translated: O delighter of the Kurus, he did not do this through fear of them.

original: asāṃnidhyād dhi pārthānāṃ keśavasya ca dhīmataḥ
analyzed: asāṃnidhyāt hi pārthānām keśavasya ca dhīmataḥ
translated: For, in the absence of the Parthas and the wise Keshava,

original: sātyakeś cāpi karmedaṃ droṇaputreṇa sādhitam
analyzed: sātyakeḥ ca api karma idam droṇaputreṇa sādhitam
translated: And also of Satyaki, this act was accomplished by the son of Drona.

original: na hi teṣāṃ samakṣaṃ tān hanyād api marutpatiḥ
analyzed: na hi teṣām samakṣam tān hanyāt api marutpatiḥ
translated: For, in their presence, even the lord of the Maruts could not have slain them.

original: etad īdṛśakaṃ vṛttaṃ rājan suptajane vibho
analyzed: etat īdṛśakam vṛttam rājan supta jane vibho
translated: This is the kind of incident that occurred, O king, when people were asleep, O lord.

original: tato janakṣayaṃ kṛtvā pāṇḍavānāṃ mahātyayam
analyzed: tatas jana kṣayam kṛtvā pāṇḍavānām mahā atyayam
translated: Then, having caused a great slaughter of the Pandavas,

original: diṣṭyā diṣṭyeti cānyonyaṃ sametyocur mahārathāḥ
analyzed: diṣṭyā diṣṭyā iti ca anyonyam sametya ūcuḥ mahā rathāḥ
translated: The mighty car-warriors, having met together, said to each other, 'By good luck, by good luck!'

original: paryaṣvajat tato drauṇis tābhyāṃ ca pratinanditaḥ
analyzed: paryaṣvajat tatas drauṇiḥ tābhyām ca pratinanditaḥ
translated: Then Drona's son embraced them and was welcomed by them.

original: idaṃ harṣāc ca sumahad ādade vākyam uttamam
analyzed: idam harṣāt ca su mahat ādade vākyam uttamam
translated: And out of joy, he uttered these excellent words:

original: pāñcālā nihatāḥ sarve draupadeyāś ca sarvaśaḥ
analyzed: pāñcālāḥ nihatāḥ sarve draupadeyāḥ ca sarvaśas
translated: 'All the Panchalas have been slain, and all the sons of Draupadi.

original: somakā matsyaśeṣāś ca sarve vinihatā mayā
analyzed: somakāḥ matsya śeṣāḥ ca sarve vinihatāḥ mayā
translated: The Somakas and the remaining Matsyas have all been slain by me.

original: idānīṃ kṛtakṛtyāḥ sma yāma tatraiva māciram
analyzed: idānīm kṛtakṛtyāḥ sma yāma tatra eva māciram
translated: Now that we have accomplished our purpose, let us go there without delay.'

original: yadi jīvati no rājā tasmai śaṃsāmahe priyam
analyzed: yadi jīvati naḥ rājā tasmai śaṃsāmahe priyam
translated: If the king is alive, we will tell him this good news.

original: saṃjaya uvāca
analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca
translated: Sanjaya said:

original: te hatvā sarvapāñcālān draupadeyāṃś ca sarvaśaḥ
analyzed: te hatvā sarva pāñcālān draupadeyān ca sarvaśas
translated: Having killed all the Panchalas and all the sons of Draupadi,

original: agacchan sahitās tatra yatra duryodhano hataḥ
analyzed: agacchan sahitāḥ tatra yatra duryodhanaḥ hataḥ
translated: they went together to where Duryodhana was lying.

original: gatvā cainam apaśyaṃs te kiṃ cit prāṇaṃ narādhipam
analyzed: gatvā ca enam apaśyan te kim cit prāṇam narādhipam
translated: Having gone there, they saw that king, who was still alive,

original: tato rathebhyaḥ praskandya parivavrus tavātmajam
analyzed: tatas rathebhyaḥ praskandya parivavruḥ tava ātmajam
translated: but barely. They jumped down from their chariots and surrounded your son.

original: taṃ bhagnasakthaṃ rājendra kṛcchraprāṇam acetasam
analyzed: tam bhagna saktham rāja indra kṛcchra prāṇam acetasam
translated: O lord of kings, they saw him, his thighs broken, his life in danger, unconscious,

original: vamantaṃ rudhiraṃ vaktrād apaśyan vasudhātale
analyzed: vamantam rudhiram vaktrāt apaśyan vasudhā tale
translated: vomiting blood from his mouth, lying on the ground.

original: vṛtaṃ samantād bahubhiḥ śvāpadair ghoradarśanaiḥ🔽śālāvṛkagaṇaiś caiva bhakṣayiṣyadbhir antikāt
analyzed: vṛtam samantāt bahubhiḥ śvāpadaiḥ ghora darśanaiḥ  śālāvṛka gaṇaiḥ ca eva bhakṣayiṣyadbhiḥ antikāt
translated: He was surrounded on all sides by many terrible-looking beasts,🔽and by packs of jackals, who were about to devour him from close by.

original: nivārayantaṃ kṛcchrāt tāñ śvāpadān saṃcikhādiṣūn
analyzed: nivārayantam kṛcchrāt tām śvāpadān saṃcikhādiṣūn
translated: He was trying to ward off those beasts, which were eager to eat him, with difficulty.

original: viveṣṭamānaṃ mahyāṃ ca subhṛśaṃ gāḍhavedanam
analyzed: viveṣṭamānam mahyām ca su bhṛśam gāḍha vedanam
translated: He was writhing on the ground, in extreme pain.

original: taṃ śayānaṃ mahātmānaṃ bhūmau svarudhirokṣitam
analyzed: tam śayānam mahātmānam bhūmau sva rudhira ukṣitam
translated: They saw that great-souled one lying on the ground, covered in his own blood,

original: hataśiṣṭās trayo vīrāḥ śokārtāḥ paryavārayan
analyzed: hata śiṣṭāḥ trayaḥ vīrāḥ śoka ārtāḥ paryavārayan
translated: and the three remaining heroes, afflicted with grief, surrounded him.

original: aśvatthāmā kṛpaś caiva kṛtavarmā ca sātvataḥ
analyzed: aśvatthāmā kṛpaḥ ca eva kṛtavarmā ca sātvataḥ
translated: Ashvatthama, Kripa, and Kritavarma of the Satvata clan,

original: tais tribhiḥ śoṇitādigdhair niḥśvasadbhir mahārathaiḥ
analyzed: taiḥ tribhiḥ śoṇita ādigdhaiḥ niḥśvasadbhiḥ mahā rathaiḥ
translated: Those three great warriors, covered in blood and sighing,

original: śuśubhe saṃvṛto rājā vedī tribhir ivāgnibhiḥ🔽te taṃ śayānaṃ saṃprekṣya rājānam atathocitam
analyzed: śuśubhe saṃvṛtaḥ rājā vedī tribhiḥ iva agnibhiḥ  te tam śayānam saṃprekṣya rājānam a tathā ucitam
translated: surrounded the king, who shone like a sacrificial altar with three fires.🔽Seeing the king lying there, who did not deserve such a fate,

original: duḥkhād aśrūṇy amuñcanta niḥśvāsaparamā nṛpaḥ
analyzed: duḥkhāt aśrūṇi amuñcanta niḥśvāsa paramāḥ nṛpaḥ
translated: they shed tears out of sorrow, O king, and sighed deeply.

original: aviṣahyena duḥkhena tatas te rurudus trayaḥ🔽tatas te rudhiraṃ hastair mukhān nirmṛjya tasya ha
analyzed: aviṣahyena duḥkhena tatas te ruruduḥ trayaḥ  tatas te rudhiram hastaiḥ mukhāt nirmṛjya tasya ha
translated: Then those three wept in unbearable grief,🔽wiping the blood from his face with their hands.

original: raṇe rājñaḥ śayānasya kṛpaṇaṃ paryadevayan
analyzed: raṇe rājñaḥ śayānasya kṛpaṇam paryadevayan
translated: While the king lay dead, they lamented piteously.

original: kṛpa uvāca
analyzed: kṛpaḥ uvāca
translated: Kripa said:

original: na daivasyātibhāro 'sti yad ayaṃ rudhirokṣitaḥ
analyzed: na daivasya atibhāraḥ asti yat ayam rudhira ukṣitaḥ
translated: There is no burden too heavy for fate, that this man, covered in blood,

original: ekādaśacamūbhartā śete duryodhano hataḥ
analyzed: ekādaśa camū bhartā śete duryodhanaḥ hataḥ
translated: the lord of eleven armies, should lie dead, Duryodhana.

original: paśya cāmīkarābhasya cāmīkaravibhūṣitām
analyzed: paśya cāmīkara ābhasya cāmīkara vibhūṣitām
translated: See the iron club, adorned with gold,

original: gadāṃ gadāpriyasyemāṃ samīpe patitāṃ bhuvi
analyzed: gadām gadāpriyasya imām samīpe patitām bhuvi
translated: of the one who loved the club, fallen near him on the ground.

original: iyam enaṃ gadā śūraṃ na jahāti raṇe raṇe
analyzed: iyam enam gadā śūram na jahāti raṇe raṇe
translated: This club never leaves the hero in battle,

original: svargāyāpi vrajantaṃ hi na jahāti yaśasvinam
analyzed: svargāya api vrajantam hi na jahāti yaśasvinam
translated: even when he goes to heaven, it does not leave the famous one.

original: paśyemāṃ saha vīreṇa jāmbūnadavibhūṣitām
analyzed: paśya imām saha vīreṇa jāmbūnada vibhūṣitām
translated: See this golden club, adorned with gold,

original: śayānāṃ śayane dharme bhāryāṃ prītimatīm iva
analyzed: śayānām śayane dharme bhāryām prītimatīm iva
translated: lying with the hero, like a loving wife on a bed of virtue.

original: yo vai mūrdhāvasiktānām agre yātaḥ paraṃtapaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ vai mūrdhāvasiktānām agre yātaḥ paraṃtapaḥ
translated: He who, the scorcher of enemies, went ahead of those whose heads were anointed,

original: sa hato grasate pāṃsūn paśya kālasya paryayam
analyzed: sa hataḥ grasate pāṃsūn paśya kālasya paryayam
translated: is now dead, swallowing dust. Behold the change of time!

original: yenājau nihatā bhūmāv aśerata purā dviṣaḥ
analyzed: yena ājau nihatāḥ bhūmau aśerata purā dviṣaḥ
translated: By whom in battle, enemies were killed and lay down on the ground in the past,

original: sa bhūmau nihataḥ śete kururājaḥ parair ayam
analyzed: sa bhūmau nihataḥ śete kuru rājaḥ paraiḥ ayam
translated: that king of the Kurus is now killed and lies on the ground by his enemies.

original: bhayān namanti rājāno yasya sma śatasaṃghaśaḥ
analyzed: bhayāt namanti rājānaḥ yasya sma śata saṃghaśas
translated: Before whom hundreds of kings used to bow down in fear,

original: sa vīraśayane śete kravyādbhiḥ parivāritaḥ
analyzed: sa vīra śayane śete kravyādbhiḥ parivāritaḥ
translated: he now lies on a hero's bed, surrounded by carnivorous beasts.

original: upāsata nṛpāḥ pūrvam arthahetor yam īśvaram
analyzed: upāsata nṛpāḥ pūrvam artha hetoḥ yam īśvaram
translated: Whom kings used to serve in the past for the sake of wealth,

original: dhik sadyo nihataḥ śete paśya kālasya paryayam
analyzed: dhik sadyas nihataḥ śete paśya kālasya paryayam
translated: alas, he is now killed and lies down. Behold the change of time!

original: tam upāsyanty araṇye 'dya mṛgagomāyavaḥ sma ha🔽upāsate ca taṃ hy adya kravyādā māṃsahetavaḥ
analyzed: tam upāsyanti araṇye dya mṛga gomāyavaḥ sma ha  upāsate ca tam hi adya kravyādāḥ māṃsa hetavaḥ
translated: In the forest, deer and jackals now serve him,🔽and carnivorous beasts now serve him for the sake of meat.

original: tam upāsanta kauravyaṃ kravyādā māṃsagṛddhinaḥ
analyzed: tam upāsanta kauravyam kravyādāḥ māṃsa gṛddhinaḥ
translated: Carnivorous beasts, greedy for meat, now serve that descendant of Kuru.

original: saṃjaya uvāca🔽taṃ śayānaṃ nṛpaśreṣṭhaṃ tato bharatasattama
analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca  tam śayānam nṛpa śreṣṭham tatas bharata sattama
translated: Sanjaya said:

original: aśvatthāmā samālokya karuṇaṃ paryadevayat
analyzed: aśvatthāmā samālokya karuṇam paryadevayat
translated: Then, O best of the Bharata race, Ashvatthama, beholding that best of kings lying on the ground, lamented piteously,

original: āhus tvāṃ rājaśārdūla mukhyaṃ sarvadhanuṣmatām
analyzed: āhuḥ tvām rāja śārdūla mukhyam sarva dhanuṣmatām
translated: saying, They call you, O tiger among kings, the foremost of all bowmen,

original: dhanādhyakṣopamaṃ yuddhe śiṣyaṃ saṃkarṣaṇasya ha
analyzed: dhanādhyakṣa upamam yuddhe śiṣyam saṃkarṣaṇasya ha
translated: the disciple of Sankarshana, equal to the lord of treasures in battle.

original: kathaṃ vivaram adrākṣīd bhīmasenas tavānagha
analyzed: katham vivaram adrākṣīt bhīmasenaḥ tava anagha
translated: O sinless one, how did Bhimasena find a weakness in you?

original: balinaḥ kṛtino nityaṃ sa ca pāpātmavān nṛpa
analyzed: balinaḥ kṛtinaḥ nityam sa ca pāpa ātmavān nṛpa
translated: You were always strong and skilled, and he is sinful, O king.

original: kālo nūnaṃ mahārāja loke 'smin balavattaraḥ
analyzed: kālaḥ nūnam mahā rāja loke smin balavattaraḥ
translated: Time, O great king, is certainly stronger in this world.

original: paśyāmo nihataṃ tvāṃ ced bhīmasenena saṃyuge🔽kathaṃ tvāṃ sarvadharmajñaṃ kṣudraḥ pāpo vṛkodaraḥ
analyzed: paśyāmaḥ nihatam tvām ced bhīmasenena saṃyuge  katham tvām sarva dharma jñam kṣudraḥ pāpaḥ vṛkodaraḥ
translated: If we see you killed by Bhimasena in battle,🔽how could the wretched sinner Vrikodara, the slow-witted one,

original: nikṛtyā hatavān mando nūnaṃ kālo duratyayaḥ
analyzed: nikṛtyā hatavān mandaḥ nūnam kālaḥ duratyayaḥ
translated: have deceitfully killed you, who know all duties? Time is indeed difficult to overcome.

original: dharmayuddhe hy adharmeṇa samāhūyaujasā mṛdhe
analyzed: dharma yuddhe hi adharmeṇa samāhūya ojasā mṛdhe
translated: In a righteous battle, you were deceitfully challenged and struck down in the battle by the powerful Bhimasena

original: gadayā bhīmasenena nirbhinne sakthinī tava🔽adharmeṇa hatasyājau mṛdyamānaṃ padā śiraḥ
analyzed: gadayā bhīmasenena nirbhinne sakthinī tava  adharmeṇa hatasya ājau mṛdyamānam padā śiraḥ
translated: with his mace, and your thighs were shattered by Bhimasena.🔽Your head was crushed with his foot on the field of battle by the wretched one, while you were being killed unjustly.

original: yad upekṣitavān kṣudro dhik tam astu yudhiṣṭhiram
analyzed: yat upekṣitavān kṣudraḥ dhik tam astu yudhiṣṭhiram
translated: Shame on Yudhishthira, who ignored it.

original: dhig astu tasya pāpasya mithyā dharmiṣṭhavādinaḥ
analyzed: dhik astu tasya pāpasya mithyā dharmiṣṭha vādinaḥ
translated: Shame on that sinner, who falsely claims to be righteous.

original: idaṃ pāpaṃ bhīmasenaḥ kṛtavāñ chadmanā ca yat
analyzed: idam pāpam bhīmasenaḥ kṛtavān chadmanā ca yat
translated: This sin was committed by Bhimasena through deceit.

original: yuddheṣv apavadiṣyanti yodhā nūnaṃ vṛkodaram
analyzed: yuddheṣu apavadiṣyanti yodhāḥ nūnam vṛkodaram
translated: The warriors will certainly censure Vrikodara in battles.

original: yāvat sthāsyanti bhūtāni nikṛtyā hy asi pātitaḥ
analyzed: yāvat sthāsyanti bhūtāni nikṛtyā hi asi pātitaḥ
translated: As long as beings remain, you have been deceitfully brought down.

original: nanu rāmo 'bravīd rājaṃs tvāṃ sadā yadunandanaḥ
analyzed: nanu rāmaḥ bravīt rājan tvām sadā yadu nandanaḥ
translated: O king, did not Rama, the delighter of the Yadus, always tell you:

original: duryodhanasamo nāsti gadayā iti vīryavān
analyzed: duryodhana samaḥ nā asti gadayā iti vīryavān
translated: There is none equal to Duryodhana in mace-fighting.

original: ślāghate tvāṃ hi vārṣṇeyo rājan saṃsatsu bhārata
analyzed: ślāghate tvām hi vārṣṇeyaḥ rājan saṃsatsu bhārata
translated: O king, Varshneya (Krishna) praises you in assemblies, O Bharata,

original: suśiṣyo mama kauravyo gadāyuddha iti prabho🔽yāṃ gatiṃ kṣatriyasyāhuḥ praśastāṃ paramarṣayaḥ
analyzed: su śiṣyaḥ mama kauravyaḥ gadā yuddhe iti prabho  yām gatim kṣatriyasya āhuḥ praśastām parama ṛṣayaḥ
translated: saying, The Kourava (Duryodhana) is a good disciple of mine in mace-fighting, O lord.🔽The supreme sages have declared the most praiseworthy end for a kshatriya

original: hatasyābhimukhasyājau prāptas tvam asi tāṃ gatim
analyzed: hatasya abhimukhasya ājau prāptaḥ tvam asi tām gatim
translated: to be attained by one who is killed while facing the enemy in battle.

original: duryodhana na śocāmi tvām ahaṃ puruṣarṣabha
analyzed: duryodhana na śocāmi tvām aham puruṣa ṛṣabha
translated: You have attained that end, O Duryodhana. I do not grieve for you, O best of men.

original: hataputrāṃ tu śocāmi gāndhārīṃ pitaraṃ ca te
analyzed: hata putrām tu śocāmi gāndhārīm pitaram ca te
translated: But I grieve for Gandhari and your father, whose sons have been killed.

original: yāv anāthau kṛtau vīra tvayā nāthena vadhyatā
analyzed: yau anāthau kṛtau vīra tvayā nāthena vadhyatā
translated: Those two helpless ones have been made helpless by you, their protector, O hero.

original: bhikṣukau vicariṣyete śocantau pṛthivīm imām
analyzed: bhikṣukau vicariṣyete śocantau pṛthivīm imām
translated: Mourning, they will wander over this earth like beggars.

original: dhig astu kṛṣṇaṃ vārṣṇeyam arjunaṃ cāpi durmatim
analyzed: dhik astu kṛṣṇam vārṣṇeyam arjunam ca api durmatim
translated: Shame on Varshneya Krishna and the evil-minded Arjuna!

original: dharmajñamāninau yau tvāṃ vadhyamānam upekṣatām
analyzed: dharma jña māninau yau tvām vadhyamānam upekṣatām
translated: They who, though priding themselves on their knowledge of dharma, ignored you being killed.

original: pāṇḍavāś cāpi te sarve kiṃ vakṣyanti narādhipān
analyzed: pāṇḍavāḥ ca api te sarve kim vakṣyanti narādhipān
translated: And what will all the Pandavas say to the kings?

original: kathaṃ duryodhano 'smābhir hata ity anapatrapāḥ
analyzed: katham duryodhanaḥ smābhiḥ hataḥ iti anapatrapāḥ
translated: How was Duryodhana killed by us? without any shame.

original: dhanyas tvam asi gāndhāre yas tvam āyodhane hataḥ
analyzed: dhanyaḥ tvam asi gāndhāre yaḥ tvam āyodhane hataḥ
translated: Blessed are you, O son of Gandhari, that you were killed in battle.

original: prayāto 'bhimukhaḥ śatrūn dharmeṇa puruṣarṣabha
analyzed: prayātaḥ abhimukhaḥ śatrūn dharmeṇa puruṣa ṛṣabha
translated: O bull among men, he went forth facing the enemies righteously.

original: hataputrā hi gāndhārī nihatajñātibāndhavā
analyzed: hata putrā hi gāndhārī nihata jñāti bāndhavā
translated: Gandhari, whose sons and kinsmen have been killed,

original: prajñācakṣuś ca durdharṣaḥ kāṃ gatiṃ pratipatsyate
analyzed: prajñācakṣuḥ ca durdharṣaḥ kām gatim pratipatsyate
translated: and the invincible one with the eye of wisdom, what end will he attain?

original: dhig astu kṛtavarmāṇaṃ māṃ kṛpaṃ ca mahāratham
analyzed: dhik astu kṛtavarmāṇam mām kṛpam ca mahā ratham
translated: Shame on Kritavarma, and on me, the great warrior Kripa,

original: ye vayaṃ na gatāḥ svargaṃ tvāṃ puraskṛtya pārthivam
analyzed: ye vayam na gatāḥ svargam tvām puraskṛtya pārthivam
translated: that we have not gone to heaven, placing that king at the forefront.

original: dātāraṃ sarvakāmānāṃ rakṣitāraṃ prajāhitam
analyzed: dātāram sarva kāmānām rakṣitāram prajā hitam
translated: The giver of all desires, the protector, the benefactor of the people,

original: yad vayaṃ nānugacchāmas tvāṃ dhig asmān narādhamān
analyzed: yat vayam na anugacchāmaḥ tvām dhik asmān nara adhamān
translated: that we do not follow you, shame on us, the worst of men.

original: kṛpasya tava vīryeṇa mama caiva pituś ca me
analyzed: kṛpasya tava vīryeṇa mama ca eva pituḥ ca me
translated: By the valor of Kripa, of my father, and of myself,

original: sabhṛtyānāṃ naravyāghra ratnavanti gṛhāṇi ca
analyzed: sa bhṛtyānām nara vyāghra ratnavanti gṛhāṇi ca
translated: O tiger among men, with our servants, our houses full of jewels,

original: bhavatprasādād asmābhiḥ samitraiḥ sahabāndhavaiḥ
analyzed: bhavat prasādāt asmābhiḥ sa mitraiḥ saha bāndhavaiḥ
translated: by your grace, along with our friends and relatives,

original: avāptāḥ kratavo mukhyā bahavo bhūridakṣiṇāḥ
analyzed: avāptāḥ kratavaḥ mukhyāḥ bahavaḥ bhūri dakṣiṇāḥ
translated: we have performed many great sacrifices with abundant gifts.

original: kutaś cāpīdṛśaṃ sārtham upalapsyāmahe vayam
analyzed: kutas ca api īdṛśam sārtham upalapsyāmahe vayam
translated: And from where will we obtain such wealth again,

original: yādṛśena puraskṛtya tvaṃ gataḥ sarvapārthivān
analyzed: yādṛśena puraskṛtya tvam gataḥ sarva pārthivān
translated: by which we could have placed you at the forefront of all the kings?

original: vayam eva trayo rājan gacchantaṃ paramāṃ gatim
analyzed: vayam eva trayaḥ rājan gacchantam paramām gatim
translated: O king, we three alone, following you to the highest end,

original: yad vai tvāṃ nānugacchāmas tena tapsyāmahe vayam
analyzed: yat vai tvām na anugacchāmaḥ tena tapsyāmahe vayam
translated: We will be tormented by the thought that we are not following you.

original: tvatsvargahīnā hīnārthāḥ smarantaḥ sukṛtasya te
analyzed: tvad svarga hīnāḥ hīna arthāḥ smarantaḥ sukṛtasya te
translated: Deprived of heaven and deprived of our purpose, remembering your good deeds,

original: kiṃ nāma tad bhavet karma yena tvānuvrajema vai
analyzed: kim nāma tat bhavet karma yena tvā anuvrajema vai
translated: What deed could there be by which we could follow you?

original: duḥkhaṃ nūnaṃ kuruśreṣṭha cariṣyāmo mahīm imām
analyzed: duḥkham nūnam kuru śreṣṭha cariṣyāmaḥ mahīm imām
translated: We will certainly wander on this earth, O best of the Kurus, in misery.

original: hīnānāṃ nas tvayā rājan kutaḥ śāntiḥ kutaḥ sukham
analyzed: hīnānām naḥ tvayā rājan kutas śāntiḥ kutas sukham
translated: O king, deprived of you, how can there be peace for us, how can there be happiness?

original: gatvaitāṃs tu mahārāja sametya tvaṃ mahārathān
analyzed: gatvā etān tu mahā rāja sametya tvam mahā rathān
translated: O great king, having gone to those great warriors and met them,

original: yathāśreṣṭhaṃ yathājyeṣṭhaṃ pūjayer vacanān mama
analyzed: yathāśreṣṭham yathājyeṣṭham pūjayeḥ vacanāt mama
translated: you should honor them according to their seniority and according to my words.

original: ācāryaṃ pūjayitvā ca ketuṃ sarvadhanuṣmatām
analyzed: ācāryam pūjayitvā ca ketum sarva dhanuṣmatām
translated: Having honored the teacher, the banner of all archers,

original: hataṃ mayādya śaṃsethā dhṛṣṭadyumnaṃ narādhipa
analyzed: hatam mayā adya śaṃsethāḥ dhṛṣṭadyumnam narādhipa
translated: you should tell the king that Dhrishtadyumna has been killed by me today.

original: pariṣvajethā rājānaṃ bāhlikaṃ sumahāratham
analyzed: pariṣvajethāḥ rājānam bāhlikam su mahā ratham
translated: You should embrace the king, the great warrior Bahlika,

original: saindhavaṃ somadattaṃ ca bhūriśravasam eva ca
analyzed: saindhavam somadattam ca bhūriśravasam eva ca
translated: and also Saindhava, Somadatta, and Bhurishrava,

original: tathā pūrvagatān anyān svargaṃ pārthivasattamān
analyzed: tathā pūrva gatān anyān svargam pārthiva sattamān
translated: and also the other former great kings who have gone to heaven.

original: asmad vākyāt pariṣvajya pṛcchethās tvam anāmayam
analyzed: asmat vākyāt pariṣvajya pṛcchethāḥ tvam anāmayam
translated: Having embraced them with our words, you should ask about their welfare.

original: ity evam uktvā rājānaṃ bhagnasaktham acetasam
analyzed: iti evam uktvā rājānam bhagna saktham acetasam
translated: Having spoken thus to the king, whose thighs were broken and who was unconscious,

original: aśvatthāmā samudvīkṣya punar vacanam abravīt
analyzed: aśvatthāmā samudvīkṣya punar vacanam abravīt
translated: Seeing this, Ashvatthama again spoke these words:

original: duryodhana jīvasi ced vācaṃ śrotrasukhāṃ śṛṇu
analyzed: duryodhana jīvasi ced vācam śrotra sukhām śṛṇu
translated: If you are still alive, O Duryodhana, listen to these words that are pleasing to the ears:

original: sapta pāṇḍavataḥ śeṣā dhārtarāṣṭrās trayo vayam
analyzed: sapta pāṇḍavataḥ śeṣāḥ dhārtarāṣṭrāḥ trayaḥ vayam
translated: There are seven remaining from the Pandavas, and three of us from the sons of Dhritarashtra,

original: te caiva bhrātaraḥ pañca vāsudevo 'tha sātyakiḥ
analyzed: te ca eva bhrātaraḥ pañca sātyakiḥ
translated: And those five brothers, and Vasudeva, and Satyaki,

original: ahaṃ ca kṛtavarmā ca kṛpaḥ śāradvatas tathā
analyzed: aham ca kṛtavarmā ca kṛpaḥ śāradvataḥ tathā
translated: And myself, and Kritavarma, and Kripa Sharadvatas son,

original: draupadeyā hatāḥ sarve dhṛṣṭadyumnasya cātmajāḥ
analyzed: draupadeyāḥ hatāḥ sarve dhṛṣṭadyumnasya ca ātmajāḥ
translated: All the sons of Draupadi have been killed, and the sons of Dhrishtadyumna,

original: pāñcālā nihatāḥ sarve matsyaśeṣaṃ ca bhārata
analyzed: pāñcālāḥ nihatāḥ sarve matsya śeṣam ca bhārata
translated: All the Panchalas have been killed, and the remaining Matsyas, O descendant of Bharata,

original: kṛte pratikṛtaṃ paśya hataputrā hi pāṇḍavāḥ
analyzed: kṛte pratikṛtam paśya hata putrāḥ hi pāṇḍavāḥ
translated: See that I have retaliated, for the sons of the Pandavas have been killed.

original: sauptike śibiraṃ teṣāṃ hataṃ sanaravāhanam
analyzed: sauptike śibiram teṣām hatam sa nara vāhanam
translated: In the night, their camp was destroyed along with the men and vehicles.

original: mayā ca pāpakarmāsau dhṛṣṭadyumno mahīpate
analyzed: mayā ca pāpa karmā asau dhṛṣṭadyumnaḥ mahīpate
translated: And by me, O lord of the earth, that sinful Dhrishtadyumna

original: praviśya śibiraṃ rātrau paśumāreṇa māritaḥ🔽duryodhanas tu tāṃ vācaṃ niśamya manasaḥ priyām
analyzed: praviśya śibiram rātrau paśumāreṇa māritaḥ  duryodhanaḥ tu tām vācam niśamya manasaḥ priyām
translated: Was killed in the night by a deer-hunter after entering the camp.🔽But Duryodhana, having heard those words that were pleasing to the mind,

original: pratilabhya punaś ceta idaṃ vacanam abravīt🔽na me 'karot tad gāṅgeyo na karṇo na ca te pitā
analyzed: pratilabhya punar cetaḥ idam vacanam abravīt  na me karot tat gāṅgeyaḥ na karṇaḥ na ca te pitā
translated: Regaining his senses, spoke these words:

original: yat tvayā kṛpabhojābhyāṃ sahitenādya me kṛtam
analyzed: yat tvayā kṛpa bhojābhyām sahitena adya me kṛtam
translated: Neither Gangeya, nor Karna, nor your father did what you have done for me today, together with Kripa and Bhoja.

original: sa cet senāpatiḥ kṣudro hataḥ sārdhaṃ śikhaṇḍinā
analyzed: sa ced senāpatiḥ kṣudraḥ hataḥ sārdham śikhaṇḍinā
translated: If that mean-spirited general, along with Shikhandi, is killed,

original: tena manye maghavatā samam ātmānam adya vai
analyzed: tena manye maghavatā samam ātmānam adya vai
translated: I consider myself equal to Maghavan today.

original: svasti prāpnuta bhadraṃ vaḥ svarge naḥ saṃgamaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: svasti prāpnuta bhadram vaḥ svarge naḥ saṃgamaḥ punar
translated: May you attain well-being and prosperity. May we meet again in heaven.

original: ity evam uktvā tūṣṇīṃ sa kururājo mahāmanāḥ
analyzed: iti evam uktvā tūṣṇīm sa kuru rājaḥ mahā manāḥ
translated: Having said this, the great-minded king of the Kurus remained silent.

original: samutsṛṣṭeṣu vidhinā prāṇeṣu gaganaṃ gate
analyzed: samutsṛṣṭeṣu vidhinā prāṇeṣu gaganam gate
translated: When his life was released according to the rules and he went to heaven,

original: vidyuttejaḥsamaḥ prāyāt kṛpādyāḥ kautukānvitāḥ
analyzed: vidyut tejaḥ samaḥ prāyāt kṛpā ādyāḥ kautuka anvitāḥ
translated: Kripa and the others, full of curiosity, followed him, who was like lightning in brilliance.

original: ākrāmata divaṃ puṇyāṃ śarīraṃ kṣitim āviśat
analyzed: ākrāmata divam puṇyām śarīram kṣitim āviśat
translated: He ascended to the sacred heaven, and his body entered the earth.

original: evaṃ te nidhanaṃ yātaḥ putro duryodhano nṛpa
analyzed: evam te nidhanam yātaḥ putraḥ duryodhanaḥ nṛpa
translated: Thus your son, King Duryodhana, met his end.

original: agre yātvā raṇe śūraḥ paścād vinihataḥ paraiḥ
analyzed: agre yātvā raṇe śūraḥ paścāt vinihataḥ paraiḥ
translated: Having gone to the front of the battle as a hero, he was killed by the enemy in the end.

original: prāṇān udasṛjad vīraḥ suhṛdāṃ śokam ādadhat
analyzed: prāṇān udasṛjat vīraḥ suhṛdām śokam ādadhat
translated: The hero gave up his life, causing grief to his friends.

original: tatheti te pariṣvaktāḥ pariṣvajya ca taṃ nṛpam
analyzed: tathā iti te pariṣvaktāḥ pariṣvajya ca tam nṛpam
translated: Saying So be it, they embraced him and he embraced the king.

original: vimānasaṃstham ākāśe dadṛśus te suyodhanam
analyzed: vimāna saṃstham ākāśe dadṛśuḥ te suyodhanam
translated: They saw Suyodhana in an aerial chariot in the sky,

original: aindrair gaṇaiḥ parivṛtaṃ divyamālyānulepanam
analyzed: aindraiḥ gaṇaiḥ parivṛtam divya mālya anulepanam
translated: surrounded by the attendants of Indra, anointed with divine garlands and unguents,

original: sādhu sādhv iti bhāṣantaṃ kṛpādīnāṃ punaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: sādhu sādhu iti bhāṣantam kṛpā ādīnām punar punar
translated: again and again saying Well done! Well done! to Kripa and the others.

original: punaḥ punaḥ prekṣamāṇāḥ svakān āruruhū rathān
analyzed: punar punar prekṣamāṇāḥ svakān āruruhuḥ rathān
translated: Looking again and again, they mounted their own chariots.

original: ity evaṃ tava putrasya niśamya karuṇāṃ giram
analyzed: iti evam tava putrasya niśamya karuṇām giram
translated: Having heard these piteous words of your son in this way,

original: pratyūṣakāle śokārtaḥ prādhāvaṃ nagaraṃ prati
analyzed: pratyūṣa kāle śoka ārtaḥ prādhāvam nagaram prati
translated: at dawn, afflicted with grief, I ran towards the city.

original: evam eṣa kṣayo vṛttaḥ kurupāṇḍavasenayoḥ
analyzed: evam eṣa kṣayaḥ vṛttaḥ kuru pāṇḍava senayoḥ
translated: Thus has occurred the destruction of the armies of the Kurus and Pandavas,

original: ghoro viśasano raudro rājan durmantrite tava
analyzed: ghoraḥ viśasanaḥ raudraḥ rājan durmantrite tava
translated: terrible, violent and destructive, O king, due to your evil counsel.

original: tava putre gate svargaṃ śokārtasya mamānagha
analyzed: tava putre gate svargam śoka ārtasya mama anagha
translated: When your son has gone to heaven, O sinless one, I am afflicted with grief,

original: ṛṣidattaṃ pranaṣṭaṃ tad divyadarśitvam adya vai
analyzed: ṛṣi dattam pranaṣṭam tat divya darśi tvam adya vai
translated: and today that divine insight given by the sages has been lost to me.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: iti śrutvā sa nṛpatiḥ putrajñātivadhaṃ tadā
analyzed: iti śrutvā sa nṛpatiḥ putra jñāti vadham tadā
translated: Having heard this news of the slaughter of his sons and relatives, the king

original: niḥśvasya dīrgham uṣṇaṃ ca tataś cintāparo 'bhavat
analyzed: niḥśvasya dīrgham uṣṇam ca tatas cintā paraḥ bhavat
translated: sighed deeply and hot, and then became absorbed in thought.

original: nārāyaṇaṃ namaskṛtya naraṃ caiva narottamam
analyzed: nārāyaṇam namaskṛtya naram ca eva narottamam
translated: Having saluted Narayana and also Nara, the best of men,

original: devīṃ sarasvatīṃ caiva tato jayam udīrayet
analyzed: devīm sarasvatīm ca eva tatas jayam udīrayet
translated: and also the goddess Sarasvati, one should then utter Jaya (victory).

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: tasyāṃ rātryāṃ vyatītāyāṃ dhṛṣṭadyumnasya sārathiḥ
analyzed: tasyām rātryām vyatītāyām dhṛṣṭadyumnasya sārathiḥ
translated: When that night had passed, the charioteer of Dhrishtadyumna

original: śaśaṃsa dharmarājāya sauptike kadanaṃ kṛtam
analyzed: śaśaṃsa dharmarājāya sauptike kadanam kṛtam
translated: reported to Dharmaraja the carnage committed during the night.

original: draupadeyā mahārāja drupadasyātmajaiḥ saha
analyzed: draupadeyāḥ mahā rāja drupadasya ātmajaiḥ saha
translated: The sons of Draupadi, O great king, along with the sons of Drupada,

original: pramattā niśi viśvastāḥ svapantaḥ śibire svake
analyzed: pramattāḥ niśi viśvastāḥ svapantaḥ śibire svake
translated: while sleeping in their own camp at night, trusting in their own strength,🔽were all killed by the son of Subala, the mighty car-warrior Ashvatthama.

original: kṛtavarmaṇā nṛśaṃsena gautamena kṛpeṇa ca
analyzed: kṛtavarmaṇā nṛśaṃsena gautamena kṛpeṇa ca
translated: By the cruel Kritavarman, Gautama, Kripa,

original: aśvatthāmnā ca pāpena hataṃ vaḥ śibiraṃ niśi
analyzed: aśvatthāmnā ca pāpena hatam vaḥ śibiram niśi
translated: And the sinful Ashvatthama, your camp was destroyed at night.

original: etair naragajāśvānāṃ prāsaśaktiparaśvadhaiḥ
analyzed: etaiḥ nara gaja aśvānām prāsa śakti paraśvadhaiḥ
translated: By them, with javelins, spears and axes,

original: sahasrāṇi nikṛntadbhir niḥśeṣaṃ te balaṃ kṛtam
analyzed: sahasrāṇi nikṛntadbhiḥ niḥśeṣam te balam kṛtam
translated: Cutting down thousands of men, elephants and horses, your army was completely destroyed.

original: vighuṣṭanānāvihagaphalabhārānatasya ha🔽chidyamānasya mahato vanasyeva paraśvadhaiḥ
analyzed: vighuṣṭa nānā vihaga phala bhāra ānatasya ha  chidyamānasya mahataḥ vanasya iva paraśvadhaiḥ
translated: Of a tree bent down with the weight of fruits of various kinds of birds,🔽When it is being cut down with axes, a great sound is heard,

original: śuśruve sumahāñ śabdo balasya tava bhārata
analyzed: śuśruve su mahān śabdaḥ balasya tava bhārata
translated: So was heard the great sound of your army, O descendant of Bharata.

original: aham eko 'vaśiṣṭas tu tasmāt sainyān mahīpate
analyzed: aham ekaḥ vaśiṣṭaḥ tu tasmāt sainyāt mahīpate
translated: I alone remain from that army, O lord of the earth,

original: muktaḥ kathaṃ cid dharmātman vyagrasya kṛtavarmaṇaḥ
analyzed: muktaḥ katham cit dharma ātman vyagrasya kṛtavarmaṇaḥ
translated: Somehow released, O righteous one, from the distracted Kritavarma.

original: tac chrutvā vākyam aśivaṃ kuntīputro yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
analyzed: tat śrutvā vākyam aśivam kuntī putraḥ yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: Hearing those inauspicious words, Yudhishthira, the son of Kunti,

original: papāta mahyāṃ durdharṣaḥ putraśokasamanvitaḥ
analyzed: papāta mahyām durdharṣaḥ putra śoka samanvitaḥ
translated: Fell on the ground, invincible, filled with grief for his sons.

original: taṃ patantam abhikramya parijagrāha sātyakiḥ
analyzed: tam patantam abhikramya parijagrāha sātyakiḥ
translated: As he was falling, Satyaki approached and caught him,

original: bhīmaseno 'rjunaś caiva mādrīputrau ca pāṇḍavau🔽labdhacetās tu kaunteyaḥ śokavihvalayā girā
analyzed: bhīmasenaḥ rjunaḥ ca eva mādrī putrau ca pāṇḍavau  labdha cetāḥ tu kaunteyaḥ śoka vihvalayā girā
translated: As also Bhimasena, Arjuna, and the Pandava sons of Madri.🔽But the son of Kunti, having regained consciousness, with a voice choked with grief,

original: jitvā śatrūñ jitaḥ paścāt paryadevayad āturaḥ
analyzed: jitvā śatrūm jitaḥ paścāt paryadevayat āturaḥ
translated: Having conquered the enemies, was later defeated and lamented in pain.

original: durvidā gatir arthānām api ye divyacakṣuṣaḥ
analyzed: durvidā gatiḥ arthānām api ye divya cakṣuṣaḥ
translated: The course of events is difficult to understand, even for those with divine sight.

original: jīyamānā jayanty anye jayamānā vayaṃ jitāḥ🔽hatvā bhrātṝn vayasyāṃś ca pitṝn putrān suhṛdgaṇān
analyzed: jīyamānāḥ jayanti anye jayamānāḥ vayam jitāḥ  hatvā bhrātṝn vayasyān ca pitṝn putrān suhṛd gaṇān
translated: Others, though defeated, are victorious; we, though victorious, are defeated.🔽Having killed our brothers, friends, fathers, sons, groups of well-wishers,

original: bandhūn amātyān pautrāṃś ca jitvā sarvāñ jitā vayam
analyzed: bandhūn amātyān pautrān ca jitvā sarvām jitāḥ vayam
translated: relatives, ministers, and grandsons, having conquered all, we are the ones who are conquered.

original: anartho hy arthasaṃkāśas tathārtho 'narthadarśanaḥ
analyzed: anarthaḥ hi artha saṃkāśaḥ tathā arthaḥ nartha darśanaḥ
translated: For misfortune appears as good fortune, and likewise good fortune appears as misfortune.

original: jayo 'yam ajayākāro jayas tasmāt parājayaḥ
analyzed: jayaḥ yam ajaya ākāraḥ jayaḥ tasmāt parājayaḥ
translated: This victory has the form of defeat; therefore victory is defeat.

original: yaṃ jitvā tapyate paścād āpanna iva durmatiḥ
analyzed: yam jitvā tapyate paścāt āpannaḥ iva durmatiḥ
translated: Having won it, one repents afterwards, like an evil-minded person who has fallen into misfortune.

original: kathaṃ manyeta vijayaṃ tato jitataraḥ paraiḥ🔽yeṣām arthāya pāpasya dhig jayasya suhṛdvadhe
analyzed: katham manyeta vijayam tatas jitataraḥ paraiḥ  yeṣām arthāya pāpasya dhik jayasya suhṛd vadhe
translated: How can one consider victory when one is defeated even more by the enemy?🔽For the sake of whom one commits sin, shame on that victory, on the killing of a friend.

original: nirjitair apramattair hi vijitā jitakāśinaḥ🔽karṇinālīkadaṃṣṭrasya khaḍgajihvasya saṃyuge🔽cāpavyāttasya raudrasya jyātalasvananādinaḥ
analyzed: nirjitaiḥ apramattaiḥ hi vijitāḥ jita kāśinaḥ  karṇi nālīka daṃṣṭrasya khaḍga jihvasya saṃyuge  cāpa vyāttasya raudrasya jyā tala svana nādinaḥ
translated: For those who are conquered, who are heedful, who are victorious, who desire victory,🔽In battle, with tusks like lances and spikes, with a tongue like a sword,🔽With a bow wide open, with a terrible roar, with the sound of the bowstring and palms,

original: kruddhasya narasiṃhasya saṃgrāmeṣv apalāyinaḥ
analyzed: kruddhasya nara siṃhasya saṃgrāmeṣu apalāyinaḥ
translated: Of the angry lion among men, who does not flee from battle,

original: ye vyamucyanta karṇasya pramādāt ta ime hatāḥ
analyzed: ye vyamucyanta karṇasya pramādāt te ime hatāḥ
translated: Those who escaped Karna's carelessness, they are the ones who are killed.

original: rathahradaṃ śaravarṣormimantaṃ /
analyzed: ratha hradam śara varṣa ūrmimantam
translated: The chariot-lake, with the waves of showers of arrows,

original: ratnācitaṃ vāhanarājiyuktam🔽śaktyṛṣṭimīnadhvajanāganakraṃ /
analyzed: ratna ācitam vāhana rāji yuktam  śakti ṛṣṭi mīna dhvaja nāga nakram
translated: Adorned with jewels, equipped with the best of vehicles,🔽With spears, swords, fish, flags, elephants, and alligators,

original: śarāsanāvartamaheṣuphenam🔽saṃgrāmacandrodayavegavelaṃ /
analyzed: śarāsana āvarta mahā iṣu phenam  saṃgrāma candra udaya vega velam
translated: With bows as whirlpools, great arrows as foam,🔽With the rising tide of the moon of battle as its speed,

original: droṇārṇavaṃ jyātalanemighoṣam🔽ye terur uccāvacaśastranaubhis /🔽te rājaputrā nihatāḥ pramādāt
analyzed: droṇa arṇavam jyā tala nemi ghoṣam  ye teruḥ uccāvaca śastra naubhiḥ  te rāja putrāḥ nihatāḥ pramādāt
translated: The ocean of Drona, with the sound of bowstrings and palms as its waves,🔽Those who crossed it with boats of various weapons, high and low,

original: na hi pramādāt paramo 'sti kaś cid /🔽vadho narāṇām iha jīvaloke🔽pramattam arthā hi naraṃ samantāt /
analyzed: na hi pramādāt paramaḥ sti kaḥ cit  vadhaḥ narāṇām iha jīva loke  pramattam arthāḥ hi naram samantāt
translated: Those princes were killed through carelessness. There is nothing greater🔽Than carelessness for the destruction of men in this world of the living.🔽For wealth abandons a careless man on all sides,

original: tyajanty anarthāś ca samāviśanti🔽dhvajottamāgrocchritadhūmaketuṃ /🔽śarārciṣaṃ kopamahāsamīram
analyzed: tyajanti anarthāḥ ca samāviśanti  dhvaja uttama agra ucchrita dhūmaketum  śara arciṣam kopa mahā samīram
translated: And misfortunes befall him.🔽With the victory banner raised high like a smoke banner,🔽With arrow-flames, the great wind of anger,

original: mahādhanurjyātalanemighoṣaṃ /
analyzed: mahā dhanuḥ jyā tala nemi ghoṣam
translated: With the sound of the great bowstring and palms as its waves,

original: tanutranānāvidhaśastrahomam🔽mahācamūkakṣavarābhipannaṃ /🔽mahāhave bhīṣmamahādavāgnim
analyzed: tanutra nānāvidha śastra homam  mahā camū kakṣa vara abhipannam  mahā āhave bhīṣma mahā dava agnim
translated: With the sacrifice of various kinds of armor and weapons,🔽Engulfed by the great army like a great fire,

original: ye sehur āttāyataśastravegaṃ /🔽te rājaputrā nihatāḥ pramādāt
analyzed: ye sehuḥ ātta āyata śastra vegam  te rāja putrāḥ nihatāḥ pramādāt
translated: Those who endured the speed of the extended weapons of the great battle,

original: na hi pramattena nareṇa labhyā /
analyzed: na hi pramattena nareṇa labhyā
translated: Those princes were killed through carelessness. A careless man cannot obtain

original: vidyā tapaḥ śrīr vipulaṃ yaśo vā🔽paśyāpramādena nihatya śatrūn /
analyzed: vidyā tapaḥ śrīḥ vipulam yaśaḥ vā  paśya apramādena nihatya śatrūn
translated: Knowledge, austerities, great glory, or fame.🔽See how Indra, having conquered all enemies through carefulness,

original: sarvān mahendraṃ sukham edhamānam
analyzed: sarvān mahā indram sukham edhamānam
translated: Enjoys great happiness.

original: indropamān pārthivaputrapautrān /
analyzed: indra upamān pārthiva putra pautrān
translated: The sons and grandsons of kings, who were like Indra,

original: paśyāviśeṣeṇa hatān pramādāt🔽tīrtvā samudraṃ vaṇijaḥ samṛddhāḥ /
analyzed: paśya a viśeṣeṇa hatān pramādāt  tīrtvā samudram vaṇijaḥ samṛddhāḥ
translated: Have been killed without distinction due to carelessness.🔽Merchants who have crossed the prosperous ocean,

original: sannāḥ kunadyām iva helamānāḥ
analyzed: sannāḥ kunadyām iva helamānāḥ
translated: Are being carried away by a small river as if in play.

original: amarṣitair ye nihatāḥ śayānā /
analyzed: amarṣitaiḥ ye nihatāḥ śayānā
translated: Those who were killed while lying down by the intolerant ones,

original: niḥsaṃśayaṃ te tridivaṃ prapannāḥ
analyzed: niḥsaṃśayam te tridivam prapannāḥ
translated: Have undoubtedly gone to heaven.

original: kṛṣṇāṃ nu śocāmi kathaṃ na sādhvīṃ /
analyzed: kṛṣṇām nu śocāmi katham na sādhvīm
translated: But how can I not grieve for the virtuous Krishna?

original: śokārṇave sādya vinaṅkṣyatīti
analyzed: śoka arṇave sā adya vinaṅkṣyati iti
translated: She will surely perish today in an ocean of grief.

original: bhrātṝṃś ca putrāṃś ca hatān niśamya /
analyzed: bhrātṝn ca putrān ca hatān niśamya
translated: Having heard that her brothers and sons have been killed,

original: pāñcālarājaṃ pitaraṃ ca vṛddham
analyzed: pāñcāla rājam pitaram ca vṛddham
translated: And her old father, the king of Panchala,

original: dhruvaṃ visaṃjñā patitā pṛthivyāṃ /
analyzed: dhruvam visaṃjñā patitā pṛthivyām
translated: She will certainly fall unconscious on the ground.

original: sā śeṣyate śokakṛśāṅgayaṣṭiḥ
analyzed: sā śeṣyate śoka kṛśa aṅgayaṣṭiḥ
translated: Her slender body will become emaciated with grief.

original: tac chokajaṃ duḥkham apārayantī /
analyzed: tat śoka jam duḥkham a pārayantī
translated: Unable to bear that grief born of sorrow,

original: kathaṃ bhaviṣyaty ucitā sukhānām
analyzed: katham bhaviṣyati ucitā sukhānām
translated: How will she, who deserves happiness,

original: putrakṣayabhrātṛvadhapraṇunnā /
analyzed: putra kṣaya bhrātṛ vadha praṇunnā
translated: Driven by the loss of her sons and the death of her brothers,

original: pradahyamāneva hutāśanena
analyzed: pradahyamānā iva hutāśanena
translated: Burn as if by a fire?

original: ity evam ārtaḥ paridevayan sa /
analyzed: iti evam ārtaḥ paridevayan sa
translated: Thus lamenting in sorrow,

original: rājā kurūṇāṃ nakulaṃ babhāṣe
analyzed: rājā kurūṇām nakulam babhāṣe
translated: The king of the Kurus spoke to Nakula,

original: gacchānayainām iha mandabhāgyāṃ /
analyzed: gaccha anayā enām iha mandabhāgyām
translated: Go and bring her here, the unfortunate one,

original: samātṛpakṣām iti rājaputrīm
analyzed: sa mātṛ pakṣām iti rāja putrīm
translated: The princess with her mother's relatives.

original: mādrīsutas tat parigṛhya vākyaṃ /
analyzed: mādrī sutaḥ tat parigṛhya vākyam
translated: Madri's son accepted those words,

original: dharmeṇa dharmapratimasya rājñaḥ
analyzed: dharmeṇa dharmapratimasya rājñaḥ
translated: The king, who was like Dharma in righteousness,

original: yayau rathenālayam āśu devyāḥ /
analyzed: yayau rathena ālayam āśu devyāḥ
translated: quickly went by chariot to the temple of the goddess.

original: pāñcālarājasya ca yatra dārāḥ
analyzed: pāñcāla rājasya ca yatra dārāḥ
translated: Where the wives of the Panchala king were kept,

original: prasthāpya mādrīsutam ājamīḍhaḥ /
analyzed: prasthāpya mādrī sutam ājamīḍhaḥ
translated: after the son of Madri, of the Ajamida dynasty, had left.

original: śokārditas taiḥ sahitaḥ suhṛdbhiḥ
analyzed: śoka arditaḥ taiḥ sahitaḥ suhṛdbhiḥ
translated: Afflicted with grief, he went with his friends,

original: rorūyamāṇaḥ prayayau sutānām /
analyzed: rorūyamāṇaḥ prayayau sutānām
translated: weeping, to the place where his sons were.

original: āyodhanaṃ bhūtagaṇānukīrṇam
analyzed: āyodhanam bhūta gaṇa anukīrṇam
translated: The battlefield, strewn with hordes of spirits,

original: sa tat praviśyāśivam ugrarūpaṃ /
analyzed: sa tat praviśya aśivam ugra rūpam
translated: he entered it, inauspicious and fierce-looking.

original: dadarśa putrān suhṛdaḥ sakhīṃś ca🔽bhūmau śayānān rudhirārdragātrān /
analyzed: dadarśa putrān suhṛdaḥ sakhīn ca  bhūmau śayānān rudhira ārdra gātrān
translated: He saw his sons, friends and allies🔽lying on the ground, their bodies drenched in blood.

original: vibhinnabhagnāpahṛtottamāṅgān🔽sa tāṃs tu dṛṣṭvā bhṛśam ārtarūpo /
analyzed: vibhinna bhagna apahṛta uttamāṅgān  sa tān tu dṛṣṭvā bhṛśam ārta rūpaḥ
translated: Their limbs mangled, broken and their heads severed,

original: yudhiṣṭhiro dharmabhṛtāṃ variṣṭhaḥ
analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiraḥ dharma bhṛtām variṣṭhaḥ
translated: seeing them, Yudhishthira, the best among the upholders of dharma,

original: uccaiḥ pracukrośa ca kauravāgryaḥ /
analyzed: uccais pracukrośa ca kaurava agryaḥ
translated: the foremost of the Kurus, cried out in a loud voice.

original: papāta corvyāṃ sagaṇo visaṃjñaḥ
analyzed: papāta ca urvyām sa gaṇaḥ visaṃjñaḥ
translated: And fell unconscious on the ground with his followers.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: sa dṛṣṭvā nihatān saṃkhye putrān bhrātṝn sakhīṃs tathā
analyzed: sa dṛṣṭvā nihatān saṃkhye putrān bhrātṝn sakhīn tathā
translated: Having seen his sons, brothers and friends slain in battle,

original: mahāduḥkhaparītātmā babhūva janamejaya
analyzed: mahā duḥkha parīta ātmā babhūva janamejaya
translated: Janamejaya, his soul overwhelmed with great sorrow,

original: tatas tasya mahāñ śokaḥ prādurāsīn mahātmanaḥ
analyzed: tatas tasya mahān śokaḥ prādurāsīt mahātmanaḥ
translated: then a great grief arose for that magnanimous one,

original: smarataḥ putrapautrāṇāṃ bhrātṝṇāṃ svajanasya ha
analyzed: smarataḥ putra pautrāṇām bhrātṝṇām sva janasya ha
translated: as he remembered his sons, grandsons, brothers and relatives.

original: tam aśruparipūrṇākṣaṃ vepamānam acetasam
analyzed: tam aśru paripūrṇa akṣam vepamānam acetasam
translated: His eyes filled with tears, trembling, and unconscious,

original: suhṛdo bhṛśasaṃvignāḥ sāntvayāṃ cakrire tadā🔽kṛtvā tu vidhivat teṣāṃ putrāṇām amitaujasām
analyzed: suhṛdaḥ bhṛśa saṃvignāḥ sāntvayām cakrire tadā  kṛtvā tu vidhivat teṣām putrāṇām amita ojasām
translated: his well-wishers, deeply concerned, comforted him then.🔽Having performed the funeral rites according to the rules for all those sons of immeasurable prowess,

original: pretakāryāṇi sarveṣāṃ babhūva bhṛśaduḥkhitaḥ
analyzed: pretakāryāṇi sarveṣām babhūva bhṛśa duḥkhitaḥ
translated: he was greatly distressed.

original: tatas tasmin kṣaṇe kālye rathenādityavarcasā
analyzed: tatas tasmin kṣaṇe kālye rathena āditya varcasā
translated: Then, at that very moment, in the early morning, on a chariot shining like the sun,

original: tasmin muhūrte javanair vājibhir hemamālibhiḥ
analyzed: tasmin muhūrte javanaiḥ vājibhiḥ hema mālibhiḥ
translated: in that very moment, with swift horses adorned with golden garlands,

original: nakulaḥ kṛṣṇayā sārdham upāyāt paramārtayā
analyzed: nakulaḥ kṛṣṇayā sārdham upāyāt parama ārtayā
translated: Nakula arrived with Krishna, who was extremely afflicted with grief.

original: upaplavyagatā sā tu śrutvā sumahad apriyam
analyzed: upaplavya gatā sā tu śrutvā su mahat apriyam
translated: She, who had gone to Upaplavya, having heard the extremely great misfortune

original: tadā vināśaṃ putrāṇāṃ sarveṣāṃ vyathitābhavat
analyzed: tadā vināśam putrāṇām sarveṣām vyathitā abhavat
translated: of the destruction of all her sons, became distressed.

original: kampamāneva kadalī vātenābhisamīritā
analyzed: kampamānā iva kadalī vātena abhisamīritā
translated: Trembling like a plantain tree shaken by the wind,

original: kṛṣṇā rājānam āsādya śokārtā nyapatad bhuvi
analyzed: kṛṣṇā rājānam āsādya śoka ārtā nyapatat bhuvi
translated: Krishna, afflicted with grief, approached the king and fell down on the ground.

original: babhūva vadanaṃ tasyāḥ sahasā śokakarśitam
analyzed: babhūva vadanam tasyāḥ sahasā śoka karśitam
translated: Her face, suddenly emaciated with grief,

original: phullapadmapalāśākṣyās tamodhvasta ivāṃśumān🔽tatas tāṃ patitāṃ dṛṣṭvā saṃrambhī satyavikramaḥ
analyzed: phulla padma palāśa akṣyāḥ tamaḥ dhvastaḥ iva aṃśumān  tatas tām patitām dṛṣṭvā saṃrambhī satya vikramaḥ
translated: of one whose eyes were like fully bloomed lotus petals, became like the sun obscured by darkness.🔽Then, seeing her fallen, Vrikodara, who was wrathful and of true valor,

original: bāhubhyāṃ parijagrāha samupetya vṛkodaraḥ
analyzed: bāhubhyām parijagrāha samupetya vṛkodaraḥ
translated: approached and supported her with his arms.

original: sā samāśvāsitā tena bhīmasenena bhāminī
analyzed: sā samāśvāsitā tena bhīmasenena bhāminī
translated: That beautiful lady was comforted by Bhimasena.

original: rudatī pāṇḍavaṃ kṛṣṇā sahabhrātaram abravīt
analyzed: rudatī pāṇḍavam kṛṣṇā saha bhrātaram abravīt
translated: Krishna, weeping, spoke to the Pandava with his brothers:

original: diṣṭyā rājaṃs tvam adyemām akhilāṃ bhokṣyase mahīm
analyzed: diṣṭyā rājan tvam adyā imām akhilām bhokṣyase mahīm
translated: Fortunate it is, O king, that you will now enjoy this entire earth,

original: ātmajān kṣatradharmeṇa saṃpradāya yamāya vai
analyzed: ātmajān kṣatra dharmeṇa saṃpradāya yamāya vai
translated: having handed over your sons to Yama in accordance with the Kshatriya dharma.

original: diṣṭyā tvaṃ pārtha kuśalī mattamātaṅgagāminam🔽rājan rājyaṃ pradāya tvam anujānāṃ mayā saha
analyzed: diṣṭyā tvam pārtha kuśalī matta mātaṅga gāminam  rājan rājyam pradāya tvam anujānām mayā saha
translated: Fortunate it is, O Partha, that you are well, O you who move like a rutting elephant,🔽O king, having given the kingdom to you, I am now being permitted by you to go with my brothers to the forest.

original: vanaṃ vraja parityajya kaṣṭāṃ rājyaspṛhāṃ vibho
analyzed: vanam vraja parityajya kaṣṭām rājya spṛhām vibho
translated: Go to the forest, O lord, having renounced this painful desire for the kingdom.

original: evaṃvidhaṃ phalaṃ kaṣṭaṃ rājyasya kaṭukodayam
analyzed: evaṃvidham phalam kaṣṭam rājyasya kaṭuka udayam
translated: Such are the painful consequences of kingship, with its bitter fruits,

original: yatra jñātivadhaṃ kṛtvā rājyena sukham īpsyate
analyzed: yatra jñāti vadham kṛtvā rājyena sukham īpsyate
translated: where, having killed one's relatives, one seeks happiness through the kingdom.

original: yadartham iṣyate rājyaṃ bhogāś cārthā dhanāni ca
analyzed: yad artham iṣyate rājyam bhogāḥ ca arthāḥ dhanāni ca
translated: For the sake of which one desires kingship, enjoyments, wealth and riches,

original: drauṇirūpeṇa daivena hatāḥ paśuvad eva te
analyzed: drauṇi rūpeṇa daivena hatāḥ paśu vat eva te
translated: they have been killed by you like animals, in the form of Drona's son, by fate.

original: nūnaṃ vajreṇa ghaṭitaṃ hṛdayaṃ tava pārthiva🔽tathā hi mandabhāgyāyā mama duḥkhāni sarvadā
analyzed: nūnam vajreṇa ghaṭitam hṛdayam tava pārthiva  tathā hi mandabhāgyāyāḥ mama duḥkhāni sarvadā
translated: Surely, O king, your heart must be made of thunderbolts,🔽since, even after seeing such a calamity, you are not dead.🔽For, O king, I am always seeing the misfortunes of my brothers,

original: paśyantyā lokanāthebhyo bhartṛbhyaḥ surasaṃmite🔽smṛtvā teṣāṃ sukhaṃ cādya yauvanaṃ ca narādhipa
analyzed: paśyantyāḥ loka nāthebhyaḥ bhartṛbhyaḥ sura saṃmite  smṛtvā teṣām sukham ca adya yauvanam ca narādhipa
translated: who are like gods, the lords of the world, and my husbands.🔽Remembering their happiness, youth, and various activities appropriate to their age,

original: ceṣṭāś ca vividhās teṣāṃ vayaḥkālānurūpikāḥ
analyzed: ceṣṭāḥ ca vividhāḥ teṣām vayaḥ kāla anurūpikāḥ
translated: O king, I am not dead, though I am extremely unfortunate.

original: kathaṃ śakṣyasi rājendra muhūrtam api jīvitum
analyzed: katham śakṣyasi rāja indra muhūrtam api jīvitum
translated: O Indra among kings, how will you be able to live even for a moment?

original: bhrātaro mama rājendra bhṛtyā iva vaśe tava
analyzed: bhrātaraḥ mama rāja indra bhṛtyāḥ iva vaśe tava
translated: O lord of kings, my brothers are under your control like servants.

original: tān apaśyan kathaṃ rājan bhaviṣyasi vicintya vai
analyzed: tān a paśyan katham rājan bhaviṣyasi vicintya vai
translated: Not seeing them, how will you be, O king, thinking about them?

original: katham āsthāya kāle tvaṃ ratiṃ prāpsyasi pārthiva🔽putrapautrair vihīno hi śyālair bandhubhir eva ca
analyzed: katham āsthāya kāle tvam ratim prāpsyasi pārthiva  putra pautraiḥ vihīnaḥ hi śyālaiḥ bandhubhiḥ eva ca
translated: How will you attain pleasure at the right time, O king?🔽You are devoid of sons, grandsons, brothers-in-law, and relatives.

original: bāndhavaiḥ kṛtakṛtyaiś ca suhṛdbhir jñātibhis tathā
analyzed: bāndhavaiḥ kṛtakṛtyaiḥ ca suhṛdbhiḥ jñātibhiḥ tathā
translated: And also with relatives who have accomplished their purpose, with friends and kinsmen.

original: atha vā rājyalabdhastho bhogecchaḥ kṛpaṇo 'si cet
analyzed: atha vā rājya labdha sthaḥ bhoga icchaḥ ced
translated: Or if you are a miser desiring enjoyments, having attained the kingdom,

original: kāmaṃ te 'stu yathājoṣam ahaṃ tyakṣyāmi jīvitam
analyzed: kāmam te stu yathājoṣam aham tyakṣyāmi jīvitam
translated: let it be as you wish, I will give up my life.

original: citāṃ kuruta me kṣipraṃ pravekṣyāmi hutāśanam
analyzed: citām kuruta me kṣipram pravekṣyāmi hutāśanam
translated: Quickly make a funeral pyre for me, I will enter the fire.

original: na kariṣyatha me jātu vacanaṃ hy etad eva hi
analyzed: na kariṣyatha me jātu vacanam hi etat eva hi
translated: If you will never carry out this command of mine,

original: viṣeṇa rajjvā pātena parityakṣyāmi jīvitam
analyzed: viṣeṇa rajjvā pātena parityakṣyāmi jīvitam
translated: I will give up my life by poison, rope, or falling.

original: tasya pāpakṛto drauṇer jīvato jīvitaṃ na me
analyzed: tasya pāpa kṛtaḥ drauṇeḥ jīvataḥ jīvitam na me
translated: As long as that sinful Drona's son lives, I have no life.

original: nimeṣam api ca sthātuṃ kathaṃ yuktaṃ nareśvara
analyzed: nimeṣam api ca sthātum katham yuktam nareśvara
translated: O lord of men, how is it proper to remain even for a moment?

original: ihaiva prāyam āsiṣye darbhān saṃstara vā śubhe
analyzed: iha eva prāyam āsiṣye darbhān saṃstara vā śubhe
translated: Here itself I will practice fasting unto death, spread the auspicious darbha grass.

original: vajrapātopamaṃ duḥkhaṃ sāhaṃ śakṣye kathaṃ tv aham
analyzed: vajra pāta upamam duḥkham sā aham śakṣye katham tu aham
translated: How can I bear the grief that is like a thunderbolt falling on me?

original: hā heti paridevantyāḥ smṛtvā putrāṃs tathāgatān
analyzed: hā hā iti paridevantyāḥ smṛtvā putrān tathāgatān
translated: As I lament, Alas! Alas! remembering my sons and the Tathāgatas,

original: maraṇaṃ sarvathā śreṣṭhaṃ na tu me jīvitaṃ kṣamam🔽yena me niśi suptasya bhrātṛvargasya pārthiva
analyzed: maraṇam sarvathā śreṣṭham na tu me jīvitam kṣamam  yena me niśi suptasya bhrātṛ vargasya pārthiva
translated: Death is indeed best for me in every way, not this miserable life.🔽O king, by whom the life of my group of brothers was taken away here at night while asleep,

original: jīvitaṃ dūhṛtam eveha paśūnām iva tasya tu
analyzed: jīvitam dūhṛtam eva iha paśūnām iva tasya tu
translated: Like that of animals,

original: jīvato jīvituṃ nāhaṃ dhārayiṣye muhūrtakam
analyzed: jīvataḥ jīvitum na aham dhārayiṣye muhūrtakam
translated: I will not bear life for even a moment as long as he lives.

original: eṣā tyajāmy ahaṃ prāya āsthāyedaṃ tavāgrataḥ
analyzed: eṣā tyajāmi aham prāyas āsthāya idam tava agratas
translated: I will now give up my life in front of you, having resorted to this.

original: avāpya pṛthivīṃ kṛtsnāṃ saubhadraṃ na smariṣyasi
analyzed: avāpya pṛthivīm kṛtsnām saubhadram na smariṣyasi
translated: Having obtained the entire earth, you will not remember Subhadra's son.

original: ātmajāṃs tena dharmeṇa śrutvā śūrān nipātitān
analyzed: ātmajān tena dharmeṇa śrutvā śūrān nipātitān
translated: Having heard that your heroic sons were brought down by that dharma,

original: upaplavye mayā sārdhaṃ diṣṭyā tvaṃ na smariṣyasi
analyzed: upaplavye mayā sārdham diṣṭyā tvam na smariṣyasi
translated: Fortunate are you that you will not remember them in Upaplāvya with me.

original: prasuptānāṃ vadhaṃ śrutvā drauṇinā pāpakarmaṇā
analyzed: prasuptānām vadham śrutvā drauṇinā pāpa karmaṇā
translated: Having heard the slaughter of those sleeping by the sinful Drona's son,

original: śokas tapati māṃ pārtha hutāśana ivāśayam🔽tasya pāpakṛto drauṇer na ced adya tvayā mṛdhe
analyzed: śokaḥ tapati mām pārtha hutāśanaḥ iva āśayam  tasya pāpa kṛtaḥ drauṇeḥ na ced adya tvayā mṛdhe
translated: Grief burns me, O Partha, like a fire in the heart.🔽If today you do not take away in battle

original: hriyate sānubandhasya yudhi vikramya jīvitam
analyzed: hriyate sa anubandhasya yudhi vikramya jīvitam
translated: The life of that sinful Drona's son along with his followers, displaying your prowess,

original: ihaiva prāyam āsiṣye tan nibodhata pāṇḍavāḥ
analyzed: iha eva prāyam āsiṣye tat nibodhata pāṇḍavāḥ
translated: I will give up my life here itself. Understand this, O sons of Pandu.

original: na cet phalam avāpnoti drauṇiḥ pāpasya karmaṇaḥ
analyzed: na ced phalam avāpnoti drauṇiḥ pāpasya karmaṇaḥ
translated: If Drona's son does not reap the fruit of his sinful deeds,

original: evam uktvā tataḥ kṛṣṇā pāṇḍavaṃ pratyupāviśat
analyzed: evam uktvā tatas kṛṣṇā pāṇḍavam pratyupāviśat
translated: Having said this, Krishna sat down facing the Pandava.

original: yudhiṣṭhiraṃ yājñasenī dharmarājaṃ yaśasvinī
analyzed: yudhiṣṭhiram yājñasenī dharmarājam yaśasvinī
translated: The illustrious Yajnaseni sat down in front of Dharmaraja Yudhishthira.

original: dṛṣṭvopaviṣṭāṃ rājarṣiḥ pāṇḍavo mahiṣīṃ priyām
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā upaviṣṭām rājarṣiḥ pāṇḍavaḥ mahiṣīm priyām
translated: Seeing his beloved queen, the royal sage Pandava,

original: pratyuvāca sa dharmātmā draupadīṃ cārudarśanām🔽dharmyaṃ dharmeṇa dharmajñe prāptās te nidhanaṃ śubhe
analyzed: pratyuvāca sa dharma ātmā draupadīm cāru darśanām  dharmyam dharmeṇa dharma jñe prāptāḥ te nidhanam śubhe
translated: the righteous one, spoke to the beautiful Draupadi:🔽O virtuous one, O virtuous one, your sons and brothers have attained their end righteously.

original: putrās te bhrātaraś caiva tān na śocitum arhasi
analyzed: putrāḥ te bhrātaraḥ ca eva tān na śocitum arhasi
translated: O auspicious one, you should not grieve for them.

original: taṃ śrutvāgatamanyutatkampamānābhyapadyatasic
analyzed: tam śrutvā āgata manyu tad kampamāna abhyapadyata sic
translated: Hearing his words, she trembled and fell down.

original: droṇaputraḥ sa kalyāṇi vanaṃ dūram ito gataḥ
analyzed: droṇaputraḥ sa kalyāṇi vanam dūram itas gataḥ
translated: O fortunate one, Drona's son has gone far away to the forest.

original: tasya tvaṃ pātanaṃ saṃkhye kathaṃ jñāsyasi śobhane
analyzed: tasya tvam pātanam saṃkhye katham jñāsyasi śobhane
translated: O beautiful one, how will you know when he is brought down in battle?

original: draupady uvāca
analyzed: draupadī uvāca
translated: Draupadi said:

original: droṇaputrasya sahajo maṇiḥ śirasi me śrutaḥ
analyzed: droṇaputrasya sahajaḥ maṇiḥ śirasi me śrutaḥ
translated: I have heard that a natural gem is on the head of Drona's son.

original: nihatya saṃkhye taṃ pāpaṃ paśyeyaṃ maṇim āhṛtam
analyzed: nihatya saṃkhye tam pāpam paśyeyam maṇim āhṛtam
translated: Having killed that sinner in battle, I would see the gem brought (to me).

original: rājañ śirasi taṃ kṛtvā jīveyam iti me matiḥ
analyzed: rājam śirasi tam kṛtvā jīveyam iti me matiḥ
translated: O king, having placed it on my head, I would live. This is my opinion.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: ity uktvā pāṇḍavaṃ kṛṣṇā rājānaṃ cārudarśanā
analyzed: iti uktvā pāṇḍavam kṛṣṇā rājānam cāru darśanā
translated: Having said this to the Pandava king, the beautiful Krishna,

original: bhīmasenam athābhyetya kupitā vākyam abravīt
analyzed: bhīmasenam atha abhyetya kupitā vākyam abravīt
translated: Approaching Bhimasena, she spoke these angry words:

original: trātum arhasi māṃ bhīma kṣatradharmam anusmaran
analyzed: trātum arhasi mām bhīma kṣatra dharmam anusmaran
translated: Remembering the duty of a kshatriya, O Bhima, you should save me.

original: jahi taṃ pāpakarmāṇaṃ śambaraṃ maghavān iva
analyzed: jahi tam pāpa karmāṇam śambaram maghavān iva
translated: Slay that sinful one, like Indra slaying Shambara.

original: na hi te vikrame tulyaḥ pumān astīha kaś cana
analyzed: na hi te vikrame tulyaḥ pumān asti iha kaḥ cana
translated: There is no man equal to you in valor on this earth.

original: śrutaṃ tat sarvalokeṣu paramavyasane yathā
analyzed: śrutam tat sarva lokeṣu parama vyasane yathā
translated: It is known in all the worlds how you became

original: dvīpo 'bhūs tvaṃ hi pārthānāṃ nagare vāraṇāvate
analyzed: dvīpaḥ bhūḥ tvam hi pārthānām nagare vāraṇāvate
translated: an island for the Parthas in the city of Varanavata during their great calamity.

original: hiḍimbadarśane caiva tathā tvam abhavo gatiḥ🔽tathā virāṭanagare kīcakena bhṛśārditām
analyzed: hiḍimba darśane ca eva tathā tvam abhavaḥ gatiḥ  tathā virāṭa nagare kīcakena bhṛśa arditām
translated: And when Hidimba was seen, you became their refuge.🔽Similarly, in the city of Virata, you rescued me

original: mām apy uddhṛtavān kṛcchrāt paulomīṃ maghavān iva
analyzed: mām api uddhṛtavān kṛcchrāt paulomīm maghavān iva
translated: from great affliction by Kichaka, like Indra rescuing Paulomi.

original: yathaitāny akṛthāḥ pārtha mahākarmāṇi vai purā
analyzed: yathā etāni akṛthāḥ pārtha mahā karmāṇi vai purā
translated: Just as you performed those great deeds in the past, O Partha,

original: tathā drauṇim amitraghna vinihatya sukhī bhava
analyzed: tathā drauṇim amitra ghna vinihatya sukhī bhava
translated: slay Drona's son, O slayer of enemies, and be happy.

original: visphārya saśaraṃ cāpaṃ tūrṇam aśvāṃś ca nodayan
analyzed: visphārya sa śaram cāpam tūrṇam aśvān ca nodayan
translated: Stretch your bow with an arrow and quickly urge on our horses.

original: taṃ pāpaṃ puruṣavyāghra vinihatya sukhī bhava
analyzed: tam pāpam puruṣa vyāghra vinihatya sukhī bhava
translated: Slay that sinful one, O tiger among men, and be happy.

original: tasyā bahuvidhaṃ duḥkhān niśamya paridevitam
analyzed: tasyāḥ bahuvidham duḥkhāt niśamya paridevitam
translated: Hearing her lamentations in various ways due to her great sorrow,

original: nāmarṣayata kaunteyo bhīmaseno mahābalaḥ
analyzed: na amarṣayata kaunteyaḥ bhīmasenaḥ mahā balaḥ
translated: the mighty Kounteya Bhimasena could not bear it.

original: sa kāñcanavicitrāṅgam āruroha mahāratham
analyzed: sa kāñcana vicitra aṅgam āruroha mahā ratham
translated: He then mounted his great chariot, the body of which was decorated with gold,

original: ādāya ruciraṃ citraṃ samārgaṇaguṇaṃ dhanuḥ🔽nakulaṃ sārathiṃ kṛtvā droṇaputravadhe vṛtaḥ
analyzed: ādāya ruciram citram sa mārgaṇa guṇam dhanuḥ  nakulam sārathim kṛtvā droṇaputra vadhe vṛtaḥ
translated: Taking his beautiful and colorful bow with arrows fixed to the string,🔽Making Nakula his charioteer, determined to kill Drona's son,

original: visphārya saśaraṃ cāpaṃ tūrṇam aśvān acodayat🔽te hayāḥ puruṣavyāghra coditā vātaraṃhasaḥ
analyzed: visphārya sa śaram cāpam tūrṇam aśvān acodayat  te hayāḥ puruṣa vyāghra coditāḥ vāta raṃhasaḥ
translated: Stretching his bow with an arrow fixed to it, he quickly urged on his horses.🔽Those horses, urged on by that tiger among men, swift as the wind,

original: vegena tvaritā jagmur harayaḥ śīghragāminaḥ🔽śibirāt svād gṛhītvā sa rathasya padam acyutaḥ
analyzed: vegena tvaritāḥ jagmuḥ harayaḥ śīghra gāminaḥ  śibirāt svāt gṛhītvā sa rathasya padam acyutaḥ
translated: Quickly sped along, those swift-moving bay horses.🔽Taking his chariot's position from his camp, that undeteriorating, valiant one

original: droṇaputrarathasyāśu yayau mārgeṇa vīryavān
analyzed: droṇaputra rathasya āśu yayau mārgeṇa vīryavān
translated: Quickly went along the path of Drona's son's chariot.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: tasmin prayāte durdharṣe yadūnām ṛṣabhas tataḥ
analyzed: tasmin prayāte durdharṣe yadūnām ṛṣabhaḥ tatas
translated: When that invincible one had departed, then that bull among the Yadus,

original: abravīt puṇḍarīkākṣaḥ kuntīputraṃ yudhiṣṭhiram
analyzed: abravīt puṇḍarīkākṣaḥ kuntī putram yudhiṣṭhiram
translated: Pundarikaksha (Krishna) spoke to Yudhishthira, the son of Kunti:

original: eṣa pāṇḍava te bhrātā putraśokam apārayan
analyzed: eṣa pāṇḍava te bhrātā putra śokam a pārayan
translated: O Pandava, this brother of yours, the descendant of the Bharata lineage, unable to bear the grief for his sons,

original: jighāṃsur drauṇim ākrande yāti bhārata bhārataḥ
analyzed: jighāṃsuḥ drauṇim ākrande yāti bhārata bhārataḥ
translated: Is going out to the battlefield, O Bharata, desiring to kill Drona's son.

original: bhīmaḥ priyas te sarvebhyo bhrātṛbhyo bharatarṣabha
analyzed: bhīmaḥ priyaḥ te sarvebhyaḥ bhrātṛbhyaḥ bharata ṛṣabha
translated: O bull among the Bharata lineage, Bhima is dearer to you than all your brothers.

original: taṃ kṛcchragatam adya tvaṃ kasmān nābhyavapadyase
analyzed: tam kṛcchra gatam adya tvam kasmāt na abhyavapadyase
translated: Why do you not go to him today, when he is in a difficult situation?

original: syās tu me paramaṃ guhyaṃ śrutvā ca kriyatāṃ punaḥ
analyzed: syāḥ tu me paramam guhyam śrutvā ca kriyatām punar
translated: But you should listen to my supreme secret and then do it again.

original: taṃ prayāntaṃ mahābāhuṃ bhīmasenaṃ mahābalam
analyzed: tam prayāntam mahā bāhum bhīmasenam mahā balam
translated: That mighty-armed and greatly strong Bhimasena is going

original: droṇaputravadhaprepsuṃ kasmān nābhyavapatsyase
analyzed: droṇaputra vadha prepsum kasmāt na abhyavapatsyase
translated: with the desire to kill Drona's son. Why do you not follow him?

original: sa hi krodhaparītātmā śāṃkaraṃ vapur āsthitaḥ
analyzed: sa hi krodha parīta ātmā śāṃkaram vapuḥ āsthitaḥ
translated: He, with his mind full of anger, has taken on the form of Shankara.

original: avadhyaḥ sarvalokānāṃ drauṇiḥ paramakopanaḥ
analyzed: avadhyaḥ sarva lokānām drauṇiḥ parama kopanaḥ
translated: Drona's son, who is extremely wrathful, is unslayable by all the worlds.

original: krodhena paramāviṣṭaṃ bhīmaṃ putravadhārditam🔽dṛṣṭamātreṇa taṃ śūro vadhiṣyati mahāstravit
analyzed: krodhena parama āviṣṭam bhīmam putra vadha arditam  dṛṣṭa mātreṇa tam śūraḥ vadhiṣyati mahā astra vid
translated: Bhima, who is afflicted by the death of his son, is overcome with great anger.🔽That hero, who is skilled in great weapons, will kill him as soon as he sees him.

original: sa śūraḥ sa ca vikrāntaḥ samanyur nāśayiṣyati
analyzed: sa śūraḥ sa ca vikrāntaḥ sa manyuḥ nāśayiṣyati
translated: That hero, who is valiant, will destroy him with his anger.

original: tasmād bhīmaṃ mahārāja prayāma bharatarṣabha🔽yat tad ācaṣṭa putrāya droṇaḥ parapuraṃjayaḥ
analyzed: tasmāt bhīmam mahā rāja prayāma bharata ṛṣabha  yat tat ācaṣṭa putrāya droṇaḥ parapuraṃjayaḥ
translated: Therefore, O great king, O bull of the Bharata race, follow Bhima.🔽That weapon called Brahmashira, which Drona, the conqueror of enemy cities, taught to his son,

original: astraṃ brahmaśiro nāma dahed yat pṛthivīm api
analyzed: astram brahmaśiraḥ nāma dahet yat pṛthivīm api
translated: which could burn even the earth,

original: tan mahātmā mahābhāgaḥ ketuḥ sarvadhanuṣmatām
analyzed: tat mahātmā mahābhāgaḥ ketuḥ sarva dhanuṣmatām
translated: the great-souled one, the illustrious one, the banner of all archers,

original: pratyapādayad ācāryaḥ prīyamāṇo dhanaṃjayam
analyzed: pratyapādayat ācāryaḥ prīyamāṇaḥ dhanaṃjayam
translated: the teacher, pleased, bestowed it on Dhananjaya.

original: tatputro 'syaivam evainam anvayācad amarṣaṇaḥ
analyzed: tad putraḥ sya evam eva enam anvayācat amarṣaṇaḥ
translated: His son, who is equally intolerant, has asked for it in the same way.

original: athārjunasya saṃprāptaṃ dṛṣṭvā brahmaśiras tathā
analyzed: atha arjunasya saṃprāptam dṛṣṭvā brahmaśiraḥ tathā
translated: Then, seeing that Arjuna has obtained the Brahmashira,

original: tam uvāca svapitaram aśvatthāmā mahābalaḥ
analyzed: tam uvāca sva pitaram aśvatthāmā mahā balaḥ
translated: The greatly powerful Ashvatthama said to his father:

original: krodhena mahatāviṣṭo dṛṣṭvā snehaviparyayam
analyzed: krodhena mahatā āviṣṭaḥ dṛṣṭvā sneha viparyayam
translated: Overcome with great anger, seeing the change in affection,

original: putro 'haṃ guṇavāṃs tāta kimarthaṃ me na dattavān
analyzed: putraḥ ham guṇavān tāta kimartham me na dattavān
translated: He said, O father, I am your virtuous son. Why did you not give me

original: brahmāstraṃ sarahasyaṃ ca arjunāyopapāditam
analyzed: brahmāstram sa rahasyam ca arjunāya upapāditam
translated: The Brahma weapon with its secret, which you bestowed on Arjuna?

original: taṃ kruddham iti sa jñātvā putrasnehāc ca bhārata
analyzed: tam kruddham iti sa jñātvā putra snehāt ca bhārata
translated: O descendant of Bharata, knowing him to be angry and out of affection for his son,

original: tataḥ provāca putrāya nātihṛṣṭamanā iva
analyzed: tatas provāca putrāya na ati hṛṣṭa manāḥ iva
translated: He then spoke to his son, not very pleased,

original: viditaṃ cāpalaṃ hy āsīd ātmajasya mahātmanaḥ
analyzed: viditam cāpalam hi āsīt ātmajasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: Knowing the fickleness of his great-souled son,

original: kruddharūpasya śūrasya vīrasyāpy atyamarṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: kruddha rūpasya śūrasya vīrasya api ati amarṣiṇaḥ
translated: Of the angry-looking, brave, heroic and intolerant one,

original: sarvadharmavid ācāryo nānviṣat satataṃ sutam
analyzed: sarva dharma vid ācāryaḥ na anviṣat satatam sutam
translated: The teacher, who knew all the rules, did not always seek his son,

original: paramāpadgatenāpi na sma tāta tvayā raṇe
analyzed: parama āpad gatena api na sma tāta tvayā raṇe
translated: Even when he was in a great calamity, O son, you should not

original: idam astraṃ prayoktavyaṃ mānuṣeṣu viśeṣataḥ
analyzed: idam astram prayoktavyam mānuṣeṣu viśeṣataḥ
translated: Use this weapon, especially against humans.

original: ity uktavān guruḥ putraṃ droṇaḥ paścād athoktavān
analyzed: iti uktavān guruḥ putram droṇaḥ paścāt atha uktavān
translated: Having said this to his son, Drona, the teacher, later said,

original: na tvaṃ jātu satāṃ mārge sthāteti puruṣarṣabha
analyzed: na tvam jātu satām mārge sthātā iti puruṣa ṛṣabha
translated: You will never stand on the path of the virtuous, O best of men.

original: sa tad ājñāya duṣṭātmā pitur vacanam apriyam
analyzed: sa tat ājñāya duṣṭa ātmā pituḥ vacanam apriyam
translated: Having heard those unpleasant words of his father, that evil-minded one,

original: nirāśaḥ sarvakalyāṇaiḥ śocan paryapatan mahīm
analyzed: nirāśaḥ sarva kalyāṇaiḥ śocan paryapatat mahīm
translated: Despairing of all good things, lamented and fell down on the ground.

original: tatas tadā kuruśreṣṭha vanasthe tvayi bhārata
analyzed: tatas tadā kuru śreṣṭha vana sthe tvayi bhārata
translated: O best of the Kurus, O descendant of Bharata, when you were living in the forest at that time,

original: avasad dvārakām etya vṛṣṇibhiḥ paramārcitaḥ
analyzed: avasat dvārakām etya vṛṣṇibhiḥ parama arcitaḥ
translated: he lived in Dvaraka, highly honored by the Vrishnis, after coming there.

original: sa kadā cit samudrānte vasan drāravatīm anu
analyzed: sa kadā cit samudra ante vasan drāravatīm anu
translated: Once, while living on the shore of the ocean near Dvaravati,

original: eka ekaṃ samāgamya mām uvāca hasann iva🔽yat tad ugraṃ tapaḥ kṛṣṇa caran satyaparākramaḥ
analyzed: ekaḥ ekam samāgamya mām uvāca hasan iva  yat tat ugram tapaḥ kṛṣṇa caran satya parākramaḥ
translated: he came to me alone and spoke to me as if smiling,

original: agastyād bhāratācāryaḥ pratyapadyata me pitā
analyzed: agastyāt bhārata ācāryaḥ pratyapadyata me pitā
translated: O Krishna, my father, the preceptor of the Bharatas, who was invincible in battle,

original: astraṃ brahmaśiro nāma devagandharvapūjitam
analyzed: astram brahmaśiraḥ nāma deva gandharva pūjitam
translated: obtained from Agastya the weapon called Brahmashira, which is worshipped by gods, gandharvas and others.

original: tad adya mayi dāśārha yathā pitari me tathā
analyzed: tat adya mayi dāśārha yathā pitari me tathā
translated: That weapon is now with me, O Dasharha, just as it was with my father.

original: asmattas tad upādāya divyam astraṃ yadūttama
