analyzed: asmattaḥ tat upādāya divyam astram yadu uttama
translated: O best of the Yadus, having taken that divine weapon from me,

original: mamāpy astraṃ prayaccha tvaṃ cakraṃ ripuharaṃ raṇe
analyzed: mama api astram prayaccha tvam cakram ripu haram raṇe
translated: give me your discus, which destroys enemies in battle.

original: sa rājan prīyamāṇena mayāpy uktaḥ kṛtāñjaliḥ
analyzed: sa rājan prīyamāṇena mayā api uktaḥ kṛtāñjaliḥ
translated: O king, he was pleased and spoke to me with folded hands,

original: yācamānaḥ prayatnena matto 'straṃ bharatarṣabha
analyzed: yācamānaḥ prayatnena mattaḥ u stram bharata ṛṣabha
translated: O best of the Bharata lineage, I am earnestly requesting you for that weapon.

original: devadānavagandharvamanuṣyapatagoragāḥ
analyzed: deva dānava gandharva manuṣya pataga uragāḥ
translated: Gods, demons, gandharvas, humans, birds and serpents,

original: na samā mama vīryasya śatāṃśenāpi piṇḍitāḥ
analyzed: na samāḥ mama vīryasya śata aṃśena api piṇḍitāḥ
translated: when combined, are not equal to even a hundredth part of my prowess.

original: idaṃ dhanur iyaṃ śaktir idaṃ cakram iyaṃ gadā
analyzed: idam dhanuḥ iyam śaktiḥ idam cakram iyam gadā
translated: This is my bow, this is my spear, this is my discus, this is my club,

original: yad yad icchasi ced astraṃ mattas tat tad dadāni te
analyzed: yat yat icchasi ced astram mattaḥ tat tat dadāni te
translated: If you desire any weapon from me, I will give it to you.

original: yac chaknoṣi samudyantuṃ prayoktum api vā raṇe
analyzed: yat śaknoṣi samudyantum prayoktum api vā raṇe
translated: Whatever you are able to wield and employ in battle,

original: tad gṛhāṇa vināstreṇa yan me dātum abhīpsasi🔽sa sunābhaṃ sahasrāraṃ vajranābham ayasmayam
analyzed: tat gṛhāṇa vinā astreṇa yat me dātum abhīpsasi  sa su nābham sahasra aram vajra nābham ayasmayam
translated: take that from me, without the weapon that you wish to give me.🔽O mighty-armed one, he chose the discus, with a good nave, a thousand spokes, and an adamantine rim, made of iron,

original: vavre cakraṃ mahābāho spardhamāno mayā saha🔽gṛhāṇa cakram ity ukto mayā tu tadanantaram
analyzed: vavre cakram mahā bāho spardhamānaḥ mayā saha  gṛhāṇa cakram iti uktaḥ mayā tu tad anantaram
translated: rivaling me.🔽After I said Take the discus,

original: jagrāhopetya sahasā cakraṃ savyena pāṇinā
analyzed: jagrāha upetya sahasā cakram savyena pāṇinā
translated: he suddenly approached and seized the discus with his left hand.

original: na caitad aśakat sthānāt saṃcālayitum acyuta
analyzed: na ca etat aśakat sthānāt saṃcālayitum acyuta
translated: But he was unable to move it from its place, O Achyuta.

original: atha tad dakṣiṇenāpi grahītum upacakrame
analyzed: atha tat dakṣiṇena api grahītum upacakrame
translated: Then he tried to grasp it with his right hand also.

original: sarvayatnena tenāpi gṛhṇann etad akalpayat🔽tataḥ sarvabalenāpi yac caitan na śaśāka saḥ
analyzed: sarva yatnena tena api gṛhṇan etat akalpayat  tatas sarva balena api yat ca etat na śaśāka saḥ
translated: Even with all his strength, he was unable to grasp it.

original: uddhartuṃ vā cālayituṃ drauṇiḥ paramadurmanāḥ
analyzed: uddhartum vā cālayitum drauṇiḥ parama durmanāḥ
translated: Then, with all his might, when he was unable to lift it or move it, Drona's son became extremely dejected.

original: kṛtvā yatnaṃ paraṃ śrāntaḥ sa nyavartata bhārata
analyzed: kṛtvā yatnam param śrāntaḥ sa nyavartata bhārata
translated: Having made great effort and become exhausted, he desisted, O Bharata.

original: nivṛttam atha taṃ tasmād abhiprāyād vicetasam
analyzed: nivṛttam atha tam tasmāt abhiprāyāt vicetasam
translated: Then, having turned away from that intention, his mind confused,

original: aham āmantrya susnigdham aśvatthāmānam abruvam
analyzed: aham āmantrya su snigdham aśvatthāmānam abruvam
translated: I addressed Ashvatthama with great affection and said to him:

original: yaḥ sa devamanuṣyeṣu pramāṇaṃ paramaṃ gataḥ
analyzed: yaḥ sa deva manuṣyeṣu pramāṇam paramam gataḥ
translated: He who was the supreme authority among gods and men,

original: gāṇḍīvadhanvā śvetāśvaḥ kapipravaraketanaḥ
translated: The wielder of the Gandiva bow, with white horses and the banner of the best of monkeys,

original: yaḥ sākṣād devadeveśaṃ śitikaṇṭham umāpatim
analyzed: yaḥ sākṣāt devadeveśam śitikaṇṭham umāpatim
translated: Who directly pleased Shiva, the lord of the gods and lord of Uma,

original: dvaṃdvayuddhe parājiṣṇus toṣayām āsa śaṃkaram
analyzed: dvaṃdva yuddhe parājiṣṇuḥ toṣayām āsa śaṃkaram
translated: The conqueror in duels,

original: yasmāt priyataro nāsti mamānyaḥ puruṣo bhuvi
analyzed: yasmāt priyataraḥ nā asti mama anyaḥ puruṣaḥ bhuvi
translated: He who said, There is no other man on earth who is dearer to me than Arjuna,

original: nādeyaṃ yasya me kiṃ cid api dārāḥ sutās tathā
analyzed: na ādeyam yasya me kim cit api dārāḥ sutāḥ tathā
translated: Nor is there anything that I cannot give him, even my wife and children.

original: tenāpi suhṛdā brahman pārthenākliṣṭakarmaṇā
analyzed: tena api suhṛdā brahman pārthena akliṣṭa karmaṇā
translated: By that well-wishing friend of mine, O Brahmana, by Partha of untiring deeds,

original: noktapurvam idaṃ vākyaṃ yat tvaṃ mām abhibhāṣase
analyzed: na ukta purvam idam vākyam yat tvam mām abhibhāṣase
translated: This very speech that you are addressing to me has never been spoken before.

original: brahmacaryaṃ mahad ghoraṃ cīrtvā dvādaśavārṣikam
analyzed: brahmacaryam mahat ghoram cīrtvā dvādaśa vārṣikam
translated: Having observed the great and terrible vow of celibacy for twelve years,

original: himavatpārśvam abhyetya yo mayā tapasārcitaḥ
analyzed: himavat pārśvam abhyetya yaḥ mayā tapasā arcitaḥ
translated: And having approached the side of the Himalayas, he who was worshipped by me with austerities,

original: samānavratacāriṇyāṃ rukmiṇyāṃ yo 'nvajāyata
analyzed: samāna vrata cāriṇyām rukmiṇyām yaḥ nu ajāyata
translated: In Rukmini, who observed the same vows as him, he was born.

original: sanatkumāras tejasvī pradyumno nāma me sutaḥ
analyzed: sanatkumāraḥ tejasvī pradyumnaḥ nāma me sutaḥ
translated: My son, the radiant Sanatkumara, named Pradyumna,

original: tenāpy etan mahad divyaṃ cakram apratimaṃ mama
analyzed: tena api etat mahat divyam cakram apratimam mama
translated: By him also, this great and divine discus of mine, which is matchless,

original: na prārthitam abhūn mūḍha yad idaṃ prārthitaṃ tvayā
analyzed: na prārthitam abhūt mūḍha yat idam prārthitam tvayā
translated: Was never desired, O fool, as it is desired by you.

original: rāmeṇātibalenaitan noktapūrvaṃ kadā cana
analyzed: rāmeṇa atibalena etat na ukta pūrvam kadā cana
translated: By the greatly powerful Rama, this was never spoken before.

original: na gadena na sāmbena yad idaṃ prārthitaṃ tvayā
analyzed: na gadena na sāmbena yat idam prārthitam tvayā
translated: What you have asked for has never been asked for by Gada, Samba,

original: dvārakāvāsibhiś cānyair vṛṣṇyandhakamahārathaiḥ
analyzed: dvārakā vāsibhiḥ ca anyaiḥ vṛṣṇi andhaka mahā rathaiḥ
translated: Or by the other great charioteers of the Vrishni and Andhaka clans who reside in Dvaraka.

original: noktapūrvam idaṃ jātu yad idaṃ prārthitaṃ tvayā
analyzed: na ukta pūrvam idam jātu yat idam prārthitam tvayā
translated: This has never been asked for by anyone before.

original: bhāratācāryaputraḥ san mānitaḥ sarvayādavaiḥ
analyzed: bhārata ācārya putraḥ san mānitaḥ sarva yādavaiḥ
translated: You are the son of the preceptor of the Bharatas and are honored by all the Yadavas.

original: dhāraṇe na samarthas tvaṃ kutaḥ kṣeptuṃ mahāhave
analyzed: dhāraṇe na samarthaḥ tvam kutas kṣeptum mahā āhave
translated: You are not even capable of holding it, how much less of hurling it in a great battle?

original: cakreṇa rathināṃ śreṣṭha kiṃ nu tāta yuyutsase
analyzed: cakreṇa rathinām śreṣṭha kim nu tāta yuyutsase
translated: O best of charioteers, what are you trying to do with this discus, O son?

original: evam ukto mayā drauṇir mām idaṃ pratyuvāca ha
analyzed: evam uktaḥ mayā drauṇiḥ mām idam pratyuvāca ha
translated: Thus addressed by me, Drona's son replied to me, saying:

original: prayujya bhavate pūjāṃ yotsye kṛṣṇa tvayety uta
analyzed: prayujya bhavate pūjām yotsye kṛṣṇa tvayā iti uta
translated: Having offered you homage, O Krishna, I will fight with you.

original: tatas te prārthitaṃ cakraṃ devadānavapūjitam
analyzed: tatas te prārthitam cakram deva dānava pūjitam
translated: Then he asked for the discus, worshipped by gods and demons,

original: ajeyaḥ syām iti vibho satyam etad bravīmi te
analyzed: ajeyaḥ syām iti vibho satyam etat bravīmi te
translated: saying, O lord, I will be invincible. This is the truth I tell you.

original: tvatto 'haṃ durlabhaṃ kāmam anavāpyaiva keśava
analyzed: tvattaḥ ham durlabham kāmam an avāpya eva keśava
translated: O Keshava, without obtaining this boon that is so difficult to get from you,

original: pratiyāsyāmi govinda śivenābhivadasva mām
analyzed: pratiyāsyāmi govinda śivena abhivadasva mām
translated: I will return, O Govinda. Bless me with auspicious words.

original: etat sunābhaṃ vṛṣṇīnām ṛṣabheṇa tvayā dhṛtam
analyzed: etat su nābham vṛṣṇīnām ṛṣabheṇa tvayā dhṛtam
translated: This well-naveled discus, held by you, the bull of the Vrishnis,

original: cakram apraticakreṇa bhuvi nānyo 'bhipadyate
analyzed: cakram apraticakreṇa bhuvi na anyaḥ bhipadyate
translated: No one else on earth can wield this invincible discus.

original: etāvad uktvā drauṇir māṃ yugyam aśvān dhanāni ca
analyzed: etāvat uktvā drauṇiḥ mām yugyam aśvān dhanāni ca
translated: Having said this much, Drona's son gave me his yoked horses and wealth,

original: ādāyopayayau bālo ratnāni vividhāni ca
analyzed: ādāya upayayau bālaḥ ratnāni vividhāni ca
translated: The boy took various jewels and returned.

original: sa saṃrambhī durātmā ca capalaḥ krūra eva ca
analyzed: sa saṃrambhī durātmā ca capalaḥ krūraḥ eva ca
translated: He was wrathful, evil-souled, fickle and cruel.

original: veda cāstraṃ brahmaśiras tasmād rakṣyo vṛkodaraḥ
analyzed: veda ca astram brahmaśiraḥ tasmāt rakṣyaḥ vṛkodaraḥ
translated: He knew the Brahma-shiras weapon, therefore Vrikodara should be protected.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: evam uktvā yudhāṃ śreṣṭhaḥ sarvayādavanandanaḥ🔽sarvāyudhavaropetam āruroha mahāratham
analyzed: evam uktvā yudhām śreṣṭhaḥ sarva yādava nandanaḥ  sarva āyudha vara upetam āruroha mahā ratham
translated: Having said this, the best of warriors, the delighter of all the Yadavas,🔽mounted his great chariot, which was equipped with all the best weapons.

original: yuktaṃ paramakāmbojais turagair hemamālibhiḥ
analyzed: yuktam parama kāmbojaiḥ turagaiḥ hema mālibhiḥ
translated: It was yoked with the best horses from Kamboja, adorned with golden garlands.

original: ādityodayavarṇasya dhuraṃ rathavarasya tu
analyzed: āditya udaya varṇasya dhuram ratha varasya tu
translated: On the right side of the chariot, which had the color of the rising sun,

original: dakṣiṇām avahat sainyaḥ sugrīvaḥ savyato 'vahat
analyzed: dakṣiṇām avahat sainyaḥ sugrīvaḥ savyatas vahat
translated: Sugriva pulled, and on the left side, Sainya pulled.

original: pārṣṇivāhau tu tasyāstāṃ meghapuṣpabalāhakau
analyzed: pārṣṇi vāhau tu tasya āstām meghapuṣpa balāhakau
translated: Meghapushpa and Balahaka were his rear guards.

original: viśvakarmakṛtā divyā nānāratnavibhūṣitā
analyzed: viśvakarma kṛtā divyā nānā ratna vibhūṣitā
translated: It was created by Vishvakarma, divine, adorned with various jewels,

original: ucchriteva rathe māyā dhvajayaṣṭir adṛśyata
analyzed: ucchritā iva rathe māyā dhvaja yaṣṭiḥ adṛśyata
translated: and the illusion of the chariot seemed to rise up, with a flagstaff visible.

original: vainateyaḥ sthitas tasyāṃ prabhāmaṇḍalaraśmivān
analyzed: vainateyaḥ sthitaḥ tasyām prabhā maṇḍala raśmivān
translated: Garuda was stationed on it, with a halo of light rays.

original: tasya satyavataḥ ketur bhujagārir adṛśyata
analyzed: tasya satyavataḥ ketuḥ bhujagāriḥ adṛśyata
translated: The flag of Satyavat, the enemy of serpents, was seen.

original: anvārohad dhṛṣīkeśaḥ ketuḥ sarvadhanuṣmatām
analyzed: anvārohat dhṛṣīkeśaḥ ketuḥ sarva dhanuṣmatām
translated: Hrishikesha, the flag of all archers, ascended it.

original: arjunaḥ satyakarmā ca kururājo yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
analyzed: arjunaḥ satya karmā ca kururājaḥ yudhiṣṭhiraḥ
translated: Arjuna, the one who performs truthful deeds, and Yudhishthira, the king of the Kurus,

original: aśobhetāṃ mahātmānau dāśārham abhitaḥ sthitau
analyzed: aśobhetām mahātmānau dāśārham abhitas sthitau
translated: Those two great souls stood near the Dasharha,

original: rathasthaṃ śārṅgadhanvānam aśvināv iva vāsavam
analyzed: ratha stham śārṅgadhanvānam aśvinau iva vāsavam
translated: like the Ashvins near Vasava, the wielder of Sharnga bow, standing on the chariot.

original: tāv upāropya dāśārhaḥ syandanaṃ lokapūjitam🔽pratodena javopetān paramāśvān acodayat
analyzed: tau upāropya dāśārhaḥ syandanam loka pūjitam  pratodena java upetān parama aśvān acodayat
translated: The Dasharha, worshipped by the world, made them ascend the chariot,🔽and urged the swift horses with the whip.

original: te hayāḥ sahasotpetur gṛhītvā syandanottamam
analyzed: te hayāḥ sahasā utpetuḥ gṛhītvā syandana uttamam
translated: Those horses suddenly took off, pulling the excellent chariot,

original: āsthitaṃ pāṇḍaveyābhyāṃ yadūnām ṛṣabheṇa ca
analyzed: āsthitam pāṇḍaveyābhyām yadūnām ṛṣabheṇa ca
translated: with the two Pandavas and the bull of the Yadu clan seated on it.

original: vahatāṃ śārṅgadhanvānam aśvānāṃ śīghragāminām
analyzed: vahatām śārṅgadhanvānam aśvānām śīghra gāminām
translated: As the horses, swift as thought, carried the wielder of Sharnga bow,

original: prādurāsīn mahāñ śabdaḥ pakṣiṇāṃ patatām iva
analyzed: prādurāsīt mahān śabdaḥ pakṣiṇām patatām iva
translated: a great sound arose, like the sound of flying birds.

original: te samārchan naravyāghrāḥ kṣaṇena bharatarṣabha
analyzed: te samārchat nara vyāghrāḥ kṣaṇena bharata ṛṣabha
translated: O bull among the Bharata lineage, in a moment those tigers among men

original: bhīmasenaṃ maheṣvāsaṃ samanudrutya vegitāḥ🔽krodhadīptaṃ tu kaunteyaṃ dviṣadarthe samudyatam
analyzed: bhīmasenam mahā iṣvāsam samanudrutya vegitāḥ  krodha dīptam tu kaunteyam dviṣat arthe samudyatam
translated: swiftly pursued the great archer Bhimasena.

original: nāśaknuvan vārayituṃ sametyāpi mahārathāḥ
analyzed: na aśaknuvan vārayitum sametya api mahā rathāḥ
translated: But the great warriors, even when they approached, were unable to restrain Kounteya, who was inflamed with rage,🔽ready to kill the enemy for the sake of the great-souled ones.

original: sa teṣāṃ prekṣatām eva śrīmatāṃ dṛḍhadhanvinām
analyzed: sa teṣām prekṣatām eva śrīmatām dṛḍha dhanvinām
translated: While those prosperous and firm archers looked on,

original: yayau bhāgirathīkacchaṃ haribhir bhṛśavegitaiḥ
analyzed: yayau bhāgirathī kaccham haribhiḥ bhṛśa vegitaiḥ
translated: he went to the banks of the Bhagirathi with his swift horses.

original: yatra sma śrūyate drauṇiḥ putrahantā mahātmanām
analyzed: yatra sma śrūyate drauṇiḥ putra hantā mahātmanām
translated: It is said that Drona's son, the slayer of the sons of the great-souled ones,🔽was there.

original: sa dadarśa mahātmānam udakānte yaśasvinam
analyzed: sa dadarśa mahātmānam udaka ante yaśasvinam
translated: He saw the illustrious and great-souled one,

original: kṛṣṇadvaipāyanaṃ vyāsam āsīnam ṛṣibhiḥ saha🔽taṃ caiva krūrakarmāṇaṃ ghṛtāktaṃ kuśacīriṇam
analyzed: kṛṣṇadvaipāyanam vyāsam āsīnam ṛṣibhiḥ saha  tam ca eva krūra karmāṇam ghṛta aktam kuśa cīriṇam
translated: Krishna Dvaipayana Vyasa, seated with the sages by the water's edge.🔽And near him he saw Drona's son, the performer of cruel deeds,🔽oiled and wearing kusha grass,

original: rajasā dhvastakeśāntaṃ dadarśa drauṇim antike
analyzed: rajasā dhvasta keśāntam dadarśa drauṇim antike
translated: with the ends of his hair covered in dust.

original: tam abhyadhāvat kaunteyaḥ pragṛhya saśaraṃ dhanuḥ
analyzed: tam abhyadhāvat kaunteyaḥ pragṛhya sa śaram dhanuḥ
translated: The mighty-armed Kounteya, grasping his bow and arrow,

original: bhīmaseno mahābāhus tiṣṭha tiṣṭheti cābravīt
analyzed: bhīmasenaḥ mahā bāhuḥ tiṣṭha tiṣṭha iti ca abravīt
translated: ran towards him, saying, Wait, wait!

original: sa dṛṣṭvā bhīmadhanvānaṃ pragṛhītaśarāsanam
analyzed: sa dṛṣṭvā bhīma dhanvānam pragṛhīta śarāsanam
translated: Seeing the one with the terrible bow, holding his bow and arrow,

original: bhrātarau pṛṣṭhataś cāsya janārdanarathe sthitau
analyzed: bhrātarau pṛṣṭhatas ca asya janārdana rathe sthitau
translated: and his two brothers standing behind him on Janardana's chariot,

original: vyathitātmābhavad drauṇiḥ prāptaṃ cedam amanyata
analyzed: vyathita ātmā abhavat drauṇiḥ prāptam ca idam amanyata
translated: Drona's son became distressed and thought that this was it.

original: sa tad divyam adīnātmā paramāstram acintayat🔽pradhakṣann iva kopena drauṇiḥ paramamanyumān
analyzed: sa tat divyam a dīna ātmā parama astram acintayat  pradhakṣan iva kopena drauṇiḥ parama manyumān
translated: The one with a generous soul then thought of that divine supreme weapon.🔽Drona's son, overcome with great anger,

original: jagrāha ca sa caiṣīkāṃ drauṇiḥ savyena pāṇinā
analyzed: jagrāha ca sa ca aiṣīkām drauṇiḥ savyena pāṇinā
translated: as if burning in rage, grasped a reed with his left hand.

original: sa tām āpadam āsādya divyam astram udīrayat
analyzed: sa tām āpadam āsādya divyam astram udīrayat
translated: Having encountered that danger, he invoked that divine weapon.

original: amṛṣyamāṇas tāñ śūrān divyāyudhadharān sthitān
analyzed: a mṛṣyamāṇaḥ tām śūrān divya āyudha dharān sthitān
translated: Unable to bear those heroes standing there with divine weapons,

original: apāṇḍavāyeti ruṣā vyasṛjad dāruṇaṃ vacaḥ
analyzed: a pāṇḍavāya iti ruṣā vyasṛjat dāruṇam vacaḥ
translated: he angrily uttered the terrible words, Not for the Pandavas!

original: ity uktvā rājaśārdūla droṇaputraḥ pratāpavān
analyzed: iti uktvā rāja śārdūla droṇaputraḥ pratāpavān
translated: Having said this, O tiger among kings, the powerful son of Drona

original: sarvalokapramohārthaṃ tad astraṃ pramumoca ha
analyzed: sarva loka pramoha artham tat astram pramumoca ha
translated: released that weapon for the purpose of deluding all the worlds.

original: tatas tasyām iṣīkāyāṃ pāvakaḥ samajāyata
analyzed: tatas tasyām iṣīkāyām pāvakaḥ samajāyata
translated: Then from that blade of grass, a fire arose

original: pradhakṣyann iva lokāṃs trīn kālāntakayamopamaḥ
analyzed: pradhakṣyan iva lokān trīn kāla antaka yama upamaḥ
translated: as if about to consume the three worlds, like the end of time, like Yama.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca🔽iṅgitenaiva dāśārhas tam abhiprāyam āditaḥ
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca  iṅgitena eva dāśārhaḥ tam abhiprāyam āditas
translated: Vaishampayana said:🔽The Dasharha (Krishna) understood from the gestures alone the intention of Drona's son from the beginning.

original: drauṇer buddhvā mahābāhur arjunaṃ pratyabhāṣata
analyzed: drauṇeḥ buddhvā mahā bāhuḥ arjunam pratyabhāṣata
translated: The mighty-armed one, having understood, spoke to Arjuna:

original: arjunārjuna yad divyam astraṃ te hṛdi vartate
analyzed: arjuna arjuna yat divyam astram te hṛdi vartate
translated: Arjuna, Arjuna, that divine weapon which is in your heart,

original: droṇopadiṣṭaṃ tasyāyaṃ kālaḥ saṃprati pāṇḍava
analyzed: droṇa upadiṣṭam tasya ayam kālaḥ saṃprati pāṇḍava
translated: taught by Drona, the time for it has come now, O Pandava.

original: bhrātṝṇām ātmanaś caiva paritrāṇāya bhārata
analyzed: bhrātṝṇām ātmanaḥ ca eva paritrāṇāya bhārata
translated: For the protection of your brothers and yourself, O Bharata,

original: visṛjaitat tvam apy ājāv astram astranivāraṇam
analyzed: visṛja etat tvam api ājau astram astra nivāraṇam
translated: release that weapon in the battle, which can counter all weapons.

original: keśavenaivam uktas tu pāṇḍavaḥ paravīrahā
analyzed: keśavena evam uktaḥ tu pāṇḍavaḥ para vīra hā
translated: Thus addressed by Keshava, the Pandava, the slayer of enemy heroes,

original: avātarad rathāt tūrṇaṃ pragṛhya saśaraṃ dhanuḥ
analyzed: avātarat rathāt tūrṇam pragṛhya sa śaram dhanuḥ
translated: quickly descended from his chariot, taking up his bow with an arrow fixed.

original: pūrvam ācāryaputrāya tato 'nantaram ātmane
analyzed: pūrvam ācārya putrāya tatas nantaram ātmane
translated: First to the son of the preceptor, then to himself,

original: bhrātṛbhyaś caiva sarvebhyaḥ svastīty uktvā paraṃtapaḥ
analyzed: bhrātṛbhyaḥ ca eva sarvebhyaḥ svasti iti uktvā paraṃtapaḥ
translated: and to all his brothers, having said May there be well-being, the scorcher of enemies

original: devatābhyo namaskṛtya gurubhyaś caiva sarvaśaḥ
analyzed: devatābhyaḥ namaskṛtya gurubhyaḥ ca eva sarvaśas
translated: Having bowed to the gods and to the teachers in every way,

original: utsasarja śivaṃ dhyāyann astram astreṇa śāmyatām
analyzed: utsasarja śivam dhyāyan astram astreṇa śāmyatām
translated: he released the weapon, thinking of Shiva, May the weapon be pacified by the weapon.

original: tatas tad astraṃ sahasā sṛṣṭaṃ gāṇḍīvadhanvanā
analyzed: tatas tat astram sahasā sṛṣṭam gāṇḍīvadhanvanā
translated: Then that weapon, suddenly released by the wielder of Gandiva,

original: prajajvāla mahārciṣmad yugāntānalasaṃnibham
analyzed: prajajvāla mahā arciṣmat yugānta anala saṃnibham
translated: blazed with great flames, resembling the fire at the end of the yuga.

original: tathaiva droṇaputrasya tad astraṃ tigmatejasaḥ
analyzed: tathā eva droṇaputrasya tat astram tigma tejasaḥ
translated: In the same way, the weapon of Drona's son, of fierce energy,

original: prajajvāla mahājvālaṃ tejomaṇḍalasaṃvṛtam
analyzed: prajajvāla mahā jvālam tejaḥ maṇḍala saṃvṛtam
translated: blazed with great flames, surrounded by a halo of radiance.

original: nirghātā bahavaś cāsan petur ulkāḥ sahasraśaḥ
analyzed: nirghātāḥ bahavaḥ ca āsan petuḥ ulkāḥ sahasraśas
translated: There were many loud noises, and meteors fell by the thousands.

original: mahad bhayaṃ ca bhūtānāṃ sarveṣāṃ samajāyata🔽saśabdam abhavad vyoma jvālāmālākulaṃ bhṛśam
analyzed: mahat bhayam ca bhūtānām sarveṣām samajāyata  sa śabdam abhavat vyoma jvālā mālā ākulam bhṛśam
translated: A great fear arose in all beings.🔽The sky became noisy, extremely agitated by garlands of flames.

original: cacāla ca mahī kṛtsnā saparvatavanadrumā🔽te astre tejasā lokāṃs tāpayantī vyavasthite
analyzed: cacāla ca mahī kṛtsnā sa parvata vana drumā  te astre tejasā lokān tāpayantī vyavasthite
translated: The entire earth trembled, with its mountains, forests, and trees.🔽When those weapons, scorching the worlds with their brilliance, were thus stationed,

original: maharṣī sahitau tatra darśayām āsatus tadā
analyzed: mahā ṛṣī sahitau tatra darśayām āsatuḥ tadā
translated: the great sages appeared there,

original: nāradaḥ sa ca dharmātmā bharatānāṃ pitāmahaḥ
analyzed: nāradaḥ sa ca dharma ātmā bharatānām pitāmahaḥ
translated: Narada and that righteous grandfather of the Bharatas.🔽Both of them, knowing all dharma and desiring the welfare of all beings,

original: ubhau śamayituṃ vīrau bhāradvājadhanaṃjayau🔽tau munī sarvadharmajñau sarvabhūtahitaiṣiṇau
analyzed: ubhau śamayitum vīrau bhāradvāja dhanaṃjayau 🔽tau munī sarva dharma jñau sarva bhūta hita eṣiṇau
translated: came to pacify those two heroes, Bharadvaja's son and Dhananjaya.

original: dīptayor astrayor madhye sthitau paramatejasau
analyzed: dīptayoḥ astrayoḥ madhye sthitau parama tejasau
translated: Those two, of supreme splendor, stood in the middle of those two blazing weapons.

original: tadantaram anādhṛṣyāv upagamya yaśasvinau
analyzed: tad antaram anādhṛṣyau upagamya yaśasvinau
translated: Those two illustrious ones, unassailable, approached that space.

original: āstām ṛṣivarau tatra jvalitāv iva pāvakau
analyzed: āstām ṛṣi varau tatra jvalitau iva pāvakau
translated: Those two best of sages stood there, blazing like fire.

original: prāṇabhṛdbhir anādhṛṣyau devadānavasaṃmatau
analyzed: prāṇa bhṛdbhiḥ anādhṛṣyau deva dānava saṃmatau
translated: Those two, revered by gods and demons, were unassailable by living beings.

original: astratejaḥ śamayituṃ lokānāṃ hitakāmyayā
analyzed: astra tejaḥ śamayitum lokānām hita kāmyayā
translated: Desiring the welfare of the worlds, to pacify the energy of the weapons,

original: ṛṣī ūcatuḥ
analyzed: ṛṣī ūcatuḥ
translated: The sages said:

original: nānāśastravidaḥ pūrve ye 'py atītā mahārathāḥ🔽saṃjahāra haṃ śaraṃ divyaṃ tvaramāṇo mahārathāḥthaḥ🔽naitad astraṃ manuṣyeṣu taiḥ prayuktaṃ kathaṃ cana🔽kim idaṃ sāhasaṃ vīrau kṛtavantau mahātyayam🔽vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca🔽dṛṣṭvaiva naraśārdūlas tāv agnisamatejasau
analyzed: nānā śastra vidaḥ pūrve ye pi atītāḥ mahā rathāḥ  saṃjahāra ham śaram divyam tvaramāṇaḥ  na etat astram manuṣyeṣu taiḥ prayuktam katham cana  kim idam sāhasam vīrau kṛtavantau mahā atyayam  vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca  dṛṣṭvā eva nara śārdūlaḥ tau agni sama tejasau
translated: Those great warriors of the past, who were skilled in various weapons,

original: gāṇḍīvadhanvā saṃcintya prāptakālaṃ mahārathaḥ🔽saṃjahāra śaraṃ divyaṃ tvaramāṇo dhanaṃjayaḥ
analyzed: gāṇḍīvadhanvā saṃcintya prāpta kālam mahā rathaḥ  saṃjahāra śaram divyam tvaramāṇaḥ dhanaṃjayaḥ
translated: The wielder of the Gandiva, that great chariot, having seen those two who were like the fire in splendor,🔽thought for a moment and quickly withdrew the divine arrow.

original: uvāca vadatāṃ śreṣṭhas tāv ṛṣī prāñjalis tadā
analyzed: uvāca vadatām śreṣṭhaḥ tau ṛṣī prāñjaliḥ tadā
translated: That best of speakers, Dhananjaya, with folded hands, said to those two sages:

original: prayuktam astram astreṇa śāmyatām iti vai mayā
analyzed: prayuktam astram astreṇa śāmyatām iti vai mayā
translated: I said that the weapon should be pacified by another weapon.🔽Having said this, the best of the Bharata lineage, the son of Pandu,

original: saṃhṛte paramāstre 'smin sarvān asmān aśeṣataḥ
analyzed: saṃhṛte parama astre smin sarvān asmān aśeṣatas
translated: When this supreme weapon was withdrawn, all of us were completely🔽

original: pāpakarmā dhruvaṃ drauṇiḥ pradhakṣyaty astratejasā
analyzed: pāpa karmā dhruvam drauṇiḥ pradhakṣyati astra tejasā
translated: When this supreme weapon has been withdrawn, the sinful son of Drona will certainly consume all of us without exception🔽with the energy of his weapon.

original: atra yad dhitam asmākaṃ lokānāṃ caiva sarvathā
analyzed: atra yat hitam asmākam lokānām ca eva sarvathā
translated: In this matter, whatever is beneficial for us and for all the worlds

original: bhavantau devasaṃkāśau tathā saṃhartum arhataḥ
analyzed: bhavantau deva saṃkāśau tathā saṃhartum arhataḥ
translated: in every way, you two who are like gods, should withdraw it accordingly.

original: ity uktvā saṃjahārāstraṃ punar eva dhanaṃjayaḥ
analyzed: iti uktvā saṃjahāra astram punar eva dhanaṃjayaḥ
translated: Having said this, Dhananjaya again withdrew the weapon.

original: saṃhāro duṣkaras tasya devair api hi saṃyuge
analyzed: saṃhāraḥ duṣkaraḥ tasya devaiḥ api hi saṃyuge
translated: Its withdrawal is difficult, even for the gods, in battle.

original: visṛṣṭasya raṇe tasya paramāstrasya saṃgrahe
analyzed: visṛṣṭasya raṇe tasya parama astrasya saṃgrahe
translated: In withdrawing that supreme weapon released in battle,

original: na śaktaḥ pāṇḍavād anyaḥ sākṣād api śatakratuḥ
analyzed: na śaktaḥ pāṇḍavāt anyaḥ sākṣāt api śatakratuḥ
translated: no one but the Pandava, not even Indra himself, is capable.

original: brahmatejobhavaṃ tad dhi visṛṣṭam akṛtātmanā🔽na śakyam āvartayituṃ brahmacārivratād ṛte
analyzed: brahma tejaḥ bhavam tat hi visṛṣṭam akṛtātmanā  na śakyam āvartayitum brahmacāri vratāt ṛte
translated: That weapon, born of the energy of Brahma, was released by one of impure soul🔽and cannot be turned back except by one who has observed the vow of celibacy.

original: acīrṇabrahmacaryo yaḥ sṛṣṭvāvartayate punaḥ
analyzed: a cīrṇa brahmacaryaḥ yaḥ sṛṣṭvā āvartayate punar
translated: One who has not practiced celibacy, having released it,

original: tad astraṃ sānubandhasya mūrdhānaṃ tasya kṛntati🔽brahmacārī vratī cāpi duravāpam avāpya tat
analyzed: tat astram sānubandhasya mūrdhānam tasya kṛntati  brahmacārī vratī ca api duravāpam avāpya tat
translated: that weapon severs the head of him and his followers.🔽Even though afflicted by the greatest calamity, Arjuna, who had observed the vow of celibacy and obtained that weapon which is difficult to obtain,

original: paramavyasanārto 'pi nārjuno 'straṃ vyamuñcata
analyzed: parama vyasana ārtaḥ pi nā arjunaḥ stram vyamuñcata
translated: did not release the weapon.

original: satyavratadharaḥ śūro brahmacārī ca pāṇḍavaḥ
analyzed: satya vrata dharaḥ śūraḥ brahmacārī ca pāṇḍavaḥ
translated: The Pandava, who was truthful, heroic, celibate, and a brahmachari,

original: guruvartī ca tenāstraṃ saṃjahārārjunaḥ punaḥ
analyzed: guru vartī ca tena astram saṃjahāra arjunaḥ punar
translated: Arjuna again withdrew that weapon, following the preceptor's command.

original: drauṇir apy atha saṃprekṣya tāv ṛṣī purataḥ sthitau
analyzed: drauṇiḥ api atha saṃprekṣya tau ṛṣī puratas sthitau
translated: Drona's son, seeing those two sages standing in front,

original: na śaśāka punar ghoram astraṃ saṃhartum āhave
analyzed: na śaśāka punar ghoram astram saṃhartum āhave
translated: was unable to withdraw the terrible weapon again in the battle.

original: aśaktaḥ pratisaṃhāre paramāstrasya saṃyuge
analyzed: aśaktaḥ pratisaṃhāre parama astrasya saṃyuge
translated: Unable to withdraw the supreme weapon in the battle,

original: drauṇir dīnamanā rājan dvaipāyanam abhāṣata
analyzed: drauṇiḥ dīna manāḥ rājan dvaipāyanam abhāṣata
translated: Drona's son, with a dejected mind, spoke to Dvaipayana, O king:

original: uttamavyasanārtena prāṇatrāṇam abhīpsunā
analyzed: uttama vyasana ārtena prāṇa trāṇam abhīpsunā
translated: By one afflicted with the utmost calamity, desiring to save his life,

original: mayaitad astram utsṛṣṭaṃ bhīmasenabhayān mune
analyzed: mayā etat astram utsṛṣṭam bhīmasena bhayāt mune
translated: this weapon was released by me out of fear of Bhimasena, O sage.

original: adharmaś ca kṛto 'nena dhārtarāṣṭraṃ jighāṃsatā
analyzed: adharmaḥ ca kṛtaḥ nena dhārtarāṣṭram jighāṃsatā
translated: And this one, desiring to kill the son of Dhritarashtra, has committed an unrighteous act,

original: mithyācāreṇa bhagavan bhīmasenena saṃyuge
analyzed: mithyā ācāreṇa bhagavan bhīmasenena saṃyuge
translated: through deceitful conduct, O Lord, by Bhimasena in the battle.

original: ataḥ sṛṣṭam idaṃ brahman mayāstram akṛtātmanā
analyzed: atas sṛṣṭam idam brahman mayā astram akṛtātmanā
translated: Therefore, O Brahmana, this weapon was released by me, of impure soul.

original: tasya bhūyo 'dya saṃhāraṃ kartuṃ nāham ihotsahe
analyzed: tasya bhūyas dya saṃhāram kartum na aham iha utsahe
translated: I am not able to withdraw it again here.

original: visṛṣṭaṃ hi mayā divyam etad astraṃ durāsadam🔽apāṇḍavāyeti mune vahnitejo 'numantrya vai🔽tad idaṃ pāṇḍaveyānām antakāyābhisaṃhitam
analyzed: visṛṣṭam hi mayā divyam etat astram durāsadam  a pāṇḍavāya iti mune vahni tejaḥ numantrya vai  tat idam pāṇḍaveyānām antakāya abhisaṃhitam
translated: For this invincible divine weapon has been released by me,🔽having invoked the fire's energy, O sage, saying 'Not for the Pandavas.'🔽Aiming it at the destruction of the Pandavas,

original: adya pāṇḍusutān sarvāñ jīvitād bhraṃśayiṣyati
analyzed: adya pāṇḍu sutān sarvām jīvitāt bhraṃśayiṣyati
translated: it will today deprive all the sons of Pandu of their lives.

original: kṛtaṃ pāpam idaṃ brahman roṣāviṣṭena cetasā
analyzed: kṛtam pāpam idam brahman roṣa āviṣṭena cetasā
translated: O Brahmana, this sin has been committed by me with a mind overwhelmed with anger,

original: vadham āśāsya pārthānāṃ mayāstraṃ sṛjatā raṇe
analyzed: vadham āśāsya pārthānām mayā astram sṛjatā raṇe
translated: having wished for the destruction of the Parthas, by discharging this weapon in battle.

original: vyāsa uvāca
analyzed: vyāsaḥ uvāca
translated: Vyasa said:

original: astraṃ brahmaśiras tāta vidvān pārtho dhanaṃjayaḥ
analyzed: astram brahmaśiraḥ tāta vidvān pārthaḥ dhanaṃjayaḥ
translated: O son, the learned Partha Dhananjaya,

original: utsṛṣṭavān na roṣeṇa na vadhāya tavāhave
analyzed: utsṛṣṭavān na roṣeṇa na vadhāya tava āhave
translated: discharged the Brahma-head weapon, not out of anger, nor for the destruction of your army in battle,

original: astram astreṇa tu raṇe tava saṃśamayiṣyatā
analyzed: astram astreṇa tu raṇe tava saṃśamayiṣyatā
translated: but in order to counter your weapon with his own weapon in the battle,

original: visṛṣṭam arjunenedaṃ punaś ca pratisaṃhṛtam
analyzed: visṛṣṭam arjunena idam punar ca pratisaṃhṛtam
translated: and it was released by Arjuna and then withdrawn again.

original: brahmāstram apy avāpyaitad upadeśāt pitus tava
analyzed: brahmāstram api avāpya etat upadeśāt pituḥ tava
translated: Even after obtaining that Brahma weapon through your father's instruction,

original: kṣatradharmān mahābāhur nākampata dhanaṃjayaḥ
analyzed: kṣatra dharmāt mahā bāhuḥ na akampata dhanaṃjayaḥ
translated: the mighty-armed Dhananjaya did not waver from the duties of a kshatriya.

original: evaṃ dhṛtimataḥ sādhoḥ sarvāstraviduṣaḥ sataḥ🔽sabhrātṛbandhoḥ kasmāt tvaṃ vadham asya cikīrṣasi
analyzed: evam dhṛtimataḥ sādhoḥ sarva astra viduṣaḥ sataḥ  sa bhrātṛ bandhoḥ kasmāt tvam vadham asya cikīrṣasi
translated: Thus, why do you wish to kill him, who is patient, virtuous, knowledgeable in all weapons, and righteous,🔽together with his brothers, when the Brahma-head weapon is destroyed by a supreme weapon,🔽for twelve years the rain god does not shower rain on that country.🔽It is for this reason that the mighty-armed Pandava,🔽though capable, does not destroy that weapon, desiring the welfare of the people.🔽O king, the weapon that was released by Arjuna, the best of the Kurus,🔽has been withdrawn by him, O king, out of compassion for you and for the people.🔽 Translation: This sin, O Brahmana, has been committed by me with a mind overwhelmed with anger,🔽having wished for the destruction of the Parthas, by discharging this weapon in battle.🔽Vyasa said:🔽O son, the learned Partha Dhananjaya,🔽discharged the Brahma-head weapon, not out of anger, nor for the destruction of your army in battle,🔽but in order to counter your weapon with his own weapon in the battle,🔽and it was released by Arjuna and then withdrawn again.

original: astraṃ brahmaśiro yatra paramāstreṇa vadhyate
analyzed: astram brahmaśiraḥ yatra parama astreṇa vadhyate
translated: Even after obtaining that Brahma weapon through your father's instruction,🔽the mighty-armed Dhananjaya did not waver from the duties of a kshatriya.🔽Thus, why do you wish to kill him, who is patient, virtuous, knowledgeable in all weapons, and righteous,🔽together with his brothers, when the Brahma-head weapon is destroyed by a supreme weapon,

original: samā dvādaśa parjanyas tad rāṣṭraṃ nābhivarṣati
analyzed: samāḥ dvādaśa parjanyaḥ tat rāṣṭram na abhivarṣati
translated: for twelve years the rain god does not shower rain on that country.

original: etadarthaṃ mahābāhuḥ śaktimān api pāṇḍavaḥ
analyzed: etad artham mahā bāhuḥ śaktimān api pāṇḍavaḥ
translated: It is for this reason that the mighty-armed Pandava,

original: na vihanty etad astraṃ te prajāhitacikīrṣayā
analyzed: na vihanti etat astram te prajā hita cikīrṣayā
translated: though capable, does not destroy that weapon, desiring the welfare of the people.🔽O king,

original: pāṇḍavās tvaṃ ca rāṣṭraṃ ca sadā saṃrakṣyam eva naḥ
analyzed: pāṇḍavāḥ tvam ca rāṣṭram ca sadā saṃrakṣyam eva naḥ
translated: The Pandavas, you and the kingdom are always to be protected by us.

original: tasmāt saṃhara divyaṃ tvam astram etan mahābhuja
analyzed: tasmāt saṃhara divyam tvam astram etat mahā bhuja
translated: Therefore, O mighty-armed one, withdraw this divine weapon.

original: aroṣas tava caivāstu pārthāḥ santu nirāmayāḥ
analyzed: aroṣaḥ tava ca eva astu pārthāḥ santu nirāmayāḥ
translated: Let there be no anger in you, let the Parthas be free from disease.

original: na hy adharmeṇa rājarṣiḥ pāṇḍavo jetum icchati
analyzed: na hi adharmeṇa rājarṣiḥ pāṇḍavaḥ jetum icchati
translated: The royal sage Pandava does not wish to conquer through unrighteousness.

original: maṇiṃ caitaṃ prayacchaibhyo yas te śirasi tiṣṭhati
analyzed: maṇim ca etam prayaccha ebhyaḥ yaḥ te śirasi tiṣṭhati
translated: And give them this gem that is on your head.

original: etad ādāya te prāṇān pratidāsyanti pāṇḍavāḥ
analyzed: etat ādāya te prāṇān pratidāsyanti pāṇḍavāḥ
translated: Taking this, the Pandavas will return your life.

original: drauṇir uvāca
analyzed: drauṇiḥ uvāca
translated: Drona's son said:

original: pāṇḍavair yāni ratnāni yac cānyat kauravair dhanam
analyzed: pāṇḍavaiḥ yāni ratnāni yat ca anyat kauravaiḥ dhanam
translated: The jewels obtained by the Pandavas and the wealth of the Kauravas,

original: avāptānīha tebhyo 'yaṃ maṇir mama viśiṣyate
analyzed: avāptāni iha tebhyaḥ yam maṇiḥ mama viśiṣyate
translated: this gem of mine is superior to all that.

original: yam ābadhya bhayaṃ nāsti śastravyādhikṣudhāśrayam
analyzed: yam ābadhya bhayam nā asti śastra vyādhi kṣudhā āśrayam
translated: Wearing it, there is no fear from weapons, disease, hunger or thirst,

original: devebhyo dānavebhyo vā nāgebhyo vā kathaṃ cana
analyzed: devebhyaḥ dānavebhyaḥ vā nāgebhyaḥ vā katham cana
translated: from gods, demons or serpents in any way,

original: na ca rakṣogaṇabhayaṃ na taskarabhayaṃ tathā
analyzed: na ca rakṣaḥ gaṇa bhayam na taskara bhayam tathā
translated: nor fear from hordes of rakshasas or thieves.

original: evaṃvīryo maṇir ayaṃ na me tyājyaḥ kathaṃ cana
analyzed: evaṃvīryaḥ maṇiḥ ayam na me tyājyaḥ katham cana
translated: This gem of such power is never to be abandoned by me in any way.

original: yat tu me bhagavān āha tan me kāryam anantaram
analyzed: yat tu me bhagavān āha tat me kāryam anantaram
translated: But what the Blessed One has said to me, that is to be done by me immediately.

original: ayaṃ maṇir ayaṃ cāham iṣīkā nipatiṣyati
analyzed: ayam maṇiḥ ayam ca aham iṣīkā nipatiṣyati
translated: This gem, this I, and this blade of grass will fall down.

original: na ca śakto 'smi bhagavan saṃhartuṃ punar udyatam
analyzed: na ca śaktaḥ smi bhagavan saṃhartum punar udyatam
translated: But, O Lord, I am not able to withdraw this weapon once it is raised.

original: etad astram ataś caiva garbheṣu visṛjāmy aham
analyzed: etat astram atas ca eva garbheṣu visṛjāmi aham
translated: Therefore, I shall release it on the embryos.

original: na ca vākyaṃ bhagavato na kariṣye mahāmune
analyzed: na ca vākyam bhagavataḥ na kariṣye mahā mune
translated: And, O great sage, I shall not disobey the words of the Lord.

original: prāha droṇasutaṃ tatra vyāsaḥ paramadurmanāḥ
analyzed: prāha droṇa sutam tatra vyāsaḥ parama durmanāḥ
translated: Vyasa, extremely distressed, spoke to Drona's son there:

original: garbheṣu pāṇḍaveyānām amoghaṃ caitad udyatam
analyzed: garbheṣu pāṇḍaveyānām amogham ca etat udyatam
translated: Release this unfailing weapon on the embryos of the Pandavas.

original: vyāsa uvāca
analyzed: vyāsaḥ uvāca
translated: Vyasa said:

original: evaṃ kuru na cānyā te buddhiḥ kāryā kadā cana
analyzed: evam kuru na ca anyā te buddhiḥ kāryā kadā cana
translated: Do this, and never entertain any other thought.

original: garbheṣu pāṇḍaveyānāṃ visṛjyaitad upārama
analyzed: garbheṣu pāṇḍaveyānām visṛjya etat upārama
translated: Release this on the embryos of the Pandavas and desist.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: tataḥ paramam astraṃ tad aśvatthāmā bhṛśāturaḥ
analyzed: tatas paramam astram tat aśvatthāmā bhṛśa āturaḥ
translated: Then Ashvatthama, greatly afflicted,

original: dvaipāyanavacaḥ śrutvā garbheṣu pramumoca ha
analyzed: dvaipāyana vacaḥ śrutvā garbheṣu pramumoca ha
translated: released that supreme weapon on the embryos, having heard Dvaipayana's words.

original: tam uvāca hṛṣīkeśaḥ pāṇḍavānāṃ hite rataḥ
analyzed: tam uvāca hṛṣīkeśaḥ pāṇḍavānām hite rataḥ
translated: Hrishikesha, devoted to the welfare of the Pandavas, said to him:

original: bhaviṣyam ekam utsṛjya garbheṣv astraṃ nipātyatām
analyzed: bhaviṣyam ekam utsṛjya garbheṣu astram nipātyatām
translated: Release this weapon on the embryos, sparing one who is to be born in the future.

original: aham ekaṃ dadāmy eṣāṃ piṇḍadaṃ kīrtivardhanam
analyzed: aham ekam dadāmi eṣām piṇḍa dam kīrti vardhanam
translated: I shall give them one who will offer funeral cakes, who will enhance their fame,

original: rājarṣiṃ puṇyakarmāṇam anekakratuyājinam
analyzed: rājarṣim puṇya karmāṇam aneka kratu yājinam
translated: a royal sage of meritorious deeds, who will perform many sacrifices.

original: evaṃ kuru na cānyā te buddhiḥ kāryā kathaṃ cana
analyzed: evam kuru na ca anyā te buddhiḥ kāryā katham cana
translated: Do this, and never entertain any other thought.

original: ā garbhāt pāṇḍaveyānāṃ kṛtvā pātaṃ vinaṅkṣyati
analyzed: ā garbhāt pāṇḍaveyānām kṛtvā pātam vinaṅkṣyati
translated: Having caused the destruction of the Pandavas from the womb, he will perish.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: tad ājñāya hṛṣīkeśo visṛṣṭaṃ pāpakarmaṇā
analyzed: tat ājñāya hṛṣīkeśaḥ visṛṣṭam pāpa karmaṇā
translated: Hrishikesha, having understood that the sinful act had been performed,

original: hṛṣyamāṇa idaṃ vākyaṃ drauṇiṃ pratyabravīt tadā
analyzed: hṛṣyamāṇaḥ idam vākyam drauṇim pratyabravīt tadā
translated: spoke these words to Drona's son with a joyful heart:

original: virāṭasya sutāṃ pūrvaṃ snuṣāṃ gāṇḍīvadhanvanaḥ
analyzed: virāṭasya sutām pūrvam snuṣām gāṇḍīvadhanvanaḥ
translated: In the past, when the daughter of Virata, the daughter-in-law of the wielder of Gandiva,

original: upaplavyagatāṃ dṛṣṭvā vratavān brāhmaṇo 'bravīt
analyzed: upaplavya gatām dṛṣṭvā vratavān brāhmaṇaḥ bravīt
translated: was seen by a vow-observing brahmin in Upaplavya, he said:

original: parikṣīṇeṣu kuruṣu putras tava janiṣyati
analyzed: parikṣīṇeṣu kuruṣu putraḥ tava janiṣyati
translated: When the Kurus are destroyed, a son will be born to you.

original: etad asya parikṣittvaṃ garbhasthasya bhaviṣyati
analyzed: etat asya parikṣit tvam garbha sthasya bhaviṣyati
translated: While still in the womb, he will be known as Parikshit.

original: tasya tad vacanaṃ sādhoḥ satyam eva bhaviṣyati
analyzed: tasya tat vacanam sādhoḥ satyam eva bhaviṣyati
translated: His words, which are true, will come to pass.

original: parikṣid bhavitā hy eṣāṃ punar vaṃśakaraḥ sutaḥ
analyzed: parikṣit bhavitā hi eṣām punar vaṃśa karaḥ sutaḥ
translated: This son, Parikshit, will be the perpetuator of their lineage.

original: evaṃ bruvāṇaṃ govindaṃ sātvatapravaraṃ tadā
analyzed: evam bruvāṇam govindam sātvata pravaram tadā
translated: When Govinda, the best of the Satvatas, said this,

original: drauṇiḥ paramasaṃrabdhaḥ pratyuvācedam uttaram
analyzed: drauṇiḥ parama saṃrabdhaḥ pratyuvāca idam uttaram
translated: Drona's son, filled with great anger, replied with the following:

original: naitad evaṃ yathāttha tvaṃ pakṣapātena keśava
analyzed: na etat evam yathā āttha tvam pakṣapātena keśava
translated: This is not as you say, O Keshava, out of partiality.

original: vacanaṃ puṇḍarīkākṣa na ca madvākyam anyathā
analyzed: vacanam puṇḍarīkākṣa na ca mad vākyam anyathā
translated: O lotus-eyed one, my words cannot be otherwise.

original: patiṣyaty etad astraṃ hi garbhe tasyā mayodyatam
analyzed: patiṣyati etat astram hi garbhe tasyāḥ mayā udyatam
translated: This weapon, raised by me, will fall on her womb.

original: virāṭaduhituḥ kṛṣṇa yāṃ tvaṃ rakṣitum icchasi
analyzed: virāṭa duhituḥ kṛṣṇa yām tvam rakṣitum icchasi
translated: O Krishna, you wish to protect the daughter of Virata.

original: vāsudeva uvāca
analyzed: vāsudevaḥ uvāca
translated: Vasudeva said:

original: amoghaḥ paramāstrasya pātas tasya bhaviṣyati
analyzed: amoghaḥ parama astrasya pātaḥ tasya bhaviṣyati
translated: The fall of that supreme weapon will not be fruitless.

original: abhimanyoḥ sṛjaiṣīkāṃ garbhasthaḥ śāmyatāṃ śiśuḥ
analyzed: abhimanyoḥ sṛja eṣīkām garbha sthaḥ śāmyatām śiśuḥ
translated: Shoot the arrow at Abhimanyu, may the child in the womb be pacified.

original: aham etaṃ mṛtaṃ jātaṃ jīvayiṣyāmi bālakam
analyzed: aham etam mṛtam jātam jīvayiṣyāmi bālakam
translated: I will revive this child who is born dead.

original: sa tu garbho mṛto jāto dīrgham āyur avāpsyati
analyzed: sa tu garbhaḥ mṛtaḥ jātaḥ dīrgham āyuḥ avāpsyati
translated: But that embryo, though dead, will attain a long life.

original: ity uktaḥ pratyuvācedaṃ droṇaputraḥ smayann iva
analyzed: iti uktaḥ pratyuvāca idam droṇaputraḥ smayan iva
translated: Thus addressed, Drona's son, as if smiling, replied:

original: yady astradagdhaṃ govinda jīvayasy evam astv iti
analyzed: yadi astra dagdham govinda jīvayasi evam astu iti
translated: If you can revive what is burnt by the weapon, O Govinda, let it be so.

original: tvāṃ tu kāpuruṣaṃ pāpaṃ viduḥ sarve manīṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: tvām tu kāpuruṣam pāpam viduḥ sarve manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: But all the wise ones know you to be a coward and a sinner,

original: asakṛt pāpakarmāṇaṃ bālajīvitaghātakam
analyzed: asakṛt pāpa karmāṇam bāla jīvita ghātakam
translated: Repeatedly committing sinful acts, a killer of a child's life.

original: tasmāt tvam asya pāpasya karmaṇaḥ phalam āpnuhi
analyzed: tasmāt tvam asya pāpasya karmaṇaḥ phalam āpnuhi
translated: Therefore, you will reap the fruit of this sinful act.

original: trīṇi varṣasahasrāṇi cariṣyasi mahīm imām
analyzed: trīṇi varṣa sahasrāṇi cariṣyasi mahīm imām
translated: For three thousand years you will wander over this earth,

original: aprāpnuvan kva cit kāṃ cit saṃvidaṃ jātu kena cit
analyzed: a prāpnuvan kva cit kām cit saṃvidam jātu kena cit
translated: Never finding any companionship with anyone anywhere.

original: nirjanān asahāyas tvaṃ deśān pravicariṣyasi
analyzed: nirjanān asahāyaḥ tvam deśān pravicariṣyasi
translated: Alone, without companions, you will roam through uninhabited lands.

original: bhavitrī na hi te kṣudra janamadhyeṣu saṃsthitiḥ
analyzed: bhavitrī na hi te kṣudra jana madhyeṣu saṃsthitiḥ
translated: O wretch, you will not be able to stay among people.

original: pūyaśoṇitagandhī ca durgakāntārasaṃśrayaḥ
analyzed: pūya śoṇita gandhī ca durga kāntāra saṃśrayaḥ
translated: Smelling of pus and blood, you will dwell in impassable wildernesses.

original: vicariṣyasi pāpātman sarvavyādhisamanvitaḥ
analyzed: vicariṣyasi pāpa ātman sarva vyādhi samanvitaḥ
translated: You will wander around, O sinful one, afflicted with all kinds of diseases.

original: vayaḥ prāpya parikṣit tu vedavratam avāpya ca
analyzed: vayaḥ prāpya parikṣit tu vedavratam avāpya ca
translated: Having attained youth and having obtained the vow of the Vedas,

original: kṛpāc chāradvatād vīraḥ sarvāstrāṇy upalapsyate
analyzed: kṛpāt śāradvatāt vīraḥ sarva astrāṇi upalapsyate
translated: the hero Parikshit will obtain all weapons from Kripa Sharadvat.

original: viditvā paramāstrāṇi kṣatradharmavrate sthitaḥ
analyzed: viditvā parama astrāṇi kṣatra dharma vrate sthitaḥ
translated: Knowing the supreme weapons and abiding by the vow of the Kshatriya dharma,

original: ṣaṣṭiṃ varṣāṇi dharmātmā vasudhāṃ pālayiṣyati
analyzed: ṣaṣṭim varṣāṇi dharma ātmā vasudhām pālayiṣyati
translated: the righteous one will rule the earth for sixty years.

original: itaś cordhvaṃ mahābāhuḥ kururājo bhaviṣyati
analyzed: itas ca ūrdhvam mahā bāhuḥ kururājaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: From here onwards, the mighty-armed one will be the king of the Kurus.

original: prayayau jāhnavīkacchāt kṣiptāstraś cottarāṃ diśam🔽parikṣin nāma nṛpatir miṣatas te sudurmate
analyzed: prayayau jāhnavī kacchāt kṣipta astraḥ ca uttarām diśam  parikṣit nāma nṛpatiḥ miṣataḥ te su durmate
translated: And having cast aside his weapons, he will go to the northern direction.🔽O extremely evil-minded one, while you look on,

original: ahaṃ taṃ jīvayiṣyāmi dagdham astrāgnitejasā
analyzed: aham tam jīvayiṣyāmi dagdham astra agni tejasā
translated: I will revive that king named Parikshit, who has been burned by the energy of my weapon.

original: paśya me tapaso vīryaṃ satyasya ca narādhama
analyzed: paśya me tapasaḥ vīryam satyasya ca nara adhama
translated: O lowest of men, behold the power of my austerities and truth.

original: vyāsa uvāca
analyzed: vyāsaḥ uvāca
translated: Vyasa said:

original: yasmād anādṛtya kṛtaṃ tvayāsmān karma dāruṇam
analyzed: yasmāt an ādṛtya kṛtam tvayā asmān karma dāruṇam
translated: Since you have performed this terrible deed disregarding us,

original: brāhmaṇasya sataś caiva yasmāt te vṛttam īdṛśam
analyzed: brāhmaṇasya sataḥ ca eva yasmāt te vṛttam īdṛśam
translated: and since your conduct is like this even though you are a Brahmana,

original: tasmād yad devakīputra uktavān uttamaṃ vacaḥ
analyzed: tasmāt yat devakīputraḥ uktavān uttamam vacaḥ
translated: therefore, what the son of Devaki has said in his supreme speech,

original: asaṃśayaṃ te tad bhāvi kṣudrakarman vrajāśv itaḥ
analyzed: asaṃśayam te tat bhāvi kṣudra karman vraja āśu itas
translated: will undoubtedly come to pass, O wretch of an action, go from here.

original: aśvatthāmovāca
analyzed: aśvatthāmā uvāca
translated: Ashvatthama said:

original: sahaiva bhavatā brahman sthāsyāmi puruṣeṣv aham
analyzed: saha eva bhavatā brahman sthāsyāmi puruṣeṣu aham
translated: O Brahmana, I shall remain among men with you.

original: satyavāg astu bhagavān ayaṃ ca puruṣottamaḥ
analyzed: satya vāc astu bhagavān ayam ca puruṣottamaḥ
translated: May the Blessed One and this Supreme Being be truthful in their words.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: pradāyātha maṇiṃ drauṇiḥ pāṇḍavānāṃ mahātmanām
analyzed: pradāya atha maṇim drauṇiḥ pāṇḍavānām mahātmanām
translated: Having given the jewel to the great-souled Pandavas,

original: jagāma vimanās teṣāṃ sarveṣāṃ paśyatāṃ vanam
analyzed: jagāma vimanāḥ teṣām sarveṣām paśyatām vanam
translated: Drona's son, with a troubled mind, went to the forest while all of them were watching.

original: pāṇḍavāś cāpi govindaṃ puraskṛtya hatadviṣaḥ
analyzed: pāṇḍavāḥ ca api govindam puraskṛtya hata dviṣaḥ
translated: The Pandavas, with Govinda at the forefront, having killed their enemies,

original: kṛṣṇadvaipāyanaṃ caiva nāradaṃ ca mahāmunim🔽droṇaputrasya sahajaṃ maṇim ādāya satvarāḥ
analyzed: kṛṣṇadvaipāyanam ca eva nāradam ca mahā munim  droṇaputrasya sahajam maṇim ādāya sa tvarāḥ
translated: Krishna Dvaipayana, and also the great sage Narada,🔽quickly took the jewel that was born with Drona's son

original: draupadīm abhyadhāvanta prāyopetāṃ manasvinīm
analyzed: draupadīm abhyadhāvanta prāya upetām manasvinīm
translated: and ran to the wise Droupadi, who was about to perform austerities.

original: tatas te puruṣavyāghrāḥ sadaśvair anilopamaiḥ
analyzed: tatas te puruṣa vyāghrāḥ sat aśvaiḥ anila upamaiḥ
translated: Then those tigers among men, together with Dasharha,

original: abhyayuḥ sahadāśārhāḥ śibiraṃ punar eva ha
analyzed: abhyayus saha dāśārhāḥ śibiram punar eva ha
translated: with swift horses like the wind, again approached their camp.

original: avatīrya rathābhyāṃ tu tvaramāṇā mahārathāḥ
analyzed: avatīrya rathābhyām tu tvaramāṇāḥ mahā rathāḥ
translated: Those great warriors, having descended from their chariots, hurried

original: dadṛśur draupadīṃ kṛṣṇām ārtām ārtatarāḥ svayam
analyzed: dadṛśuḥ draupadīm kṛṣṇām ārtām ārtatarāḥ svayam
translated: and saw Krishna Droupadi, who was afflicted, more afflicted than they themselves.

original: tām upetya nirānandāṃ duḥkhaśokasamanvitām
analyzed: tām upetya nirānandām duḥkha śoka samanvitām
translated: Approaching her, who was without joy, full of sorrow and grief,

original: parivārya vyatiṣṭhanta pāṇḍavāḥ sahakeśavāḥ
analyzed: parivārya vyatiṣṭhanta pāṇḍavāḥ saha keśavāḥ
translated: the Pandavas, together with Keshava, surrounded her and stood there.

original: tato rājñābhyanujñāto bhīmaseno mahābalaḥ
analyzed: tatas rājñā abhyanujñātaḥ bhīmasenaḥ mahā balaḥ
translated: Then, permitted by the king, the greatly powerful Bhimasena,

original: pradadau tu maṇiṃ divyaṃ vacanaṃ cedam abravīt
analyzed: pradadau tu maṇim divyam vacanam ca idam abravīt
translated: And gave her the divine jewel and spoke these words:

original: ayaṃ bhadre tava maṇiḥ putrahantā jitaḥ sa te
analyzed: ayam bhadre tava maṇiḥ putra hantā jitaḥ sa te
translated: This is your jewel, O blessed one, the slayer of your sons is vanquished by you.

original: uttiṣṭha śokam utsṛjya kṣatradharmam anusmara
analyzed: uttiṣṭha śokam utsṛjya kṣatra dharmam anusmara
translated: Rise up, casting off your grief, remember the duty of a Kshatriya.

original: prayāṇe vāsudevasya śamārtham asitekṣaṇe
analyzed: prayāṇe vāsudevasya śama artham asita īkṣaṇe
translated: When Vasudeva was departing, O dark-eyed one, for the sake of peace,

original: yāny uktāni tvayā bhīru vākyāni madhughātinaḥ
analyzed: yāni uktāni tvayā bhīru vākyāni madhughātinaḥ
translated: The words that were spoken by you, O timid one, by the slayer of Madhu,

original: naiva me patayaḥ santi na putrā bhrātaro na ca
analyzed: na eva me patayaḥ santi na putrāḥ bhrātaraḥ na ca
translated: I have no husbands, no sons, no brothers,

original: naiva tvam api govinda śamam icchati rājani🔽uktavaty asi dhīrāṇi vākyāni puruṣottamam
analyzed: nā eva tvam api govinda śamam icchati rājani  uktavatī asi dhīrāṇi vākyāni puruṣottamam
translated: Nor do you, O Govinda, desire peace with the king.🔽You spoke these wise words to the best of men,

original: kṣatradharmānurūpāṇi tāni saṃsmartum arhasi
analyzed: kṣatra dharma anurūpāṇi tāni saṃsmartum arhasi
translated: You should remember those words befitting the duty of a Kshatriya.

original: hato duryodhanaḥ pāpo rājyasya paripanthakaḥ
analyzed: hataḥ duryodhanaḥ pāpaḥ rājyasya paripanthakaḥ
translated: The wicked Duryodhana, the obstacle to the kingdom, has been killed.

original: duḥśāsanasya rudhiraṃ pītaṃ visphurato mayā
analyzed: duḥśāsanasya rudhiram pītam visphurataḥ mayā
translated: The blood of Duhshasana was drunk by me while he was trembling.

original: vairasya gatam ānṛṇyaṃ na sma vācyā vivakṣatām
analyzed: vairasya gatam ānṛṇyam na sma vācyāḥ vivakṣatām
translated: The enmity has been discharged, the vow of the speakers should not be uttered.

original: jitvā mukto droṇaputro brāhmaṇyād gauraveṇa ca
analyzed: jitvā muktaḥ droṇaputraḥ brāhmaṇyāt gauraveṇa ca
translated: The son of Drona was released after being defeated, out of respect for his being a Brahmana.

original: yaśo 'sya pātitaṃ devi śarīraṃ tv avaśeṣitam
analyzed: yaśaḥ sya pātitam devi śarīram tu avaśeṣitam
translated: His fame has been destroyed, O Goddess, only his body remains.

original: viyojitaś ca maṇinā nyāsitaś cāyudhaṃ bhuvi
analyzed: viyojitaḥ ca maṇinā nyāsitaḥ ca āyudham bhuvi
translated: He has been separated from the jewel and his weapon has been laid down on the ground.

original: draupady uvāca
analyzed: draupadī uvāca
translated: Draupadi said:

original: kevalānṛṇyam āptāsmi guruputro gurur mama
analyzed: kevala anṛṇyam āptā asmi guru putraḥ guruḥ mama
translated: I have repaid my debt to him alone. The son of my preceptor is my preceptor.

original: śirasy etaṃ maṇiṃ rājā pratibadhnātu bhārata
analyzed: śirasi etam maṇim rājā pratibadhnātu bhārata
translated: Let the king place this gem on his head, O Bharata.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: taṃ gṛhītvā tato rājā śirasy evākarot tadā
analyzed: tam gṛhītvā tatas rājā śirasi eva akarot tadā
translated: Then the king took it and placed it on his head,

original: guror ucchiṣṭam ity eva draupadyā vacanād api
analyzed: guroḥ ucchiṣṭam iti eva draupadyāḥ vacanāt api
translated: even though it was the leavings of his preceptor, at the words of Draupadi.

original: tato divyaṃ maṇivaraṃ śirasā dhārayan prabhuḥ
analyzed: tatas divyam maṇi varam śirasā dhārayan prabhuḥ
translated: Then the lord, wearing that excellent celestial gem on his head,

original: śuśubhe sa mahārājaḥ sacandra iva parvataḥ
analyzed: śuśubhe sa mahā rājaḥ sa candraḥ iva parvataḥ
translated: shone forth, O great king, like a mountain with the moon on it.

original: uttasthau putraśokārtā tataḥ kṛṣṇā manasvinī
analyzed: uttasthau putra śoka ārtā tatas kṛṣṇā manasvinī
translated: Then the high-minded Krishna, afflicted with grief for her sons, rose up.

original: kṛṣṇaṃ cāpi mahābāhuṃ paryapṛcchata dharmarāṭ
analyzed: kṛṣṇam ca api mahā bāhum paryapṛcchata dharmarāj
translated: And the righteous king also asked about the mighty-armed Krishna.

original: vaiśaṃpāyana uvāca
analyzed: vaiśaṃpāyanaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaishampayana said:

original: hateṣu sarvasainyeṣu sauptike tai rathais tribhiḥ
analyzed: hateṣu sarva sainyeṣu sauptike taiḥ rathaiḥ tribhiḥ
translated: When all the troops had been killed in the night by those three charioteers,

original: śocan yudhiṣṭhiro rājā dāśārham idam abravīt🔽kathaṃ nu kṛṣṇa pāpena kṣudreṇākliṣṭakarmaṇā
analyzed: śocan yudhiṣṭhiraḥ rājā dāśārham idam abravīt  katham nu kṛṣṇa pāpena kṣudreṇa akliṣṭa karmaṇā
translated: king Yudhishthira, grieving, said this to Dasharha Krishna:

original: drauṇinā nihatāḥ sarve mama putrā mahārathāḥ🔽tathā kṛtāstrā vikrāntāḥ sahasraśatayodhinaḥ
analyzed: drauṇinā nihatāḥ sarve mama putrāḥ mahā rathāḥ  tathā kṛtāstrāḥ vikrāntāḥ sahasra śata yodhinaḥ
translated: How is it, O Krishna, that all my mighty charioteer sons have been killed by the sinful, contemptible, and unwearied Drona's son?

original: drupadasyātmajāś caiva droṇaputreṇa pātitāḥ
analyzed: drupadasya ātmajāḥ ca eva droṇaputreṇa pātitāḥ
translated: And so also the sons of Drupada, skilled in weapons, powerful, and able to fight with hundreds and thousands, have been brought down by Drona's son?

original: yasya droṇo maheṣvāso na prādād āhave mukham
analyzed: yasya droṇaḥ mahā iṣvāsaḥ na prādāt āhave mukham
translated: Whose face in battle the great archer Drona did not give up,

original: taṃ jaghne rathināṃ śreṣṭhaṃ dhṛṣṭadyumnaṃ kathaṃ nu saḥ
analyzed: tam jaghne rathinām śreṣṭham dhṛṣṭadyumnam katham nu saḥ
translated: How did he kill that best of charioteers, Dhrishtadyumna?

original: kiṃ nu tena kṛtaṃ karma tathāyuktaṃ nararṣabha
analyzed: kim nu tena kṛtam karma tathā ayuktam nara ṛṣabha
translated: What deed did he do, O bull among men, that was so fitting,

original: yad ekaḥ śibiraṃ sarvam avadhīn no guroḥ sutaḥ
analyzed: yat ekaḥ śibiram sarvam avadhīt naḥ guroḥ sutaḥ
translated: That alone the son of our teacher killed all of us in the camp?

original: vāsudeva uvāca
analyzed: vāsudevaḥ uvāca
translated: Vasudeva said:

original: nūnaṃ sa devadevānām īśvareśvaram avyayam
analyzed: nūnam sa devadevānām īśvara īśvaram avyayam
translated: Surely Drona's son went for refuge to the immutable lord of lords of the gods,

original: jagāma śaraṇaṃ drauṇir ekas tenāvadhīd bahūn
analyzed: jagāma śaraṇam drauṇiḥ ekaḥ tena avadhīt bahūn
translated: And alone he killed many by him.

original: prasanno hi mahādevo dadyād amaratām api
analyzed: prasannaḥ hi mahādevaḥ dadyāt amara tām api
translated: For if Mahadeva is pleased, he would even grant immortality.

original: vīryaṃ ca giriśo dadyād yenendram api śātayet
analyzed: vīryam ca giriśaḥ dadyāt yena indram api śātayet
translated: And Girisha would grant valor by which one could even defeat Indra.

original: vedāhaṃ hi mahādevaṃ tattvena bharatarṣabha
analyzed: veda aham hi mahādevam tattvena bharata ṛṣabha
translated: For I know Mahadeva truly, O best of the Bharata lineage,

original: yāni cāsya purāṇāni karmāṇi vividhāny uta
analyzed: yāni ca asya purāṇāni karmāṇi vividhāni uta
translated: And also the various deeds he has done in the past.

original: ādir eṣa hi bhūtānāṃ madhyam antaś ca bhārata
analyzed: ādiḥ eṣa hi bhūtānām madhyam antaḥ ca bhārata
translated: He is the beginning, the middle and the end of beings, O Bharata.

original: viceṣṭate jagac cedaṃ sarvam asyaiva karmaṇā
analyzed: viceṣṭate jagat ca idam sarvam asya eva karmaṇā
translated: And this entire world moves by his action alone.

original: evaṃ sisṛkṣur bhūtāni dadarśa prathamaṃ vibhuḥ
analyzed: evam sisṛkṣuḥ bhūtāni dadarśa prathamam vibhuḥ
translated: Thus, the lord, desiring to create beings, first saw

original: pitāmaho 'bravīc cainaṃ bhūtāni sṛja māciram
analyzed: pitāmahaḥ bravīt ca enam bhūtāni sṛja māciram
translated: The grandfather said to him, Create beings, do not delay.

original: harikeśas tathety uktvā bhūtānāṃ doṣadarśivān
analyzed: harikeśaḥ tathā iti uktvā bhūtānām doṣa darśivān
translated: Harikesha, having said So be it, seeing the faults of beings,

original: dīrghakālaṃ tapas tepe magno 'mbhasi mahātapāḥ
analyzed: dīrgha kālam tapaḥ tepe magnaḥ mbhasi mahā tapāḥ
translated: For a long time, he performed austerities, immersed in the water, the great ascetic.

original: sumahāntaṃ tataḥ kālaṃ pratīkṣyainaṃ pitāmahaḥ
analyzed: su mahāntam tatas kālam pratīkṣya enam pitāmahaḥ
translated: Then, the Grandfather, having waited for a very long time,

original: sraṣṭāraṃ sarvabhūtānāṃ sasarja manasāparam
analyzed: sraṣṭāram sarva bhūtānām sasarja manasā aparam
translated: created another creator of all beings, through his mind.

original: so 'bravīt pitaraṃ dṛṣṭvā giriśaṃ magnam ambhasi
analyzed: saḥ bravīt pitaram dṛṣṭvā giriśam magnam ambhasi
translated: Seeing his father Giriśa immersed in the water, he said:

original: yadi me nāgrajas tv anyas tataḥ srakṣyāmy ahaṃ prajāḥ
analyzed: yadi me na agrajaḥ tu anyaḥ tatas srakṣyāmi aham prajāḥ
translated: If I have no elder brother, then I shall create beings.

original: tam abravīt pitā nāsti tvad anyaḥ puruṣo 'grajaḥ
analyzed: tam abravīt pitā na asti tvat anyaḥ puruṣaḥ grajaḥ
translated: His father said to him, There is no man elder than you.

original: sthāṇur eṣa jale magno visrabdhaḥ kuru vai kṛtim
analyzed: sthāṇuḥ eṣa jale magnaḥ visrabdhaḥ kuru vai kṛtim
translated: This Sthāṇu is immersed in the water. Be confident and do your duty.

original: sa bhūtāny asṛjat sapta dakṣādīṃs tu prajāpatīn
analyzed: sa bhūtāni asṛjat sapta dakṣa ādīn tu prajāpatīn
translated: He created the seven Prajāpatis beginning with Dakṣa,

original: yair imaṃ vyakarot sarvaṃ bhūtagrāmaṃ caturvidham🔽tāḥ sṛṣṭamātrāḥ kṣudhitāḥ prajāḥ sarvāḥ prajāpatim
analyzed: yaiḥ imam vyakarot sarvam bhūta grāmam caturvidham  tāḥ sṛṣṭa mātrāḥ kṣudhitāḥ prajāḥ sarvāḥ prajāpatim
translated: by whom this entire fourfold group of beings was created.🔽As soon as they were created, all the hungry beings

original: bibhakṣayiṣavo rājan sahasā prādravaṃs tadā
analyzed: bibhakṣayiṣavaḥ rājan sahasā prādravan tadā
translated: suddenly rushed towards Prajāpati, O king, desiring to devour him.

original: sa bhakṣyamāṇas trāṇārthī pitāmaham upādravat
analyzed: sa bhakṣyamāṇaḥ trāṇa arthī pitāmaham upādravat
translated: Being devoured, he sought protection and ran to the Grandfather.

original: ābhyo māṃ bhagavān pātu vṛttir āsāṃ vidhīyatām
analyzed: ābhyaḥ mām bhagavān pātu vṛttiḥ āsām vidhīyatām
translated: May the Lord protect me from them. May a means of subsistence be provided for them.

original: tatas tābhyo dadāv annam oṣadhīḥ sthāvarāṇi ca
analyzed: tatas tābhyaḥ dadau annam oṣadhīḥ sthāvarāṇi ca
translated: Then he gave them food, herbs, and plants.

original: jaṅgamāni ca bhūtāni durbalāni balīyasām🔽vihitānnāḥ prajās tās tu jagmus tuṣṭā yathāgatam
analyzed: jaṅgamāni ca bhūtāni durbalāni balīyasām  vihita annāḥ prajāḥ tāḥ tu jagmuḥ tuṣṭāḥ yathāgatam
translated: The weak creatures among the mobile beings were devoured by the stronger ones.🔽The people, who were provided with food, went away satisfied, each to his own place.

original: tato vavṛdhire rājan prītimatyaḥ svayoniṣu🔽bhūtagrāme vivṛddhe tu tuṣṭe lokagurāv api
analyzed: tatas vavṛdhire rājan prītimatyaḥ sva yoniṣu  bhūta grāme vivṛddhe tu tuṣṭe lokagurau api
translated: Then, O king, they grew, being well-disposed towards their own wombs.🔽When the groups of beings had grown and the preceptor of the people was also satisfied,

original: udatiṣṭhaj jalāj jyeṣṭhaḥ prajāś cemā dadarśa saḥ
analyzed: udatiṣṭhat jalāt jyeṣṭhaḥ prajāḥ ca imāḥ dadarśa saḥ
translated: the eldest one rose from the water and saw these people.

original: bahurūpāḥ prajā dṛṣṭvā vivṛddhāḥ svena tejasā
analyzed: bahu rūpāḥ prajāḥ dṛṣṭvā vivṛddhāḥ svena tejasā
translated: Seeing the people grown with their own energy in many forms,

original: cukrodha bhagavān rudro liṅgaṃ svaṃ cāpy avidhyata
analyzed: cukrodha bhagavān rudraḥ liṅgam svam ca api avidhyata
translated: the revered Rudra became angry and pierced his own penis.

original: tat praviddhaṃ tadā bhūmau tathaiva pratyatiṣṭhata
analyzed: tat praviddham tadā bhūmau tathā eva pratyatiṣṭhata
translated: That was thrown down on the ground and stood there as it was.

original: tam uvācāvyayo brahmā vacobhiḥ śamayann iva
analyzed: tam uvāca avyayaḥ brahmā vacobhiḥ śamayan iva
translated: Then the imperishable Brahma spoke to him, as if pacifying him with words:

original: kiṃ kṛtaṃ salile śarva cirakālaṃ sthitena te
analyzed: kim kṛtam salile śarva cira kālam sthitena te
translated: What have you done, O Sharva, by staying in the water for a long time?

original: kimarthaṃ caitad utpāṭya bhūmau liṅgaṃ praveritam
analyzed: kimartham ca etat utpāṭya bhūmau liṅgam praveritam
translated: For what purpose have you uprooted this and thrown down the penis on the ground?

original: so 'bravīj jātasaṃrambhas tadā lokagurur gurum
analyzed: saḥ bravīt jāta saṃrambhaḥ tadā lokaguruḥ gurum
translated: Then the preceptor of the people, filled with rage, spoke to his preceptor:

original: prajāḥ sṛṣṭāḥ pareṇemāḥ kiṃ kariṣyāmy anena vai
analyzed: prajāḥ sṛṣṭāḥ pareṇa imāḥ kim kariṣyāmi anena vai
translated: These people have been created by the Supreme. What shall I do with this?

original: tapasādhigataṃ cānnaṃ prajārthaṃ me pitāmaha
analyzed: tapasā adhigatam ca annam prajā artham me pitāmaha
translated: O grandfather, the food obtained by me through austerities is for the sake of people.

original: oṣadhyaḥ parivarteran yathaiva satataṃ prajāḥ
analyzed: oṣadhyaḥ parivarteran yathā eva satatam prajāḥ
translated: The herbs will always revolve like the people.

original: evam uktvā tu saṃkruddho jagāma vimanā bhavaḥ
analyzed: evam uktvā tu saṃkruddhaḥ jagāma vimanāḥ bhavaḥ
translated: Having said this, the angry Bhava left, his mind disturbed.

original: girer muñjavataḥ pādaṃ tapas taptuṃ mahātapāḥ
analyzed: gireḥ muñjavataḥ pādam tapaḥ taptum mahā tapāḥ
translated: The great ascetic went to the foot of the Munjavat mountain to perform austerities.

original: vāsudeva uvāca
analyzed: vāsudevaḥ uvāca
translated: Vasudeva said:

original: tato devayuge 'tīte devā vai samakalpayan
analyzed: tatas deva yuge tīte devāḥ vai samakalpayan
translated: Then, after the age of the gods had passed, the gods together devised

original: yajñaṃ vedapramāṇena vidhivad yaṣṭum īpsavaḥ
analyzed: yajñam veda pramāṇena vidhivat yaṣṭum īpsavaḥ
translated: to perform a sacrifice according to the authority of the Vedas, as prescribed, desiring to worship.

original: kalpayām āsur avyagrā deśān yajñocitāṃs tataḥ
analyzed: kalpayām āsuḥ avyagrāḥ deśān yajña ucitān tatas
translated: They calmly designated the places suitable for the sacrifice,

original: bhāgārhā devatāś caiva yajñiyaṃ dravyam eva ca
analyzed: bhāga arhāḥ devatāḥ ca eva yajñiyam dravyam eva ca
translated: and the gods worthy of a share, and the sacrificial substances themselves.

original: tā vai rudram ajānantyo yāthātathyena devatāḥ
analyzed: tāḥ vai rudram a jānantyaḥ yāthātathyena devatāḥ
translated: Those gods, not knowing Rudra as he truly is,

original: nākalpayanta devasya sthāṇor bhāgaṃ narādhipa🔽so 'kalpyamāne bhāge tu kṛttivāsā makhe 'maraiḥ
analyzed: na akalpayanta devasya sthāṇoḥ bhāgam narādhipa  saḥ kalpyamāne bhāge tu kṛttivāsāḥ makhe maraiḥ
translated: did not designate a share for the god Sthanu, O lord of men.🔽When a share was not designated for him in the sacrifice by the immortals, the one clad in skin

original: tarasā bhāgam anvicchan dhanur ādau sasarja ha
analyzed: tarasā bhāgam anvicchan dhanuḥ ādau sasarja ha
translated: desiring to forcibly obtain a share, first took up a bow.

original: lokayajñaḥ kriyāyajño gṛhayajñaḥ sanātanaḥ
translated: The sacrifice of the worlds, the sacrifice of action, the eternal sacrifice of the home,

original: pañcabhūtamayo yajño nṛyajñaś caiva pañcamaḥ
analyzed: pañcabhūta mayaḥ yajñaḥ nṛyajñaḥ ca eva pañcamaḥ
translated: the sacrifice consisting of the five elements, and the sacrifice of men as the fifth.

original: lokayajñena yajñaiṣī kapardī vidadhe dhanuḥ
analyzed: loka yajñena yajña eṣī kapardī vidadhe dhanuḥ
translated: Desiring to sacrifice with the sacrifice of the worlds, Kapardin fashioned a bow.

original: dhanuḥ sṛṣṭam abhūt tasya pañcakiṣkupramāṇataḥ
analyzed: dhanuḥ sṛṣṭam abhūt tasya pañca kiṣku pramāṇataḥ
translated: When the bow was created, it was five cubits long.

original: vaṣaṭkāro 'bhavaj jyā tu dhanuṣas tasya bhārata
analyzed: vaṣaṭkāraḥ bhavat jyā tu dhanuṣaḥ tasya bhārata
translated: The sound of vashatkara became the bowstring of that bow, O Bharata.

original: yajñāṅgāni ca catvāri tasya saṃhanane 'bhavan
analyzed: yajñāṅgāni ca catvāri tasya saṃhanane bhavan
translated: And the four limbs of the sacrifice became the joints of that bow.

original: tataḥ kruddho mahādevas tad upādāya kārmukam
analyzed: tatas kruddhaḥ mahādevaḥ tat upādāya kārmukam
translated: Then the enraged Mahadeva, taking up that bow,

original: ājagāmātha tatraiva yatra devāḥ samījire
analyzed: ājagāma atha tatra eva yatra devāḥ samījire
translated: came to the very place where the gods were performing the sacrifice.

original: tam āttakārmukaṃ dṛṣṭvā brahmacāriṇam avyayam
analyzed: tam ātta kārmukam dṛṣṭvā brahmacāriṇam avyayam
translated: Seeing that immutable Brahmacharin with the bow drawn,

original: vivyathe pṛthivī devī parvatāś ca cakampire
analyzed: vivyathe pṛthivī devī parvatāḥ ca cakampire
translated: the goddess Earth was pained and the mountains trembled.

original: na vavau pavanaś caiva nāgnir jajvāla caidhitaḥ
analyzed: na vavau pavanaḥ ca eva na agniḥ jajvāla ca edhitaḥ
translated: The wind did not blow, and the kindled fire did not blaze,

original: vyabhramac cāpi saṃvignaṃ divi nakṣatramaṇḍalam
analyzed: vyabhramat ca api saṃvignam divi nakṣatra maṇḍalam
translated: and the constellation in the sky, agitated and alarmed, wandered.

original: na babhau bhāskaraś cāpi somaḥ śrīmuktamaṇḍalaḥ
analyzed: na babhau bhāskaraḥ ca api somaḥ śrī mukta maṇḍalaḥ
translated: The sun did not shine, and the moon, with its disc freed from the mist,

original: timireṇākulaṃ sarvam ākāśaṃ cābhavad vṛtam🔽abhibhūtās tato devā viṣayān na prajajñire
analyzed: timireṇa ākulam sarvam ākāśam ca abhavat vṛtam  abhibhūtāḥ tatas devāḥ viṣayān na prajajñire
translated: and the entire sky, enveloped in darkness, became confused.🔽Then the gods, being overpowered, did not understand the objects [of perception].

original: na pratyabhāc ca yajñas tān vedā babhraṃśire tadā
analyzed: na pratyabhāt ca yajñaḥ tān vedāḥ babhraṃśire tadā
translated: The sacrifice did not shine, and the Vedas were then lost.

original: tataḥ sa yajñaṃ raudreṇa vivyādha hṛdi patriṇā
analyzed: tatas sa yajñam raudreṇa vivyādha hṛdi patriṇā
translated: Then he pierced the sacrifice in the heart with a feathered arrow.

original: apakrāntas tato yajño mṛgo bhūtvā sapāvakaḥ
analyzed: apakrāntaḥ tatas yajñaḥ mṛgaḥ bhūtvā sa pāvakaḥ
translated: Then the sacrifice, having become a deer with fire, departed.

original: sa tu tenaiva rūpeṇa divaṃ prāpya vyarocata
analyzed: sa tu tena eva rūpeṇa divam prāpya vyarocata
translated: It attained heaven in that very form and shone.

original: anvīyamāno rudreṇa yudhiṣṭhira nabhastale
analyzed: anvīyamānaḥ rudreṇa yudhiṣṭhira nabhastale
translated: O Yudhishthira, Rudra followed him in the sky.

original: apakrānte tato yajñe saṃjñā na pratyabhāt surān
analyzed: apakrānte tatas yajñe saṃjñā na pratyabhāt surān
translated: When the sacrifice was thus interrupted, the gods lost their senses.

original: naṣṭasaṃjñeṣu deveṣu na prajñāyata kiṃ cana
analyzed: naṣṭa saṃjñeṣu deveṣu na prajñāyata kim cana
translated: When the gods lost their senses, nothing could be discerned.

original: tryambakaḥ savitur bāhū bhagasya nayane tathā
analyzed: tryambakaḥ savituḥ bāhū bhagasya nayane tathā
translated: The three-eyed one angrily cut off the arms of Savita, the eyes of Bhaga,

original: pūṣṇaś ca daśanān kruddho dhanuṣkoṭyā vyaśātayat
analyzed: pūṣṇaḥ ca daśanān kruddhaḥ dhanuṣkoṭyā vyaśātayat
translated: and the teeth of Pushan with the tip of his bow.

original: prādravanta tato devā yajñāṅgāni ca sarvaśaḥ
analyzed: prādravanta tatas devāḥ yajña aṅgāni ca sarvaśas
translated: Then the gods and all the parts of the sacrifice fled in all directions.

original: ke cit tatraiva ghūrṇanto gatāsava ivābhavan
analyzed: ke cit tatra eva ghūrṇantaḥ gatāsavaḥ iva abhavan
translated: Some of them became as if dead, reeling right there.

original: sa tu vidrāvya tat sarvaṃ śitikaṇṭho 'vahasya ca
analyzed: sa tu vidrāvya tat sarvam śitikaṇṭhaḥ vahasya ca
translated: Having thus routed them all and laughed, the blue-throated one

original: avaṣṭabhya dhanuṣkoṭiṃ rurodha vibudhāṃs tataḥ
analyzed: avaṣṭabhya dhanuṣkoṭim rurodha vibudhān tatas
translated: blocked the gods with the tip of his bow.

original: tato vāg amarair uktā jyāṃ tasya dhanuṣo 'cchinat
analyzed: tatas vāc amaraiḥ uktā jyām tasya chinat
translated: Then a voice was heard by the immortals, which cut the string of his bow.

original: atha tat sahasā rājaṃś chinnajyaṃ visphurad dhanuḥ
analyzed: atha tat sahasā rājan chinna jyam visphurat dhanuḥ
translated: Then, O king, that bow, with its string cut, quivered suddenly.

original: tato vidhanuṣaṃ devā devaśreṣṭham upāgaman🔽śaraṇaṃ saha yajñena prasādaṃ cākarot prabhuḥ
analyzed: tatas devāḥ deva śreṣṭham upāgaman  śaraṇam saha yajñena prasādam ca akarot prabhuḥ
translated: Then the gods, with the sacrifice, approached the best of the gods,🔽and the lord was appeased.

original: tataḥ prasanno bhagavān prāsyat kopaṃ jalāśaye
analyzed: tatas prasannaḥ bhagavān prāsyat kopam jalāśaye
translated: Then the blessed one, having become pleased, cast his anger into the water.

original: sa jalaṃ pāvako bhūtvā śoṣayaty aniśaṃ prabho
analyzed: sa jalam pāvakaḥ bhūtvā śoṣayati aniśam prabho
translated: O lord, that fire, becoming water, incessantly dries it up.

original: bhagasya nayane caiva bāhū ca savitus tathā
analyzed: bhagasya nayane ca eva bāhū ca savituḥ tathā
translated: The eyes of Bhaga and the arms of Savita,

original: prādāt pūṣṇaś ca daśanān punar yajñaṃ ca pāṇḍava
analyzed: prādāt pūṣṇaḥ ca daśanān punar yajñam ca pāṇḍava
translated: And the teeth of Pushan, and the sacrifice again, O Pandava.

original: tataḥ sarvam idaṃ svasthaṃ babhūva punar eva ha
analyzed: tatas sarvam idam svastham babhūva punar eva ha
translated: Then everything here became well again.

original: sarvāṇi ca havīṃṣy asya devā bhāgam akalpayan
analyzed: sarvāṇi ca havīṃṣi asya devāḥ bhāgam akalpayan
translated: And all the oblations assigned a share to him.

original: tasmin kruddhe 'bhavat sarvam asvasthaṃ bhuvanaṃ vibho
analyzed: tasmin kruddhe bhavat sarvam asvastham bhuvanam vibho
translated: When he was angry, O lord, the entire universe became unwell,

original: prasanne ca punaḥ svasthaṃ sa prasanno 'sya vīryavān
analyzed: prasanne ca punar svastham sa vīryavān
translated: And when he was pleased again, it became well. He, the powerful one, was pleased.

original: tatas te nihatāḥ sarve tava putrā mahārathāḥ
analyzed: tatas te nihatāḥ sarve tava putrāḥ mahā rathāḥ
translated: Then all your sons, the great warriors, were killed,

original: anye ca bahavaḥ śūrāḥ pāñcālāś ca sahānugāḥ
analyzed: anye ca bahavaḥ śūrāḥ pāñcālāḥ ca saha anugāḥ
translated: And many other heroes, the Panchalas with their followers.

original: na tan manasi kartavyaṃ na hi tad drauṇinā kṛtam
analyzed: na tat manasi kartavyam na hi tat drauṇinā kṛtam
translated: That should not be kept in mind, for that was not done by Drona's son.

original: mahādevaprasādaḥ sa kuru kāryam anantaram
analyzed: mahādeva prasādaḥ sa kuru kāryam anantaram
translated: That was the grace of Mahadeva. Perform the next task.
